translated: It is also one's own.

original: dge slong aa ji ta la chos gos bzang po cig yod de /
analyzed: dge slong aa ji ta la chos gos bzang po cig yod de /
translated: A monk named Ajita had a good robe.

original: dge slong cig gis mthong nas brku bar byas pa dang / aa dzi tas tshor te bdag gi chos gos kyi gnas su kho'i chos gos gzhag pa dang / dge slong des chos gos de brkus te gud du bltas na bdag gi chos gos yin par gyur pa las bcas te /
analyzed: dge slong cig gis mthong nas brku bar byas pa dang / aa dzi tas tshor te bdag gi chos gos kyi gnas su kho'i chos gos gzhag pa dang / dge slong des chos gos de brkus te gud du bltas na bdag gi chos gos yin par gyur pa las bcas te /
translated: A monk saw it and was about to steal it, but Ajita noticed and put his robe in the monk's place. The monk stole that robe and looked elsewhere, but it was his own robe.

original: bdag gi rdzas la gzhan gyi nor du bsams te brkus na yang sbom po /
analyzed: bdag gi rdzas la gzhan gyi nor du bsams te brkus na yang sbom po /
translated: If one steals one's own property, thinking it is the property of another, it is also a serious offense.

original: rgyud gzhan gyi yang ngo //
analyzed: rgyud gzhan gyi yang ngo //
translated: It is also the continuum of another.

original: mi ma gtogs pa lam rgyud bzhi gang yang rung ste nor rdzas brkus na sbom po /
analyzed: mi ma gtogs pa lam rgyud bzhi gang yang rung ste nor rdzas brkus na sbom po /
translated: If one steals any of the four types of property of another person, it is a serious offense.

original: bdag gir ma byas kyang /
analyzed: bdag gir ma byas kyang /
translated: Even if one does not take possession of it,

original: bdag gi nor du bya ba'i phyir ma brkus kyang 'di rnams ltar byas na sbom po /🔽sbas sam / nor chud gzan cing med par bya ba'i phyir sa'i nang la sogs par sbas pa dang / ma rung bar byas pa dang / nor rdzas mer bsregs sam /
analyzed: bdag gi nor du bya ba'i phyir ma brkus kyang 'di rnams ltar byas na sbom po / sbas sam / nor chud gzan cing med par bya ba'i phyir sa'i nang la sogs par sbas pa dang / ma rung bar byas pa dang / nor rdzas mer bsregs sam /
translated: Even if one does not steal for the sake of making it one's own, it is a serious offense to do as they do.🔽Concealed means that one conceals it in the ground, etc., in order to waste or destroy the wealth.

original: chu la bskur ram dral bcom pa la sogs pa chud gzan pa @52a * //🔽dang ; bcings pa /
analyzed: chu la bskur ram dral bcom pa la sogs pa chud gzan pa @52a * // dang ; bcings pa /
translated: Wasted means that one wastes wealth by burning it, throwing it in water, smashing it, etc.🔽Bound means that one binds or ties it up in order to prevent the owner of the wealth from encountering it.

original: nor bdag dang mi phrad par bya ba'i phyir gang rta lta bu bcings shing btags pa lta bu dang / 'phrol ba la sogs pa dang / gngag rta la sogs pa btags pa las stor cing med par bya ba'i phyir 'phrol te 'khyam du btang ba dang /
analyzed: nor bdag dang mi phrad par bya ba'i phyir gang rta lta bu bcings shing btags pa lta bu dang / 'phrol ba la sogs pa dang / gngag rta la sogs pa btags pa las stor cing med par bya ba'i phyir 'phrol te 'khyam du btang ba dang /
translated: It is also the same for those who untie it, and for those who let loose horses, etc., that are tied up in order to lose them and make them disappear.

original: phral ba yang ngo ;
analyzed: phral ba yang ngo ;
translated: It is also the same for those who untie them.

original: /'di rnams lta bu la sogs pa nor bdag dang nor du phral ba'i phyir chud gzan pa'i phyir byas pa med par byas pa ni sbom po'o //
analyzed: /'di rnams lta bu la sogs pa nor bdag dang nor du phral ba'i phyir chud gzan pa'i phyir byas pa med par byas pa ni sbom po'o //
translated: To do any of these in order to waste or destroy the wealth and prevent the owner of the wealth from encountering it is a serious offense.

original: nyes byas pa ni snying rje'i sems kyis btang na'o //
analyzed: nyes byas pa ni snying rje'i sems kyis btang na'o //
translated: It is a wrong doing if one releases them with a compassionate mind.

original: ri dags dang gcan gzan rnyi dang / rgya la zin pa dang phyugs la sogs pa bsad par btags shing bcings pa la /
analyzed: ri dags dang gcan gzan rnyi dang / rgya la zin pa dang phyugs la sogs pa bsad par btags shing bcings pa la /
translated: If one releases deer and wild animals caught in traps and snares, and if one releases cattle and so on that are bound and are to be killed,

original: ri dags la sogs pa dang bdag po gnyis ka la snying rje'i phyir thug thub tu btang ba ni nyes byas /
analyzed: ri dags la sogs pa dang bdag po gnyis ka la snying rje'i phyir thug thub tu btang ba ni nyes byas /
translated: it is a wrong doing if one does so out of compassion for the deer and so on and their owners.

original: rgya dang rnyi la sogs pa snying rje ba'i sems kyis dral cing btang ba yang nyes byas te /
analyzed: rgya dang rnyi la sogs pa snying rje ba'i sems kyis dral cing btang ba yang nyes byas te /
translated: If one tears up traps and snares and so on with a compassionate mind and releases them, it is also a wrong doing.

original: snying rje la rnam gnyis so //
analyzed: snying rje la rnam gnyis so //
translated: Compassion is of two types.

original: bzlog kyang ma byas pa ma yin /
analyzed: bzlog kyang ma byas pa ma yin /
translated: It is not the case that one does not do it even though one is asked to stop.

original: rkun pos dge slong la rku ba'i rgyus dris pa la /
analyzed: rkun pos dge slong la rku ba'i rgyus dris pa la /
translated: When a thief asks a bhikṣu about the cause of his theft,

original: dge slong gis skyes pa med do /
analyzed: dge slong gis skyes pa med do /
translated: the bhikṣu says, “There is no man.”

original: khyi mi za'o zhes bya ste /🔽rku bar bstan pa'i 'og tu sngar smras pa brdzun bya ste /
analyzed: khyi mi za'o zhes bya ste / rku bar bstan pa'i 'og tu sngar smras pa brdzun bya ste /
translated: “The dog will not eat.”🔽After demonstrating the theft, he says, “Do not steal.”

original: rku ba'i mi rigs so zhes slar bzlog kyang sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rku ba'i mi rigs so zhes slar bzlog kyang sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: Even though he stops the theft, it is a serious transgression.

original: ma reg pa tshun chad sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: ma reg pa tshun chad sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: Up to the point of not touching, it is the preparation of the preparation.

original: nor rku bar bsams nas ner la ma reg tshun chad spom po la sbyor pa ste nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nor rku bar bsams nas ner la ma reg tshun chad spom po la sbyor pa ste nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If one thinks of stealing wealth but does not touch it, it is a serious transgression.

original: ben na gom pa re re zhing ngo //
analyzed: ben na gom pa re re zhing ngo //
translated: If one steals it, it is a downfall for each step one takes.

original: mkhan po lta bus slob ma la chos gos bskur te phyi bzhin du 'brang du bcug pa las /
analyzed: mkhan po lta bus slob ma la chos gos bskur te phyi bzhin du 'brang du bcug pa las /
translated: For example, a preceptor gives a Dharma robe to a disciple and makes him follow behind.

original: slob ma des rku bar bsams te /
analyzed: slob ma des rku bar bsams te /
translated: If the disciple thinks of stealing it,

original: ben na gom pa du bor ba re re zhing nyes byas re rer 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ben na gom pa du bor ba re re zhing nyes byas re rer 'gyur ro //
translated: it is a serious transgression for each step he takes.

original: de'i rgyud na sems can so so las so //
analyzed: de'i rgyud na sems can so so las so //
translated: The sentient beings in his continuum are individual.

original: mi gnyis gsum yan chad mang po zhig gi nor la dge slong cig gis brkus na mi de rnams kyi so so'i nor skal las rin thang tshang na ming du yod pa bzhin du nyes byas dang / sbom po re re yang yod /
analyzed: mi gnyis gsum yan chad mang po zhig gi nor la dge slong cig gis brkus na mi de rnams kyi so so'i nor skal las rin thang tshang na ming du yod pa bzhin du nyes byas dang / sbom po re re yang yod /
translated: If a single monk steals the wealth of many people, two or three or more, if the value is complete for each of those people, there is a serious transgression and a downfall for each, just as if there were a name for each.

original: phas pham pa ni spyir gcig tu zad de sdig ni mi du yod pa bzhin du phas pham pa re re'i sdig yod /
analyzed: phas pham pa ni spyir gcig tu zad de sdig ni mi du yod pa bzhin du phas pham pa re re'i sdig yod /
translated: As for the defeating offense, in general it is just one, but the evil is as many as there are people, and there is a defeating offense for each.

original: rin thang ma tshang na spom po dang nyes byas re re yod du zad do //
analyzed: rin thang ma tshang na spom po dang nyes byas re re yod du zad do //
translated: If the value is not complete, then there is a serious violation and a simple offense for each.

original: phur pa las bkrol ba ni grul reg pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phur pa las bkrol ba ni grul reg pa ma yin no //
translated: Unmooring a boat is not touching.

original: gru brku ba'i phyir nyag thag phur pa las bkrol ba ni gru la reg pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gru brku ba'i phyir nyag thag phur pa las bkrol ba ni gru la reg pa ma yin te /
translated: Unmooring a boat in order to steal it is not touching the boat.

original: sbom por mi 'gyur gyi nyes byas pa'o //
analyzed: sbom por mi 'gyur gyi nyes byas pa'o //
translated: It is not a serious offense, but a simple offense.

original: khur gyis rku bar der byed cing brkus par @52b na'o ;
analyzed: khur gyis rku bar der byed cing brkus par @52b na'o ;
translated: Stealing a load is the same as that.

original: / snam bu 'am ras sam nor gang yang rung ba las /
analyzed: / snam bu 'am ras sam nor gang yang rung ba las /
translated: Whether it is cloth, cotton, or any other wealth,

original: mang mo zhig khur du drags te rku ba ni brku bar bsams pa'i phyir nyes byas ni gcig tu zad /
analyzed: mang mo zhig khur du drags te rku ba ni brku bar bsams pa'i phyir nyes byas ni gcig tu zad /
translated: if a large amount is too heavy to carry off, then because of the intention to steal, there is only one simple offense.

original: 'dra ba'i phyir skyed cing sdud pa la reg pa re re zhing sbom po re re /🔽drags zin nas 'degs par reg pa'i tshe yang sbom po gcig / bteg ste 'phags na pham par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'dra ba'i phyir skyed cing sdud pa la reg pa re re zhing sbom po re re / drags zin nas 'degs par reg pa'i tshe yang sbom po gcig / bteg ste 'phags na pham par 'gyur /
translated: Because of the similarity, for each time one touches the load, gathering and collecting, there is one serious offense.

original: btogs nas phung por na'o //
analyzed: btogs nas phung por na'o //
translated: When one has finished loading it and touches it to lift it, there is one serious offense. If one lifts it and moves it, one commits a defeating offense.🔽If one steals it and makes a pile of it,

original: shing tog btogs nas snod du sdud pa'i tshe sdud par reg pa re re la sbom po re re bsdus zin nas bteg par reg pa'i tshe sbom po gcig bteg ste 'phags na pham /
analyzed: shing tog btogs nas snod du sdud pa'i tshe sdud par reg pa re re la sbom po re re bsdus zin nas bteg par reg pa'i tshe sbom po gcig bteg ste 'phags na pham /
translated: When picking fruit and gathering it in a container, for each contact of gathering, there is one coarse. When the fruit is gathered and lifted, if one coarse is lifted and carried off, there is a defeat.

original: nyes byas ni brku bar bsams pa'i phyir gcig tu zad do //
analyzed: nyes byas ni brku bar bsams pa'i phyir gcig tu zad do //
translated: If one thinks of stealing, there is a single offense of wrong conduct.

original: yal ga bkal te bcad pa ni shing tog dang me tog la sogs pa du yod kyang sbom po /
analyzed: yal ga bkal te bcad pa ni shing tog dang me tog la sogs pa du yod kyang sbom po /
translated: If one cuts off a branch, even if there are many fruits, flowers, and so on, there is a coarse.

original: spying ba ni gnas kyi steng nas nor gyi spyi bo nub na'o //
analyzed: spying ba ni gnas kyi steng nas nor gyi spyi bo nub na'o //
translated: If one throws it, when the top of the wealth sinks into the ground,

original: chu dang sa lta bu'i nang du nor brku ba'i phyir sbyor ba ni nor gyi spyi bo nub cing mi snang na pham /
analyzed: chu dang sa lta bu'i nang du nor brku ba'i phyir sbyor ba ni nor gyi spyi bo nub cing mi snang na pham /
translated: if one prepares to steal wealth that is in water or earth, when the top of the wealth sinks and is not visible, there is a defeat.

original: chu'i zhabs su nor song ste chu dang pas steng nas bltar snang ba ni sbom po ste chu'i 'og gi sa'i nang du spyings te mi snang na pham /
analyzed: chu'i zhabs su nor song ste chu dang pas steng nas bltar snang ba ni sbom po ste chu'i 'og gi sa'i nang du spyings te mi snang na pham /
translated: If the wealth goes to the bottom of the water and is visible from above the water, there is a coarse. If it is thrown into the earth below the water and is not visible, there is a defeat.

original: bkur ba'i sems kyis gang 'di nas phyis bkur bar na'o //
analyzed: bkur ba'i sems kyis gang 'di nas phyis bkur bar na'o //
translated: If one thinks of honoring it, it is if one thinks of honoring it later from here.

original: mdo ltag ma ltar sbas te bzhag pa'i tshe mi pham gyi phyis blangs te khyer pa'i tshe pham mo zhes klan ka tshol ba'i phyir mdo 'di 'chad de sba ste bzhag nas phyis blangs te bkur ro zhes bsams su zin kyang sbas pa'i tshe nor mi snang na
analyzed: mdo ltag ma ltar sbas te bzhag pa'i tshe mi pham gyi phyis blangs te khyer pa'i tshe pham mo zhes klan ka tshol ba'i phyir mdo 'di 'chad de sba ste bzhag nas phyis blangs te bkur ro zhes bsams su zin kyang sbas pa'i tshe nor mi snang na
translated: This sutra is explained in order to seek out faults. Even though it is thought that it is hidden and later taken and carried, if the wealth is not seen when hidden,

original: pham par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pham par 'gyur ro //
translated: it is defeated.

original: bshal ba ni thog ma'i gzhi'i mtshams las mjug ma 'das na'o //
analyzed: bshal ba ni thog ma'i gzhi'i mtshams las mjug ma 'das na'o //
translated: If it is washed, it is beyond the boundary of the original basis.

original: nor zhig sa las bshal te rku na gzhi ga la 'dug pa'i nor gyi mtha' ma 'am mjug ma 'dug pa'i mtshams las 'das na pham par 'gyur /
analyzed: nor zhig sa las bshal te rku na gzhi ga la 'dug pa'i nor gyi mtha' ma 'am mjug ma 'dug pa'i mtshams las 'das na pham par 'gyur /
translated: If one steals wealth that has been washed from the ground, if the end or tail of the wealth that is on the basis is beyond the boundary where it is located, it is defeated.

original: de ltar 'gyur ba yang nor 'dug pa'i gzhi la sa'i srubs sam bang rim lta bu'i mtshams med na nor gyi mjug ma'i mtshams 'das na pham /
analyzed: de ltar 'gyur ba yang nor 'dug pa'i gzhi la sa'i srubs sam bang rim lta bu'i mtshams med na nor gyi mjug ma'i mtshams 'das na pham /
translated: If there is no boundary such as a crack in the ground or a step on the basis where the wealth is located, if the end of the wealth is beyond the boundary, it is defeated.

original: yog pa'i nang du chud pa ni der ma yin no //
analyzed: yog pa'i nang du chud pa ni der ma yin no //
translated: It is not included within a fence.

original: nor bshal te rku ba'i 'og na mtshams sam sa sgal zhig yod na nor gyi mjug ma'i mtshams ma 'das kyang sa sgal de 'das pas pham par 'gyur te /
analyzed: nor bshal te rku ba'i 'og na mtshams sam sa sgal zhig yod na nor gyi mjug ma'i mtshams ma 'das kyang sa sgal de 'das pas pham par 'gyur te /
translated: If there is a boundary or a crack in the ground below the stolen property, then even if the end of the property does not pass beyond the boundary, since the crack does pass beyond it, one becomes guilty of a defeating offense.

original: dper na zhing rol gyi steng nas shing rings rku ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na zhing rol gyi steng nas shing rings rku ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like stealing a tall tree on the border of a field.

original: de'i gzugs ni /
analyzed: de'i gzugs ni /
translated: The form of the boundary.

original: mtshams 'das na pham par 'gyur ba'i mtshams kyi gzugs ni 'di rnams lta bu gang yang rung ngo //
analyzed: mtshams 'das na pham par 'gyur ba'i mtshams kyi gzugs ni 'di rnams lta bu gang yang rung ngo //
translated: Any of these forms of a boundary is a boundary beyond which one becomes guilty of a defeating offense:

original: 'phags pa dang / sa skrangs @53a * //
analyzed: 'phags pa dang / sa skrangs @53a * //
translated: a boundary marked by a noble being,🔽a boundary marked by a mound of earth like a blister,🔽a boundary marked by a crack, a boundary marked by a fissure in the earth,🔽a boundary marked by letters, a boundary marked by syllables or words, a boundary marked by a line drawn on the ground,

original: pa lta bu'i bang rim dang / gas pa dang / sa gas pa'i ser kha dang / yi ge dang / yi ge'i 'bru tshig las gcig gi steng du thal ba dang / kha dog dang gzhan dang / kha dog sna tshogs su 'dug pa las gcig las kha dog gzhan gyi steng du thal ba dang /
analyzed: pa lta bu'i bang rim dang / gas pa dang / sa gas pa'i ser kha dang / yi ge dang / yi ge'i 'bru tshig las gcig gi steng du thal ba dang / kha dog dang gzhan dang / kha dog sna tshogs su 'dug pa las gcig las kha dog gzhan gyi steng du thal ba dang /
translated: a boundary marked by color, a boundary marked by a variety of colors,

original: mtshams dang / sa shing la sogs pa'i srubs lta bu dang / rnang sgal lo //
analyzed: mtshams dang / sa shing la sogs pa'i srubs lta bu dang / rnang sgal lo //
translated: a boundary marked by a crack in the ground, a boundary marked by a tree, and so on, and a boundary marked by a crack in the ground like a seam.

original: zhing gi rnang sgal lta bu dang 'di rnams gang yang rung ste bshal ba las mtshams 'das na pham /
analyzed: zhing gi rnang sgal lta bu dang 'di rnams gang yang rung ste bshal ba las mtshams 'das na pham /
translated: If one steals more than the value of a field, a piece of land, or any of these, one commits a defeat.

original: srog chags kyi mu ni tha dad dper mngon na rtsib ma la sogs pa las so //
analyzed: srog chags kyi mu ni tha dad dper mngon na rtsib ma la sogs pa las so //
translated: The boundary of an animal is its individual form, such as a rib.

original: phyugs lta bu la gos g-yogs sam bkal ba las rku na bsnyil tam bshal te /
analyzed: phyugs lta bu la gos g-yogs sam bkal ba las rku na bsnyil tam bshal te /
translated: If one steals cattle, for example, by covering or binding them, one commits a defeat if one steals more than the value of the cattle.

original: phyugs ring na rtsi ba ma'am rul ba dag gi gzugs mngon par snang ba gang yang rung 'das na pham /
analyzed: phyugs ring na rtsi ba ma'am rul ba dag gi gzugs mngon par snang ba gang yang rung 'das na pham /
translated: If the cattle are far away, one commits a defeat if one steals more than the value of the appearance of the cattle, such as a piece of hide or a rotten bone.

original: phyugs tshon po rus pa mi mngon pa ni lus las 'das shing 'phags na pham /
analyzed: phyugs tshon po rus pa mi mngon pa ni lus las 'das shing 'phags na pham /
translated: If the cattle are fat and their bones do not show, one commits a defeat if one steals more than the value of their flesh.

original: gding ba bting ba yang gnas bzhin no //
analyzed: gding ba bting ba yang gnas bzhin no //
translated: A spread-out rug is like a rug that is set out.

original: phying pa'am phyar ba lta bu bting ba'i steng nas bshal te rku na sa la bshal ba'i mtshams dang 'dra bar phyar ba'i srubs sam kha dog tha dad pa'i mtshams 'das na pham /
analyzed: phying pa'am phyar ba lta bu bting ba'i steng nas bshal te rku na sa la bshal ba'i mtshams dang 'dra bar phyar ba'i srubs sam kha dog tha dad pa'i mtshams 'das na pham /
translated: If one steals a rug or blanket by sliding it from under a spread-out rug or blanket, one commits a defeat if one steals more than the value of the spread-out rug or blanket, either by the distance of the gap between the rugs or by the distance of the different color.

original: btsugs pa yang bzhag pa bzhin no //
analyzed: btsugs pa yang bzhag pa bzhin no //
translated: A set-up rug is like a rug that is set out.

original: skye shing ngam mda' 'phangs pa lta bu sa la zug pa zhig las rku na phyung ste sa las 'phags na pham mo //
analyzed: skye shing ngam mda' 'phangs pa lta bu sa la zug pa zhig las rku na phyung ste sa las 'phags na pham mo //
translated: If one steals a tree or an arrow that is stuck in the ground, one commits a defeat if one pulls it out of the ground.

original: gyon pa ni phral na'o //
analyzed: gyon pa ni phral na'o //
translated: If one steals something worn, one commits a defeat if one removes it from the body.

original: gos sam mgo rgyan dang gdu bu la sogs pa lus la thogs pa zhig las rku na lus las phral te 'phags na pham /
analyzed: gos sam mgo rgyan dang gdu bu la sogs pa lus la thogs pa zhig las rku na lus las phral te 'phags na pham /
translated: If one steals clothing, a headdress, bracelets, and so on that are attached to the body, one commits a defeat if one removes them from the body.🔽If one steals a ring, for example, one commits a defeat if one moves it over one knuckle.

original: sor gdub lta bu mdzub mo'i tshigs 'ga' tsam 'das nas mi pham gyi mdzub mo las 'das te 'phags na pham /🔽sho gam ni de'i sa 'das na'o //🔽sho gam gyi rgyud du 'gro ste ;
analyzed: sor gdub lta bu mdzub mo'i tshigs 'ga' tsam 'das nas mi pham gyi mdzub mo las 'das te 'phags na pham / sho gam ni de'i sa 'das na'o // sho gam gyi rgyud du 'gro ste ;
translated: If one steals a toll, one commits a defeat if one passes the toll station.

original: bdag gi nor las sho gam pa dbang bar 'gyur ba zhig mi spyin par bsams te song ba ni sho gam gcod pa'i sa'am mtshams 'das na pham mo //🔽mi ni dus byas te de ste der grub na'o //
analyzed: bdag gi nor las sho gam pa dbang bar 'gyur ba zhig mi spyin par bsams te song ba ni sho gam gcod pa'i sa'am mtshams 'das na pham mo // mi ni dus byas te de ste der grub na'o //
translated: If one intends to travel through a toll station without paying the toll, which is the king’s due, and one passes the toll station, one commits a defeat.🔽If one steals a human being, one commits a defeat if one moves him or her out of the country.

original: mi rku ba ni dus byas ta dus mal du phrad na pham /
analyzed: mi rku ba ni dus byas ta dus mal du phrad na pham /
translated: If one steals a human being, one commits a defeat if one moves him or her out of the country.

original: dus la rnam pa gsum ste gos 'di 'dra ba zhig gyon nas shog shig ces bya ba lta bu dang / nyi tshod 'di tsam na shog shig byas pa dang / shing ngam rdo 'di'i drung du shog shig ces bya ba lta bu gang yang rung ngo //
analyzed: dus la rnam pa gsum ste gos 'di 'dra ba zhig gyon nas shog shig ces bya ba lta bu dang / nyi tshod 'di tsam na shog shig byas pa dang / shing ngam rdo 'di'i drung du shog shig ces bya ba lta bu gang yang rung ngo //
translated: There are three kinds of time: “Come when you are dressed in such and such a way,” “Come at such and such a time,” or “Come to such and such a tree or rock.”

original: bya ni de ste de ltar spur na'o //
analyzed: bya ni de ste de ltar spur na'o //
translated: “If you do” means “if you fly away.”

original: bya rku ba ni rku ba'i sa logs su bskrad spur na 'phur te /
analyzed: bya rku ba ni rku ba'i sa logs su bskrad spur na 'phur te /
translated: If the bird is driven away to a place other than the place of theft, it flies away.

original: 'phags ma thag tu pham /
analyzed: 'phags ma thag tu pham /
translated: As soon as it is gone, one is defeated.

original: rku ba'i gnas @53b ma yin par logs shig tu 'phur ba ni sbom po /
analyzed: rku ba'i gnas @53b ma yin par logs shig tu 'phur ba ni sbom po /
translated: If it flies away to a place other than the place of theft, it is a serious transgression.

original: byol song btags pa las bkrol na'o //
analyzed: byol song btags pa las bkrol na'o //
translated: If it is released from being tethered to an animal.

original: ri dags rnyi las zin pa'am phyugs phur pa la btags pa lta bu rku na ma 'phags kyang bla ste bkrol ma thag tu pham mo //
analyzed: ri dags rnyi las zin pa'am phyugs phur pa la btags pa lta bu rku na ma 'phags kyang bla ste bkrol ma thag tu pham mo //
translated: If it is stolen and the bird is not gone, but is released as soon as it is untied, like a deer caught in a trap or an animal tethered to a stake, one is defeated.

original: khyu las sam bzung ba ni mi snang bar gyur na 'o //
analyzed: khyu las sam bzung ba ni mi snang bar gyur na 'o //
translated: If it is stolen from a herd, one is defeated when it is out of sight.

original: phyugs khyu lta bu las rku na bcings te bzhag kyang rung bkar te ded kyang rung bzung ste khrid kyang phyugs phal mi snang bar gyur na pham mo //
analyzed: phyugs khyu lta bu las rku na bcings te bzhag kyang rung bkar te ded kyang rung bzung ste khrid kyang phyugs phal mi snang bar gyur na pham mo //
translated: If one steals a herd of cattle, it is permissible to bind them and leave them, or to drive them away, or to lead them away. If the majority of the cattle are not seen, there is no defeat.

original: sngags kyis bkug pa ni snang na'o //
analyzed: sngags kyis bkug pa ni snang na'o //
translated: If one summons them with a mantra, there is a defeat if they are seen.

original: sngags byas te rku ba ni sngags kyi mthus nor rang 'ong ba mig sngar snang zhing mthong na pham /
analyzed: sngags byas te rku ba ni sngags kyi mthus nor rang 'ong ba mig sngar snang zhing mthong na pham /
translated: If one steals by means of a mantra, there is a defeat if the wealth that is coming through the power of the mantra is seen and is visible.

original: nor 'ong ngam mi 'ong bya ra bas btsugs te bya ra bas mthong na /
analyzed: nor 'ong ngam mi 'ong bya ra bas btsugs te bya ra bas mthong na /
translated: If one steals after having placed a guard to see if the wealth will come or not,

original: dge slong gis ma mthong yang pham /
analyzed: dge slong gis ma mthong yang pham /
translated: there is a defeat if the guard sees it, even if the bhikṣu does not see it.

original: phyi bzhin du 'gro ba dang / slob ma lta bu la mkhan po'i rdzas shig bskur te phyi bzhin du 'brang ba las rku ba dang / skyel ba ni /
analyzed: phyi bzhin du 'gro ba dang / slob ma lta bu la mkhan po'i rdzas shig bskur te phyi bzhin du 'brang ba las rku ba dang / skyel ba ni /
translated: Stealing that which is sent after one and that which is like a disciple refers to stealing something that was sent to the preceptor and was being followed by a disciple, and stealing something that was sent to be delivered.

original: nor zhig skyel du btang ba las rku ba dang 'di rnam gnyis ltar rku la 'og nas ming gis bshad pa ltar byas na pham par 'gyur te /
analyzed: nor zhig skyel du btang ba las rku ba dang 'di rnam gnyis ltar rku la 'og nas ming gis bshad pa ltar byas na pham par 'gyur te /
translated: If one steals in these two ways, as explained below by their names, there is a defeat.

original: ben tam / rku ba'i tshe ben te 'dug pa dang / log gam lam las slar log ste song ba dang / gyu 'am /
analyzed: ben tam / rku ba'i tshe ben te 'dug pa dang / log gam lam las slar log ste song ba dang / gyu 'am /
translated: If one steals a boat, one is expelled if it is out of sight,

original: lam nas g-yas g-yos su gyu 'am /
analyzed: lam nas g-yas g-yos su gyu 'am /
translated: or if it has gone upstream or downstream,🔽or if it has gone to the right or left,

original: zhugs sam / nags sam khang pa lta bur zhugs pa dang / 'dzegs na de khyer ba sngon bzhin no //
analyzed: zhugs sam / nags sam khang pa lta bur zhugs pa dang / 'dzegs na de khyer ba sngon bzhin no //
translated: or if it has entered a river, or if it has entered a forest or a house,

original: shing ngam brag lta bu la 'dzegs pa de rnams gang ltar byas kyang rung ste /
analyzed: shing ngam brag lta bu la 'dzegs pa de rnams gang ltar byas kyang rung ste /
translated: or if it has gone up a tree or a rock.

original: phyugs khyu las brkus na mi snang na pham pa bzhin du /
analyzed: phyugs khyu las brkus na mi snang na pham pa bzhin du /
translated: If one steals a herd of cattle, one is expelled if it is out of sight.

original: 'di yang mi snang bar gyur na pham /
analyzed: 'di yang mi snang bar gyur na pham /
translated: Also, if it is out of sight, one is expelled.

original: gru ni thang dang yur ba dang mtshe'u las kyang ngo //
analyzed: gru ni thang dang yur ba dang mtshe'u las kyang ngo //
translated: A boat is on land, in a canal, or in a lake.

original: gru rku ba ni thang la khur du khyer ba dang yur ba'i chu las drangs pa dang mtsho las kyang rung ste thog ma'i gnas mi snang bar gyur na pham mo //
analyzed: gru rku ba ni thang la khur du khyer ba dang yur ba'i chu las drangs pa dang mtsho las kyang rung ste thog ma'i gnas mi snang bar gyur na pham mo //
translated: If one steals a boat, one is expelled if it is on land and is carried away, if it is drawn out of the water of a canal, or if it is drawn out of a lake, and if it is out of sight of its original place.

original: rgyun gyi rjes su yang ngo //
analyzed: rgyun gyi rjes su yang ngo //
translated: Also, if it is out of sight of the current.

original: chu 'bab pa'i rgyun bzhin du gru drangs te rku ba yang thog ma 'dug 'dug pa'i gnas mi snang bar gyur na pham /
analyzed: chu 'bab pa'i rgyun bzhin du gru drangs te rku ba yang thog ma 'dug 'dug pa'i gnas mi snang bar gyur na pham /
translated: If one steals a boat by pulling it along like the flow of a river and the place where it was originally situated is no longer visible, one commits a defeat.

original: thad kar ni 'gram dag mi snang na'o //
analyzed: thad kar ni 'gram dag mi snang na'o //
translated: If one pulls it directly to the bank, it is not visible.

original: mtsho 'am chu kha tshon chen po lta bu la gru thad kar drangs te rku na pha rol gyi 'gram du ma phyin kyang thog ma 'dug pa'i sa mi snang na pham /
analyzed: mtsho 'am chu kha tshon chen po lta bu la gru thad kar drangs te rku na pha rol gyi 'gram du ma phyin kyang thog ma 'dug pa'i sa mi snang na pham /
translated: If one steals a boat by pulling it directly along a river, a lake or a great expanse of water, and the place where it was originally situated is no longer visible, one commits a defeat even if one has not reached the other bank.

original: gzhan ni der phyin na'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni der phyin na'o //
translated: The other is if one reaches the other bank.

original: chu kha tshon chung du las gru drangs te rku na thog ma 'dug 'dug pa'i gnas snang yang pha rol du phyin na pham /
analyzed: chu kha tshon chung du las gru drangs te rku na thog ma 'dug 'dug pa'i gnas snang yang pha rol du phyin na pham /
translated: If one steals a boat by pulling it along a small expanse of water, the place where it was originally situated is visible, but one commits a defeat if one reaches the other bank.

original: rgyun las bzlog pa ni tshugs 'das na'o //🔽gru chu 'bab pa'i rgyun @54a * //🔽las slar bzlog ste gyen du drangs te /
analyzed: rgyun las bzlog pa ni tshugs 'das na'o // gru chu 'bab pa'i rgyun @54a * // las slar bzlog ste gyen du drangs te /
translated: The opposite of the flow is if one passes the point.🔽If one steals a boat by pulling it upstream against the flow of a river,

original: rku na ga las 'dor ba'i gru tshugs 'das pa na pham /
analyzed: rku na ga las 'dor ba'i gru tshugs 'das pa na pham /
translated: one commits a defeat when one passes the point where the boat was released.

original: glags pa ma gtogs te bdag gi las kyi mtha' grub par 'dod pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: glags pa ma gtogs te bdag gi las kyi mtha' grub par 'dod pa de'i phyir /
translated: Except if one is sick, because one wishes to complete one’s work.

original: zhing gi chu rku ba ni lud dang rmo brko dang yur khugs lta bu bzang du byas te /
analyzed: zhing gi chu rku ba ni lud dang rmo brko dang yur khugs lta bu bzang du byas te /
translated: Stealing water from a field is to steal water from a field that is well cultivated, well irrigated and well ploughed.

original: nas bzang por skyes pa ni ma gtogs par bdag gi zhing gi las bzang du byas shing nas bzang du skyes par grub par 'dod pa'i phyir /🔽gzhan gyi las kyi mthar chung du btang ngam /
analyzed: nas bzang por skyes pa ni ma gtogs par bdag gi zhing gi las bzang du byas shing nas bzang du skyes par grub par 'dod pa'i phyir / gzhan gyi las kyi mthar chung du btang ngam /
translated: Except for the case of a good field, one is defeated if one thinks, “I will cultivate my field well and the crop will be good.”

original: gzhan gyi zhing gi las byas pa la char pa che ba'i tshe gzhan gyi zhing de la bdag zhing gi chu byo ste btang /
analyzed: gzhan gyi zhing gi las byas pa la char pa che ba'i tshe gzhan gyi zhing de la bdag zhing gi chu byo ste btang /
translated: To steal water from another’s field is to divert water to one’s own field from a canal, a good irrigation system, or a well-ploughed field that belongs to another.

original: bgags na'o // than pa byung ba'i tshe gzhan gyi zhing gi chu bcad de bdag gi zhing la btang bas /
analyzed: bgags na'o // than pa byung ba'i tshe gzhan gyi zhing gi chu bcad de bdag gi zhing la btang bas /
translated: To block water is to block water from another’s field and to divert it to one’s own field when there is a drought.

original: ston chu de'i yon tan gyis bzang ngan gyi khyad cig zhugs na pham mo //
analyzed: ston chu de'i yon tan gyis bzang ngan gyi khyad cig zhugs na pham mo //
translated: If the quality of the crop is affected by the water, one is defeated.

original: shas 'thob pa'i phyir rkun po la rgyus bstan na'o //
analyzed: shas 'thob pa'i phyir rkun po la rgyus bstan na'o //
translated: To steal by showing a thief a path is to show a thief a path to steal goods.

original: rkun shas 'dod pa'i phyir rkun po la rgyus bstan na sbom po'o zhes mdo tshig ltag nas 'chad pa yin mong 'di ni shas 'dod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rkun shas 'dod pa'i phyir rkun po la rgyus bstan na sbom po'o zhes mdo tshig ltag nas 'chad pa yin mong 'di ni shas 'dod pa'i phyir /
translated: If one teaches a thief the route in order to steal for oneself, it is a serious violation.

original: rkun po la rgyus bstan te rkun pos shas byin te ring thang tshang na pham mo //
analyzed: rkun po la rgyus bstan te rkun pos shas byin te ring thang tshang na pham mo //
translated: This is a serious violation if one teaches a thief the route for the sake of stealing and the thief obtains the stolen property.

original: sa dang khyim la mu 'khor du bcug cing bsres na'o //🔽zhing sa dang khyim sa lta bu rku na bdag gi zhing dang mu bsres te ra ba'am 'obs lta bus bskor nas ra ba 'am /
analyzed: sa dang khyim la mu 'khor du bcug cing bsres na'o // zhing sa dang khyim sa lta bu rku na bdag gi zhing dang mu bsres te ra ba'am 'obs lta bus bskor nas ra ba 'am /
translated: If one encloses a field or house with a fence or a wall, and mixes it with one’s own field or house.

original: 'obs lta bu sna phrad de sa de la rin thang brtsis te tshang na'ang pham mo //
analyzed: 'obs lta bu sna phrad de sa de la rin thang brtsis te tshang na'ang pham mo //
translated: If one steals a field or house, and one’s own field or house is mixed with it, and one encloses it with a fence or a wall, and the value of the stolen field or house is calculated according to the size of the fence or wall, then one is defeated if the value is complete.

original: de ste rgyal po'i 'khor du shags bkye ste rgyal na'o //
analyzed: de ste rgyal po'i 'khor du shags bkye ste rgyal na'o //
translated: If one wins a lawsuit in the king’s court.

original: zhing sa dang khyim sa lta bu la gzhan zhig dang sa mtshams la mi 'dum mam /
analyzed: zhing sa dang khyim sa lta bu la gzhan zhig dang sa mtshams la mi 'dum mam /
translated: If one steals a field or house, and one’s own field or house is not mixed with it, and one disputes the boundary with another,

original: ngo ldog ste rgyal po la shags bkye nas /
analyzed: ngo ldog ste rgyal po la shags bkye nas /
translated: and one wins a lawsuit in the king’s court,

original: dge slong mi dbang ba las rgyal pos dge slong dbang ngo zhes bcad na pham /
analyzed: dge slong mi dbang ba las rgyal pos dge slong dbang ngo zhes bcad na pham /
translated: If a king decides that a monk should be punished when he is not guilty, he commits a downfall.

original: de bzhin du nor rdzas gang yang rung ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du nor rdzas gang yang rung ngo //
translated: The same is true of any kind of wealth or property.

original: de ste yul dpon la brtsams pa las pha rol gyis btang na'o //
analyzed: de ste yul dpon la brtsams pa las pha rol gyis btang na'o //
translated: If the dispute is settled by the local authorities, the monk should be released if the other party agrees.

original: zhing sa dang khyim sa la mtshams dang mu'am /🔽ngo ldog pa yul dpon nam mi dra ma zhig la zhal che bkye ba las /🔽yul dpon yang rung zhal che'i zla yul bdag kyang rung ste dge slong mi dbang mod kyi rtsod dkas kyis thong zhes bsams nas btang ngam /
analyzed: zhing sa dang khyim sa la mtshams dang mu'am / ngo ldog pa yul dpon nam mi dra ma zhig la zhal che bkye ba las / yul dpon yang rung zhal che'i zla yul bdag kyang rung ste dge slong mi dbang mod kyi rtsod dkas kyis thong zhes bsams nas btang ngam /
translated: If the dispute is about a field or a house, the boundaries should be clearly marked.🔽If the dispute is settled by the local authorities or by a group of people,🔽the monk should be released if the local authorities or the other party agree.

original: yul dpon gyis thong zhes zer ba bzhin btang na pham par 'gyur /
analyzed: yul dpon gyis thong zhes zer ba bzhin btang na pham par 'gyur /
translated: If the monk is released because the local authorities or the other party think that the monk is not guilty, or because they think that the dispute should be settled by the Sangha, the monk commits a serious violation.

original: nor rdzas gzhan la rtsod pa'ang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: nor rdzas gzhan la rtsod pa'ang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The same is true of disputes over other kinds of wealth.

original: de ni sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de ni sbyor ba'o //
translated: This is the prescription.

original: zhing sa lta bu ngo ldog pa yul @54b dpon lta bus dge slong mi dbang ba la dbang bar bcad nas yul dag ma rangs te ma btang nas zhal che spos te bkye na grangs du spos pa bzhin du sbom po re re /🔽dge slong mi dbang la zhal che yang yul bdag dbang ba bcad pa las dge slong gis ma btang ste grangs spos te bkye na grangs du spos pa bzhin du sbom po re re'o //🔽rku ba'i sems med na sho gam gyi rgyud du nyes pa 'byung bar ma dogs shig / sho gam gyi rgyud yod par mi shes la rku sems kyang med na sho gam du 'gyur ba'i rdzas sho gam gyis 'das kyang nyes med do //🔽dge slong rgan po zhig gis /
analyzed: zhing sa lta bu ngo ldog pa yul @54b dpon lta bus dge slong mi dbang ba la dbang bar bcad nas yul dag ma rangs te ma btang nas zhal che spos te bkye na grangs du spos pa bzhin du sbom po re re / dge slong mi dbang la zhal che yang yul bdag dbang ba bcad pa las dge slong gis ma btang ste grangs spos te bkye na grangs du spos pa bzhin du sbom po re re'o // rku ba'i sems med na sho gam gyi rgyud du nyes pa 'byung bar ma dogs shig / sho gam gyi rgyud yod par mi shes la rku sems kyang med na sho gam du 'gyur ba'i rdzas sho gam gyis 'das kyang nyes med do // dge slong rgan po zhig gis /
translated: If a field-like person, a person who is not a master of the monks, is made a master by a person who is like a king, and the people are not pleased and do not release him, and if the case is settled by a vote, then for each vote there is a grave offense.🔽If a person who is a master of the monks is not released by the monks, and the case is settled by a vote, then for each vote there is a grave offense.🔽If there is no intention to steal, then one should not fear that there is an offense in the passage of a toll. If one does not know that there is a toll passage and has no intention to steal, then even if one passes through a toll gate with goods that are subject to a toll, there is no offense.🔽An elder monk🔽

original: dge slong gzhon nu rgyus mi shes pa zhig la sho gam las bzla ba'i phyir sho gam du 'gyur ba'i nor brkus nas /
analyzed: dge slong gzhon nu rgyus mi shes pa zhig la sho gam las bzla ba'i phyir sho gam du 'gyur ba'i nor brkus nas /
