original: sa mtshams 'das pa dang slar blangs nas /
analyzed: sa mtshams 'das pa dang slar blangs nas /
translated: Having passed the border and then returned,

original: dge slong gzhon nu nor khyer khyer pa dang ci ltar mtshor gyi pham par gyur snyam /
analyzed: dge slong gzhon nu nor khyer khyer pa dang ci ltar mtshor gyi pham par gyur snyam /
translated: he thought, “Is the young bhikṣu who carried the wealth defeated?”

original: the tshom zos nas de nyes par mi 'gyur ro zhes bcas /
analyzed: the tshom zos nas de nyes par mi 'gyur ro zhes bcas /
translated: He was doubtful and said, “He is not at fault.”

original: nor gang gis khyer ba des sbyin /
analyzed: nor gang gis khyer ba des sbyin /
translated: The one who carried the wealth should give it.

original: dge slong la gzhan gyi nor sho gam du 'gyur ba zhig bskur te sho gam pa'i sar 'ongs nas sho gam pa ci dbang ba /
analyzed: dge slong la gzhan gyi nor sho gam du 'gyur ba zhig bskur te sho gam pa'i sar 'ongs nas sho gam pa ci dbang ba /
translated: A bhikṣu was sent to the border with the wealth of another. When he arrived at the border, the border guard said, “What do you have?”

original: dge slong khyer khyer ba de sbyin no //
analyzed: dge slong khyer khyer ba de sbyin no //
translated: The bhikṣu said, “I have what the one who carried the wealth should give.”

original: btang ba las gzhan gyi bzlas na brkus pa ma yin /
analyzed: btang ba las gzhan gyi bzlas na brkus pa ma yin /
translated: If he gives it, it is not theft.

original: dge slong la sho gam ma bcad cig par gnang ste btang ba las /
analyzed: dge slong la sho gam ma bcad cig par gnang ste btang ba las /
translated: The bhikṣu was given permission to go without paying the border tax.

original: dge slong des gzhan gyi nor zhig khyer te sho gam pa ci dbang ba nor bdag sbyin pa'i phyir ma byin na sbom po'o //
analyzed: dge slong des gzhan gyi nor zhig khyer te sho gam pa ci dbang ba nor bdag sbyin pa'i phyir ma byin na sbom po'o //
translated: If the bhikṣu carries the wealth of another and does not give it to the owner of the wealth because he is powerful at the border, it is a sthūlātyaya offense.

original: bdag bkur ba'i phyir ma byin na pham pa bdag bkur ba'am /
analyzed: bdag bkur ba'i phyir ma byin na pham pa bdag bkur ba'am /
translated: If he does not give it because he is powerful and respects himself, it is a pārājika.

original: nor bdag sbyin ba gnyis kar yang ma bsams la sho gam pa ci dbang ba ma byin na nyes byas 'di ni mdo'i t'ika las 'byung /
analyzed: nor bdag sbyin ba gnyis kar yang ma bsams la sho gam pa ci dbang ba ma byin na nyes byas 'di ni mdo'i t'ika las 'byung /
translated: The Mūlasarvâstivāda Vinaya Commentary states that if one does not pay the appropriate amount of duty without considering whether the goods are one’s own or belong to another, one commits an offense.

original: zhal nas gsungs pa las ni gzhan gyi nor sho gam las bzlas te sho gam pa ci dbang ba ma byin na pham mo zhes 'byung bar zad /
analyzed: zhal nas gsungs pa las ni gzhan gyi nor sho gam las bzlas te sho gam pa ci dbang ba ma byin na pham mo zhes 'byung bar zad /
translated: The Oral Instructions of Mañjuśrī states that if one does not pay the appropriate amount of duty without considering whether the goods belong to another, one commits a downfall.

original: bcas pa'i gzhi ni rgyal po 'byi 'byi sa ras /
analyzed: bcas pa'i gzhi ni rgyal po 'byi 'byi sa ras /
translated: The basis of the training rule was King Aśoka.

original: dge slong la sho gam mi gcad par gnang ba las /
analyzed: dge slong la sho gam mi gcad par gnang ba las /
translated: He permitted monks not to pay duty.

original: dge slong gcig cig gis 'dron po gzhan gyi nor sho gam du 'gyur ba khyer te sho gam pa dbang ba ma yin pa las bcas /
analyzed: dge slong gcig cig gis 'dron po gzhan gyi nor sho gam du 'gyur ba khyer te sho gam pa dbang ba ma yin pa las bcas /
translated: A monk carried the goods of other travelers, which would have been subject to duty, without paying the appropriate amount.

original: ma btang na gzhan las mi bzla /
analyzed: ma btang na gzhan las mi bzla /
translated: If he had not carried them, he would not have committed an offense.🔽There is no permission not to pay duty on the goods of a monk. However, if a powerful or influential person sends the goods of a monk to be transported,

original: dge slong gi nor la sho gam mi gcad par gnang ba med pa la gzhan dbang chen po'am kha drag pa la bdag gi nor sho gam du 'gyur ba de bskur te /🔽sho gam pa dbang bam byin te rin @55a * //
analyzed: dge slong gi nor la sho gam mi gcad par gnang ba med pa la gzhan dbang chen po'am kha drag pa la bdag gi nor sho gam du 'gyur ba de bskur te / sho gam pa dbang bam byin te rin @55a * //
translated: and the monk does not pay the appropriate amount of duty,

original: thang tshang na pham /
analyzed: thang tshang na pham /
translated: if the value is complete, there is a defeat.

original: ma tshor bar 'da' bar 'gyur ba nan tan mi bya bar mi bya /
analyzed: ma tshor bar 'da' bar 'gyur ba nan tan mi bya bar mi bya /
translated: Do not be careless about it.

original: bdag gi snod kyi nang du gzhan gyis sho gam du 'gyur ba'i nor bcug nas ma tshor bar sho gam las 'das par 'gyur ba'i phyir snga nas bsrung zhing tshor bar bya /
analyzed: bdag gi snod kyi nang du gzhan gyis sho gam du 'gyur ba'i nor bcug nas ma tshor bar sho gam las 'das par 'gyur ba'i phyir snga nas bsrung zhing tshor bar bya /
translated: If someone puts goods subject to customs duty in your container without your knowledge, you will have to pay the duty. Therefore, be careful and check it.

original: tshong pa dang dge slong dag cig 'grogs pa dang tshong pas sho gam du 'gyur ba'i rdzas /
analyzed: tshong pa dang dge slong dag cig 'grogs pa dang tshong pas sho gam du 'gyur ba'i rdzas /
translated: Some merchants and monks were traveling together. The merchants put goods subject to customs duty

original: dge slong gi snod du ma tshor bar bcug nas sho gam 'das te tshor nas the tshom zos pa las nyes byas gzhan ni med kyi phyin chad tshor bar byos shig ces bcas /
analyzed: dge slong gi snod du ma tshor bar bcug nas sho gam 'das te tshor nas the tshom zos pa las nyes byas gzhan ni med kyi phyin chad tshor bar byos shig ces bcas /
translated: in the monk’s container without his knowledge. When they passed through customs, the monk was unsure whether he should pay the duty or not. He was told, “There is no other fault than this. From now on, check it.”

original: ma tshor na nyes byas /
analyzed: ma tshor na nyes byas /
translated: If you do not check it, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

original: srung ma dge slong du ma zhog shig /
analyzed: srung ma dge slong du ma zhog shig /
translated: Do not let the one who checks be a monk.

original: mdo ltag ma ltar sho gam du 'gyur ba'i nor bdag gi snod du gzhan gyis mi bcug par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mdo ltag ma ltar sho gam du 'gyur ba'i nor bdag gi snod du gzhan gyis mi bcug par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to prevent others from putting goods subject to customs duty in your container without your knowledge,

original: bsod snyoms sam gcig la 'gro na /
analyzed: bsod snyoms sam gcig la 'gro na /
translated: if you are going on alms round or to visit someone,

original: dge slong gnyis gsum srung mar zhog shig ma bzhag na nyes byas /
analyzed: dge slong gnyis gsum srung mar zhog shig ma bzhag na nyes byas /
translated: If not, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: de de'i zas spyis sbyin /
analyzed: de de'i zas spyis sbyin /
translated: The monk who is the manager of the food gives it to the monks.

original: slong mo la dong pa rnams kyis srung mar bzhag pa'i zas so so nas 'theb lhag par blangs la phyis sbyin /🔽des dgag / srung mar gzhag pa rnams kyis kyang bdag cag gi spyod sho gam du 'gyur ba'i rdzas shig 'jug na mi gzhug par dgag / bcug na bsnyad srung ma rnams kyi mthus ma nus te bdag cag gi snod du nor zhig bcug na /
analyzed: slong mo la dong pa rnams kyis srung mar bzhag pa'i zas so so nas 'theb lhag par blangs la phyis sbyin / des dgag / srung mar gzhag pa rnams kyis kyang bdag cag gi spyod sho gam du 'gyur ba'i rdzas shig 'jug na mi gzhug par dgag / bcug na bsnyad srung ma rnams kyi mthus ma nus te bdag cag gi snod du nor zhig bcug na /
translated: The monks who are the managers of the food take the food that was given to them and give it to the monks who are going for alms.🔽The monks who are the managers of the food say, “If someone puts in here a substance that will be subject to the customs duty, we will not allow it.

original: grogs la bcug go zhes bsnyad /
analyzed: grogs la bcug go zhes bsnyad /
translated: ” If someone puts in a substance, they say, “It was put in by our companion.”

original: med na mtshan gdab /
analyzed: med na mtshan gdab /
translated: If there is none, they mark it.

original: srung ma gzhag tu dge slong grangs kyis med na snod kyi kha rgya 'am mtshan ma btab ste slong du 'gro'o //
analyzed: srung ma gzhag tu dge slong grangs kyis med na snod kyi kha rgya 'am mtshan ma btab ste slong du 'gro'o //
translated: If there are not enough monks to be the managers of the food, they seal the container or mark it and then go for alms.

original: ma btab na nyes byas /
analyzed: ma btab na nyes byas /
translated: If they do not seal it, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: dris te blangs /
analyzed: dris te blangs /
translated: They should take it after asking.

original: bdag gi rdzas tshong pa la gtams pa zhig slar len na sho gam du 'gyur ba'i rdzas ma bcug gam zhes 'dri ste blang /
analyzed: bdag gi rdzas tshong pa la gtams pa zhig slar len na sho gam du 'gyur ba'i rdzas ma bcug gam zhes 'dri ste blang /
translated: If one takes back one's own goods that one had entrusted to a merchant, one should ask, Are there goods that are not to be taken across the border and that are among my goods?

original: gzhan gyi rdzas shig bskur na'ang sho gam du 'gyur ba med dam zhes dris te blang /
analyzed: gzhan gyi rdzas shig bskur na'ang sho gam du 'gyur ba med dam zhes dris te blang /
translated: If one receives goods from another person, one should ask, Are there goods that are not to be taken across the border among these?

original: ma dris na nyes byas /
analyzed: ma dris na nyes byas /
translated: If one does not ask, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: dbyung bar gzhan ma grub na re zhig / bdag gi rdzas rgya 'am mtshan ma btab pa nyams la dris kyang lan mi ster te /
analyzed: dbyung bar gzhan ma grub na re zhig / bdag gi rdzas rgya 'am mtshan ma btab pa nyams la dris kyang lan mi ster te /
translated: If one cannot find another to declare one's goods, one should declare one's own goods, stamping them with a seal or marking them.

original: dge spyong med na dbyung ba'i phyir snod la reg pa dang gser dngul lta bu yod de /
analyzed: dge spyong med na dbyung ba'i phyir snod la reg pa dang gser dngul lta bu yod de /
translated: If there is no monk, one may touch the vessel in order to declare the goods, or one may touch gold and silver.

original: lag gis bzung ste phyung yang nyes med /
analyzed: lag gis bzung ste phyung yang nyes med /
translated: If one holds them in one's hand and declares them, there is no fault.

original: chad par bsngos pa las ma byin pa'o //
analyzed: chad par bsngos pa las ma byin pa'o //
translated: Not giving what has been designated as a fine.

original: sho gam du 'gyur ba'i nor zhig dkon mchog gsum mam pha ma la bsngos pa zhig na'ang /
analyzed: sho gam du 'gyur ba'i nor zhig dkon mchog gsum mam pha ma la bsngos pa zhig na'ang /
translated: If one has designated a valuable object as a fine for the Three Jewels or one's parents,

original: sho gam pas ma gnang na @55b sho gam pa ci dbang ba sbyin dgos so //
analyzed: sho gam pas ma gnang na @55b sho gam pa ci dbang ba sbyin dgos so //
translated: if the customs official does not allow it, one must give whatever the customs official demands.

original: ma byin na sbom po /
analyzed: ma byin na sbom po /
translated: If one does not give, it is a serious transgression.

original: grogs po dang khyim pa lta bu zhig la bsngos te ma byin na'ang sbom po sho gam pas btang bar byas pa'i phyir thabs 'og nas bshad /
analyzed: grogs po dang khyim pa lta bu zhig la bsngos te ma byin na'ang sbom po sho gam pas btang bar byas pa'i phyir thabs 'og nas bshad /
translated: If one does not give, having dedicated to a friend or a householder, it is a serious transgression, because it is like a tax collector.

original: de gtong ba'i phyir pha ma dag gi bsngags /
analyzed: de gtong ba'i phyir pha ma dag gi bsngags /
translated: In order to give it away, one praises one's parents.

original: sho gam du 'gyur ba'i nor pha ma dag la bsngos pa la sho gam 'dod ces zer na pha ma'i drin che ba'i yon tan bsngags te /
analyzed: sho gam du 'gyur ba'i nor pha ma dag la bsngos pa la sho gam 'dod ces zer na pha ma'i drin che ba'i yon tan bsngags te /
translated: If one says, I want the tax on the wealth that is dedicated to one's parents, one praises the great kindness and good qualities of one's parents.

original: khyod kyis btang ba'i rigs so zhes byas la ma btub na ci dbang ba sbyin dgos /
analyzed: khyod kyis btang ba'i rigs so zhes byas la ma btub na ci dbang ba sbyin dgos /
translated: If one cannot give it, one must give what one has.

original: dkon mchog gi yang ngo //
analyzed: dkon mchog gi yang ngo //
translated: Also, of the Three Jewels.

original: sho gam du 'gyur ba'i nor dkon mchog gsum la bsngos pa zhig la ma btang ste sho gam 'dod ces zer na /
analyzed: sho gam du 'gyur ba'i nor dkon mchog gsum la bsngos pa zhig la ma btang ste sho gam 'dod ces zer na /
translated: If one says, I want the tax on the wealth that is dedicated to the Three Jewels,

original: dkon mchog gsum gyi yon tan bsngags te sdig che bar bshad la sho gam bcad pa'i mi rigs so zhes byas la ma btang na spyin dgos so //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum gyi yon tan bsngags te sdig che bar bshad la sho gam bcad pa'i mi rigs so zhes byas la ma btang na spyin dgos so //
translated: one praises the good qualities of the Three Jewels, explains that it is a great sin, and says, It is not right to cut the tax. If one does not give it, one must give it.

original: sbyin pa ni gzhan gyi phyir gcig las bskyi ba'i chos kyis so //
analyzed: sbyin pa ni gzhan gyi phyir gcig las bskyi ba'i chos kyis so //
translated: Giving is for the sake of others, by the rule of giving up one's own.

original: pha ma dang dkon mchog gnyi ga la so sor bsngos pa zhig las sho gam sbyin dgos par gyur na sho gam pa ci dbang ba pha ma 'am /
analyzed: pha ma dang dkon mchog gnyi ga la so sor bsngos pa zhig las sho gam sbyin dgos par gyur na sho gam pa ci dbang ba pha ma 'am /
translated: If one must pay a toll to both one's parents and the Three Jewels, one should pay it from the wealth of either one's parents or the Three Jewels.🔽One should not pay it from the wealth of both.

original: dkon mchog gi nor gcig las bskyi ba'i chos su byas te sbyin no //
analyzed: dkon mchog gi nor gcig las bskyi ba'i chos su byas te sbyin no //
translated: One should not pay it from the wealth of one's parents or the Three Jewels if it is for the purpose of killing.

original: god pa'i kha yo ni phyis bsnyam mo //
analyzed: god pa'i kha yo ni phyis bsnyam mo //
translated: One should not pay it if one thinks, I will pay it later.

original: sho gam du 'gyur ba dang bcas te lam du mi 'gro //
analyzed: sho gam du 'gyur ba dang bcas te lam du mi 'gro //
translated: One should not pay it if one is not going on the road.

original: bdag gi rdzas sho gam du 'gyur ba zhig khyer te /
analyzed: bdag gi rdzas sho gam du 'gyur ba zhig khyer te /
translated: If one thinks, I will not go on the road with my wealth that is subject to toll,🔽one should go with only as much wealth as is not subject to toll.

original: mi 'gro sho gam du 'gyur ba khyer na rgyang grags re re sho gam du mi 'gyur zhing nyes med pa ni ras kyi kha gnyis kha bcad pa'am /🔽kha dog bsgyur ba las yo byad du gtogs pa lus gang nyi tshe khyer te song ba ni nyes med /
analyzed: mi 'gro sho gam du 'gyur ba khyer na rgyang grags re re sho gam du mi 'gyur zhing nyes med pa ni ras kyi kha gnyis kha bcad pa'am / kha dog bsgyur ba las yo byad du gtogs pa lus gang nyi tshe khyer te song ba ni nyes med /
translated: If one goes with two pieces of cloth, one should either sew them together or dye them a different color.🔽One should go with only as much wealth as is not subject to toll.

original: bsgyur ba ni der mi 'gyur te lci ba ni btsir bas kyang ngo //
analyzed: bsgyur ba ni der mi 'gyur te lci ba ni btsir bas kyang ngo //
translated: If one goes with heavy things, one should go with only as much as is not subject to toll.

original: dge slong gi yo byad du gos kha dog bsgyur ba sho gam du mi 'gyur ba ni lci ba btsir te btsos pa yan chad du kha dog bsgyur ba ni sho gam mi gcod de btsong ba lta bu'i nor kha dog bsgyur te mang du khyer ba ni🔽sho gam du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong gi yo byad du gos kha dog bsgyur ba sho gam du mi 'gyur ba ni lci ba btsir te btsos pa yan chad du kha dog bsgyur ba ni sho gam mi gcod de btsong ba lta bu'i nor kha dog bsgyur te mang du khyer ba ni sho gam du 'gyur ro //
translated: If they are dyed after being pressed and boiled, they are not subject to customs duty. But if they are dyed before being sold, they are subject to customs duty.

original: kha tshar bcad na yang ngo //
analyzed: kha tshar bcad na yang ngo //
translated: If the edges are cut, they are not subject to customs duty.

original: ras lta bu bdag gi yo byad du bya ba'i phyir ya tog ma tog gnyis ka'i kha tshar bcad pa yang sho gam du mi 'gyur /
analyzed: ras lta bu bdag gi yo byad du bya ba'i phyir ya tog ma tog gnyis ka'i kha tshar bcad pa yang sho gam du mi 'gyur /
translated: If a monk cuts the edges of a cloth that is to be made into his own robes, it is not subject to customs duty.

original: btsong pa'i zong lta bu mang du khyer ba ni sho gam du 'gyur /
analyzed: btsong pa'i zong lta bu mang du khyer ba ni sho gam du 'gyur /
translated: But if he carries a lot of it, it is subject to customs duty.🔽If you do not see it, do not trust it.

original: ma mthong na de la yid ma brtan cig / dge slong sho gam gyi rgyud du 'gro ba zhig gis /
analyzed: ma mthong na de la yid ma brtan cig / dge slong sho gam gyi rgyud du 'gro ba zhig gis /
translated: A monk who was traveling through a customs area

original: dge slong grogs gcig la ras 'di kha tshar chod la kha dog @56a * //
analyzed: dge slong grogs gcig la ras 'di kha tshar chod la kha dog @56a * //
translated: asked a fellow monk to cut the edges of a cloth,

original: bsgyur te rdzogs shig par gtams pa las /
analyzed: bsgyur te rdzogs shig par gtams pa las /
translated: dye it, and finish it.

original: dge sbyong des le lo byas te kha tshar kyang ma bcad /
analyzed: dge sbyong des le lo byas te kha tshar kyang ma bcad /
translated: The ascetic was lazy and did not cut the edges.

original: kha dog kyang ma bsgyur bar snod du bcug nas /
analyzed: kha dog kyang ma bsgyur bar snod du bcug nas /
translated: Without changing the color, he put it in a container.

original: dge slong nor bdag gi yid la btsos grangs snyam ste /
analyzed: dge slong nor bdag gi yid la btsos grangs snyam ste /
translated: The monk who was the owner of the goods thought, “It is cooked.”

original: sho gam bas btsal ba dang ma btsos par gyur nas phyin chad ma mthong ba la yid ma brtan cig par bcas te bdag gi snod na sho gam du 'gyur ba yod dam med ma bltas na nyes byas /
analyzed: sho gam bas btsal ba dang ma btsos par gyur nas phyin chad ma mthong ba la yid ma brtan cig par bcas te bdag gi snod na sho gam du 'gyur ba yod dam med ma bltas na nyes byas /
translated: The customs official searched and found that it was not cooked. He said, “Do not trust that it is not cooked.” He looked in the monk’s container and said, “Do you have goods on which you have not paid customs duty?”

original: gzhan gyi 'tsho ba mi gcad /
analyzed: gzhan gyi 'tsho ba mi gcad /
translated: Do not interrupt the livelihood of others.

original: sho gam pa sho gam gyis 'tsho ba la sho gam mi sbyin pa'i phyir 'dron po bkag pa'am lam bsgyur te mi dgye /
analyzed: sho gam pa sho gam gyis 'tsho ba la sho gam mi sbyin pa'i phyir 'dron po bkag pa'am lam bsgyur te mi dgye /
translated: Do not block or divert travelers in order to avoid paying customs duty to the customs official who makes his living from customs duty.

original: de bzhin du rngon pa'am nya ba'am chang 'tshong ba la sogs pas 'tsho ba la nan tur ram mthus 'di ltar ma spyod ces mi dgag dgag na nyes byas /
analyzed: de bzhin du rngon pa'am nya ba'am chang 'tshong ba la sogs pas 'tsho ba la nan tur ram mthus 'di ltar ma spyod ces mi dgag dgag na nyes byas /
translated: Similarly, do not stop those who make their living as hunters, fishermen, or liquor sellers, by saying, “Do not act in this way,” or by force.

original: ma brtan pa la brtan par mi bya /
analyzed: ma brtan pa la brtan par mi bya /
translated: Do not be unstable.

original: dge slong gcig la lhung bzed che chung gnyis shig yod pa las /
analyzed: dge slong gcig la lhung bzed che chung gnyis shig yod pa las /
translated: A monk had two alms bowls, a large one and a small one.

original: dge slong de gud du song ba'i 'og tu dge slong gcig gis lhung bzed chung du de bdag gi lhung bzed kyi nang du shong na nyo zhes bcug ste song ba'i phyir bcug pa dang lhung bzed bdag pos mthong nas brkus so zhes brtan pa las bcas te
analyzed: dge slong de gud du song ba'i 'og tu dge slong gcig gis lhung bzed chung du de bdag gi lhung bzed kyi nang du shong na nyo zhes bcug ste song ba'i phyir bcug pa dang lhung bzed bdag pos mthong nas brkus so zhes brtan pa las bcas te
translated: When the owner of the begging bowl saw it, he accused the monk of stealing it.

original: yid ma brtan pa'i dge slong dang khyim pa'i rdzas la lag mi gzhug thug thub tu'ang mi spyad spyad na nyes byas so //
analyzed: yid ma brtan pa'i dge slong dang khyim pa'i rdzas la lag mi gzhug thug thub tu'ang mi spyad spyad na nyes byas so //
translated: One should not touch the belongings of a monk whose honesty is not known, nor should one use them even if one is pressed.

original: der 'gyur ba ni 'og ma'i bla ma dag la'o //🔽grogs po yid brtan par chud pa ni mdza' bo che chung rnam gsum ste mdza' bo chen po'i gsang ba'i tshig 'bring po la mi bya chung ngu'i tshig chen po la bya /
analyzed: der 'gyur ba ni 'og ma'i bla ma dag la'o // grogs po yid brtan par chud pa ni mdza' bo che chung rnam gsum ste mdza' bo chen po'i gsang ba'i tshig 'bring po la mi bya chung ngu'i tshig chen po la bya /
translated: The same applies to the belongings of laypeople.🔽A trusted friend is one of three kinds: a great friend, a medium friend, and a lesser friend.🔽The secret words of a great friend should not be told to a medium friend, but the words of a medium friend may be told to a great friend.

original: 'bring po'i tshig chen po la bya 'bring po'i tshig chung ngu la mi bya de ltar byas na nyes byas so //
analyzed: 'bring po'i tshig chen po la bya 'bring po'i tshig chung ngu la mi bya de ltar byas na nyes byas so //
translated: The words of a lesser friend should not be told to a medium friend, but the words of a medium friend may be told to a lesser friend.

original: mdza' bo / mdza' po ni 'di rnams te gros mthun pa dang / yid mthun pa /
analyzed: mdza' bo / mdza' po ni 'di rnams te gros mthun pa dang / yid mthun pa /
translated: Friends are those who are in agreement, who have a common purpose,

original: tshig gsang ba spobs shing mya ngan langs pa la mthong /
analyzed: tshig gsang ba spobs shing mya ngan langs pa la mthong /
translated: who are discreet, who are capable of discussing problems,

original: mya ngan med par nus pa dang / bla ma dran pa /
analyzed: mya ngan med par nus pa dang / bla ma dran pa /
translated: who are able to console, who remember favors,

original: mkhan po slob dpon dang sdug pa'i phyir rtag tu dran pa dang / mchod pa /
analyzed: mkhan po slob dpon dang sdug pa'i phyir rtag tu dran pa dang / mchod pa /
translated: who are always mindful of their gurus, preceptors, and teachers, and who are generous.

original: mdza' pa'i phyir kha zas dang gos la sogs pas mchod cing 'dul ba dang / bsngags pa ste /
analyzed: mdza' pa'i phyir kha zas dang gos la sogs pas mchod cing 'dul ba dang / bsngags pa ste /
translated: They are generous because they honor their friends with gifts of food, clothing, etc.

original: mdza' ba'i phyir gcig la gcig yon tan bsngags shing bstod pa dang / blangs na dga' ba'o //
analyzed: mdza' ba'i phyir gcig la gcig yon tan bsngags shing bstod pa dang / blangs na dga' ba'o //
translated: They are praiseworthy because they praise each other's good qualities.🔽They are agreeable because they are happy to share their possessions with their friends.

original: mdza' ba'i phyir rdzas la sogs pa thug thub tu spyad na dga' ba dang mdza' bo 'di rnams la gang @56b yang rung gcig la rab 'bring rnam gsum du phye ste /
analyzed: mdza' ba'i phyir rdzas la sogs pa thug thub tu spyad na dga' ba dang mdza' bo 'di rnams la gang @56b yang rung gcig la rab 'bring rnam gsum du phye ste /
translated: These friends are of three types: great, medium, and small.

original: mdo gong ma bzhin du mdza' bo chung ngu la chen po'i tshig mi bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: mdo gong ma bzhin du mdza' bo chung ngu la chen po'i tshig mi bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: As in the previous verse, one should not treat a small friend as a great friend.

original: las kyi lag pod dus gyis shig / dge slong gcig cig la lhung bzed chung du zhig bdog pa las dge 'dun gyis las shig tu bskos pa dang / ma nus te grogs gcig la bcol ba dang grogs de lhung bzed bdog pa de glar blangs nas las byas pa las bcas te /
analyzed: las kyi lag pod dus gyis shig / dge slong gcig cig la lhung bzed chung du zhig bdog pa las dge 'dun gyis las shig tu bskos pa dang / ma nus te grogs gcig la bcol ba dang grogs de lhung bzed bdog pa de glar blangs nas las byas pa las bcas te /
translated: He was unable to do it, so he entrusted it to a companion. That companion took the monk’s begging bowl as payment and did the work.

original: grogs kyis las bcol ba las gla blangs na nyes byas te /
analyzed: grogs kyis las bcol ba las gla blangs na nyes byas te /
translated: If you entrust work to a companion and take payment, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: phas bcol na yang las de lag pod du bya /
analyzed: phas bcol na yang las de lag pod du bya /
translated: If you are entrusted by your father, you should do the work.

original: bsod nams kyi blos kyang ngo //🔽dge slong las mi nus pa zhig gis byed par bcol na snying rje zhing las mi nus pa la /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi blos kyang ngo // dge slong las mi nus pa zhig gis byed par bcol na snying rje zhing las mi nus pa la /
translated: You should also do it if you think it will be meritorious.

original: bsod nams su 'gyur bar bsams te bcol ba ci nus su bya /
analyzed: bsod nams su 'gyur bar bsams te bcol ba ci nus su bya /
translated: If you entrust work to a monk who is unable to do it, you should do it yourself to the best of your ability, thinking, “I will do it out of compassion for him and because it will be meritorious.”

original: glas ma yin no //
analyzed: glas ma yin no //
translated: You should not take payment.

original: dge slong rgan po las mi nus pa'am grogs gzhan zhig gis las bcol na'ang /
analyzed: dge slong rgan po las mi nus pa'am grogs gzhan zhig gis las bcol na'ang /
translated: If an elder monk or another companion entrusts work to you,

original: mdo ltag ma gnyis ltar bsod nams kyi blo dang lag pod du bya'i lhung bzed ltar gla mi blang ngo //
analyzed: mdo ltag ma gnyis ltar bsod nams kyi blo dang lag pod du bya'i lhung bzed ltar gla mi blang ngo //
translated: you should do it, thinking, “It will be meritorious,” as in the first and second cases of the sutra, but you should not take payment, as in the case of the begging bowl.

original: yul skad kyis ni mi bslu'o //
analyzed: yul skad kyis ni mi bslu'o //
translated: One is not deceived by local dialects.

original: dge slong ma skad mi mthun pa gnyis shig / snga phyir dong ba las sngar song ba'i chos gos lhung ste /
analyzed: dge slong ma skad mi mthun pa gnyis shig / snga phyir dong ba las sngar song ba'i chos gos lhung ste /
translated: Two nuns with different dialects went on a journey. The nun who went first dropped her robe.

original: phyi mas bdag gi skad du bos te brda ma phrad nas blangs te khyer khyer ba las chos gos bdag mos brkus so zhes brda ba las brda mi phrod pa nyes med do zhes bcas /
analyzed: phyi mas bdag gi skad du bos te brda ma phrad nas blangs te khyer khyer ba las chos gos bdag mos brkus so zhes brda ba las brda mi phrod pa nyes med do zhes bcas /
translated: The nun who came later called out in her own dialect, but not understanding the greeting, took the robe and went on her way. The nun who had dropped the robe said, “She stole my robe!”🔽“If you do not understand the greeting, there is no fault.

original: ltung ba blangs na ring du mi bcang /
analyzed: ltung ba blangs na ring du mi bcang /
translated: If you pick up a fallen robe, do not keep it long.

original: mdo ltag ma ltar chos gos ltung pa lta bu blangs te khyer khyer ba ring du mi gzhag par bdag po la sbyin no //🔽ring du bzhag na nyes byas /
analyzed: mdo ltag ma ltar chos gos ltung pa lta bu blangs te khyer khyer ba ring du mi gzhag par bdag po la sbyin no // ring du bzhag na nyes byas /
translated: If you pick up a robe that has fallen in a place where people urinate or defecate, do not keep it long. Give it to its owner.

original: gtsug lag khang skyong la gtad /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang skyong la gtad /
translated: If you keep it long, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.🔽If you find some wealth that has fallen, give it to the caretaker of the monastery.

original: nor rdzas ltung ba zhig rnyed de blangs na gtsug lag khang skyong la gtad de su'i yin pa rmed du gzhug / rab tu byung ba'i ngo shes na dge 'dun la bstan /
analyzed: nor rdzas ltung ba zhig rnyed de blangs na gtsug lag khang skyong la gtad de su'i yin pa rmed du gzhug / rab tu byung ba'i ngo shes na dge 'dun la bstan /
translated: If you recognize the owner, show it to the community.

original: nor rdzas rnyed pa de dge slong gi rdzas shig yin par shes na gtsug lag khang skyong gi dge 'dun la bstan te bdag po yod na sbyin no //
analyzed: nor rdzas rnyed pa de dge slong gi rdzas shig yin par shes na gtsug lag khang skyong gi dge 'dun la bstan te bdag po yod na sbyin no //
translated: If it is known that the acquired wealth is the property of a monk, it should be shown to the Sangha of the monastery. If there is an owner, it should be given to him.

original: bdag po ma dmigs na rgyu thag la gdags /
analyzed: bdag po ma dmigs na rgyu thag la gdags /
translated: If the owner is not found, it should be hung on the rope.

original: nor rdzas rnyed pa de bdag po khungs ma phyin te gang yin gtol med na gtsug lag khang du rgyu thag bres te /
analyzed: nor rdzas rnyed pa de bdag po khungs ma phyin te gang yin gtol med na gtsug lag khang du rgyu thag bres te /
translated: If the acquired wealth is not known to belong to an owner, it should be hung on the rope in the monastery.

original: de la btags la gzhag / nad pas ma bsgo bar sman mi blangs dge slong ma nad pa zhig la yon bdag dang ba zhig yod de nad pas ma bsgo bar nad g-yog gis yon bdag yungs @57a * //🔽mar thug thub tu nad pa'i phyir blangs pa las bcas te /
analyzed: de la btags la gzhag / nad pas ma bsgo bar sman mi blangs dge slong ma nad pa zhig la yon bdag dang ba zhig yod de nad pas ma bsgo bar nad g-yog gis yon bdag yungs @57a * // mar thug thub tu nad pa'i phyir blangs pa las bcas te /
translated: A sick person should not take medicine without being told to do so. A sick nun had a faithful benefactor. Without being told by the sick nun, the attendant took sesame oil for the sick nun to the benefactor again and again.🔽It is said that the attendant should not take it without being told.

original: nad bas ma bsgo bar nad g-yog gis blangs na nyes byas /
analyzed: nad bas ma bsgo bar nad g-yog gis blangs na nyes byas /
translated: If the attendant takes it without being told, it is a minor offense.

original: ma byin par len pa'i phas pham pa ste rnam par 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: ma byin par len pa'i phas pham pa ste rnam par 'byed pa'o //
translated: This is the analysis of the defeating offense of taking what is not given.

original: ma byin par len pa'i phas pham pa /
analyzed: ma byin par len pa'i phas pham pa /
translated: The defeating offense of taking what is not given.

original: 'dul ba rnam par 'byed pa'i mdo /
analyzed: 'dul ba rnam par 'byed pa'i mdo /
translated: The Sutra that Analyzes the Vinaya.

original: // / bdag po dang bcas pas gnang ba las brtag pa gzhan du bdag gir mi bya /
analyzed: // / bdag po dang bcas pas gnang ba las brtag pa gzhan du bdag gir mi bya /
translated: One should not take possession of something else without the permission of the owner.

original: tshong pas shing rta chag ste bal bor ba la drug sdes lhar brjed nas yul mi kun gyis kyang nor rdzas la sogs pas mchod pa'i phyir phul ba las drug sdes /
analyzed: tshong pas shing rta chag ste bal bor ba la drug sdes lhar brjed nas yul mi kun gyis kyang nor rdzas la sogs pas mchod pa'i phyir phul ba las drug sdes /
translated: The six classes of beings forgot the deity when the merchant’s cart broke down and the goods were left behind. Because the people of the country made offerings of wealth and so forth, the six classes of beings said,

original: nged kyi lha'i nor yin gyis bskur ro zhes byas te //
analyzed: nged kyi lha'i nor yin gyis bskur ro zhes byas te //
translated: “This is our deity’s wealth. Give it to us.”🔽They took it.

original: khyer ba las bcas te nor bdag gi 'am lha ma srin gyi khyer cig par bsgo ba ma gtogs par /
analyzed: khyer ba las bcas te nor bdag gi 'am lha ma srin gyi khyer cig par bsgo ba ma gtogs par /
translated: Except for the order to return it to the owner of the wealth or to the deity,

original: lha ma srin gyi nor bdag po mis bsrungs pa las blangs na pham /
analyzed: lha ma srin gyi nor bdag po mis bsrungs pa las blangs na pham /
translated: if one takes the wealth of a deity or spirit that is guarded by a human, there is a defeat.

original: tshor ba yod pa'i lha ma srin gyi nor las blang na sbom po /
analyzed: tshor ba yod pa'i lha ma srin gyi nor las blang na sbom po /
translated: If one takes wealth from a deity or spirit who has feelings, there is a serious violation.

original: tshor ba med pa'i lha ma srin las nor blangs na nyes byas so//
analyzed: tshor ba med pa'i lha ma srin las nor blangs na nyes byas so//
translated: If one takes wealth from a deity or spirit who has no feelings, there is an offense.

original: bdag gir byas pa las mi dbrog / bdag gi rdzas rkun pos khyer ba khos slar ma byin par mi dbrog / brkus te khyer ba las mthong yang rung /
analyzed: bdag gir byas pa las mi dbrog / bdag gi rdzas rkun pos khyer ba khos slar ma byin par mi dbrog / brkus te khyer ba las mthong yang rung /
translated: One should not take what has been appropriated. One should not take back one’s own property that has been stolen by a thief without the thief’s consent.

original: brkus te khyer la ngos zin kyang rung ste /
analyzed: brkus te khyer la ngos zin kyang rung ste /
translated: If one steals and carries it off, even if one recognizes it,

original: khos ma byin par ma bskur bar zhog ces byas sam slar blangs na nyes byas /
analyzed: khos ma byin par ma bskur bar zhog ces byas sam slar blangs na nyes byas /
translated: if one says, “Do not give it back to the owner,” or if one takes it back, one commits an offense.

original: de la chos bshad de bslangs na ;
analyzed: de la chos bshad de bslangs na ;
translated: If one explains the Dharma to the thief and takes it back,

original: bdag gi rdzas rkun pos khyer ba las kho'i lag na 'dug na brkus pa'i sdig tu 'gyur ba dang / slar byin nas bsod nams che bar bshad de bslang /
analyzed: bdag gi rdzas rkun pos khyer ba las kho'i lag na 'dug na brkus pa'i sdig tu 'gyur ba dang / slar byin nas bsod nams che bar bshad de bslang /
translated: it is explained that one would commit the sin of stealing if the thief had it in his possession, but that one would create great merit by taking it back and giving it to the owner.

original: rin phyed tsam gyis kyang ngo //
analyzed: rin phyed tsam gyis kyang ngo //
translated: One may also deceive the thief with half the price.

original: mdo ltag ma ltar byas te ma ster na ci ri ba'i rin phyed tsam gyis kyang bslu'o //
analyzed: mdo ltag ma ltar byas te ma ster na ci ri ba'i rin phyed tsam gyis kyang bslu'o //
translated: If one does not give it back as promised, one may deceive the thief with half the price of the object.

original: lhung bzed dang chos gos ni rin tshang bas kyang blang ngo //
analyzed: lhung bzed dang chos gos ni rin tshang bas kyang blang ngo //
translated: One should take back a begging bowl or a monastic robe even if one is offered full price.

original: lhung bzed dang chos gos lta bu rkun pos khyer te chos bshad kyang slar mi ster na ci ri ba'i rin tshang bas kyang slar blu'o //
analyzed: lhung bzed dang chos gos lta bu rkun pos khyer te chos bshad kyang slar mi ster na ci ri ba'i rin tshang bas kyang slar blu'o //
translated: If a thief steals a begging bowl or a monastic robe, even if one explains the Dharma to the thief, one should take it back even if one is offered full price.

original: rin tshang bas slar blu dgos pa ni bdag la mkho zhing nyes pa mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rin tshang bas slar blu dgos pa ni bdag la mkho zhing nyes pa mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: One should take it back even if one is offered full price because it is necessary for oneself and because it would not be a fault.

original: mi sdug par 'gyur bar dogs pa bor ba'o zhes 'gro ba mang pos ma mthong bar mi blang /
analyzed: mi sdug par 'gyur bar dogs pa bor ba'o zhes 'gro ba mang pos ma mthong bar mi blang /
translated: It is to avoid the fear of becoming ugly.🔽The group of six took what was left over from a pig and sugarcane that had been stolen by thieves, and they were taken by the owner.

original: phag dang bu ram shing rkun pos khyer ba'i lhag rol la drug sdes blangs nas khyer ba dang / nor bdag gis zin te yul mi ma dga' ba las bcas te lhag rol de lta bu zhig blangs na'ang /
analyzed: phag dang bu ram shing rkun pos khyer ba'i lhag rol la drug sdes blangs nas khyer ba dang / nor bdag gis zin te yul mi ma dga' ba las bcas te lhag rol de lta bu zhig blangs na'ang /
translated: They were not liked by the people of the country.

original: mi gzhan gyis mthong zhing shes par byas @57b te ma brkus par dbang dag gis shes par blangs /
analyzed: mi gzhan gyis mthong zhing shes par byas @57b te ma brkus par dbang dag gis shes par blangs /
translated: If you take such leftovers, you should do so in a way that others see and understand that you are not stealing, but that you are taking it with the permission of the owner.

original: mang pos ma mthong bar blangs na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mang pos ma mthong bar blangs na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If you take it without being seen by many people, it becomes a minor offense.

original: mi ma yin pas bsngos ba ro'i rdzas kyang bdag po med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mi ma yin pas bsngos ba ro'i rdzas kyang bdag po med pa ma yin no //
translated: Even if a nonhuman being dedicates the substance of a corpse, it is not without an owner.

original: mi zhig la ba la chags shing 'dug pa las shi ste la ba'i bdag por skyes pa las drug sdes ro las la ba blangs te khyer ba dang 'dre des phyi bzhin du 'brangs te /
analyzed: mi zhig la ba la chags shing 'dug pa las shi ste la ba'i bdag por skyes pa las drug sdes ro las la ba blangs te khyer ba dang 'dre des phyi bzhin du 'brangs te /
translated: A man was attached to a cow and died. He was reborn as the owner of the cow. The group of six took the cow from the corpse and carried it away. The ghost followed them.

original: drug sdes ni rgyal po'i khab tu song 'dre sgo las ma chud de bos pa dang / sangs rgyas kyis aa nan la bka' stsal te /
analyzed: drug sdes ni rgyal po'i khab tu song 'dre sgo las ma chud de bos pa dang / sangs rgyas kyis aa nan la bka' stsal te /
translated: The Buddha told Ānanda,🔽“Give it to them and send them to follow the ghost.”

original: la ba byin cig par gtad nas 'dre'i phyi bzhin du skyel bar btang ba las bcas te /🔽ro'i rdzis 'dre gnas pa las mi blang /
analyzed: la ba byin cig par gtad nas 'dre'i phyi bzhin du skyel bar btang ba las bcas te / ro'i rdzis 'dre gnas pa las mi blang /
translated: The ghost took the blanket and left.🔽The monks followed the ghost.🔽The ghost was very fierce and the monks were afraid.

original: blangs na nyes byas /
analyzed: blangs na nyes byas /
translated: The ghost was unable to carry the blanket, so the monks followed it to see what it would do.

original: rab tu gtum pa de'i phyi bzhin du 'gro'o //
analyzed: rab tu gtum pa de'i phyi bzhin du 'gro'o //
translated: The ghost went to the place where it lived, and the monks followed it.🔽The ghost lay down in a hole and covered itself with the blanket from the feet up.🔽The monks also lay down in the hole and covered themselves with the blanket from the feet up.🔽The ghost was unable to move.

original: 'dres la ba khyer mi nus pa'i phyir nan tan skyel du btang ste 'dre'i sngon du song na kyal ka byed pa'i phyir phyi bzhin du 'brang zhing 'gro'o //🔽khas phub tu nyal la rkang ba nas steng du g-yogs pa yang ngo //
analyzed: 'dres la ba khyer mi nus pa'i phyir nan tan skyel du btang ste 'dre'i sngon du song na kyal ka byed pa'i phyir phyi bzhin du 'brang zhing 'gro'o // khas phub tu nyal la rkang ba nas steng du g-yogs pa yang ngo //
translated: The monks said, “We will not move until you give us the blanket.”🔽The ghost said, “I will not give it to you.”🔽The monks said, “We will not move until you give it to us.”🔽The ghost said, “I will not give it to you.”🔽The monks said, “We will not move until you give it to us.”🔽The ghost said, “I will not give it to you.”🔽The monks said, “We will not move until you give it to us.”🔽The ghost said, “I will not give it to you.”🔽The monks said, “We will not move until you give it to us.”🔽The ghost said, “I will not give it to you.”🔽The monks said, “We will not move until you give it to us.”🔽The ghost said, “I will not give it to you.”🔽The monks said, “We will not move until you give it to us.”🔽The ghost said, “I will not give it to you.”🔽The monks said, “We will not move until you give it to us.”🔽The ghost said, “I will not give it to you.”🔽The monks said, “We will not move until you give it to us.”🔽The ghost said, “I will not give it to you.”🔽The monks said, “We will not move until you give it to us.”

original: 'dre de'i 'dug pa'i gnas su phyin na 'dre mchil mas 'thor lag pas 'jo rkang pa phra ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dre de'i 'dug pa'i gnas su phyin na 'dre mchil mas 'thor lag pas 'jo rkang pa phra ba'i phyir /
translated: The ghost said, “I will not give it to you.”🔽The monks said, “We will not move until you give it to us.”🔽The ghost said, “I will not give it to you.”

original: khas phub tu bsnyal la la bas rkang ba nas g-yogs de ltar ma byas na nyes byas /
analyzed: khas phub tu bsnyal la la bas rkang ba nas g-yogs de ltar ma byas na nyes byas /
translated: The monks said, “We will not move until

original: ma smas pa las mi blang /
analyzed: ma smas pa las mi blang /
translated: Do not take from an undamaged corpse.

original: ro la rma ma byung ngam ma smas na ro langs kyi 'dre yod pa'i phyir rdzas mi blang /
analyzed: ro la rma ma byung ngam ma smas na ro langs kyi 'dre yod pa'i phyir rdzas mi blang /
translated: If the corpse is not damaged, do not take substances from it, because it may be a zombie ghost.

original: ma smas pa las rdzas blangs na nyes byas /🔽rang gis dbug pa'am /
analyzed: ma smas pa las rdzas blangs na nyes byas / rang gis dbug pa'am /
translated: Taking substances from an undamaged corpse is a minor infraction.🔽Do not make a wound yourself.

original: dbug tu gzhug par mi bya /🔽ro'i rdzas blang ba'i phyir ro ma smas pa la bdag gis rma dbyung ba'am /
analyzed: dbug tu gzhug par mi bya / ro'i rdzas blang ba'i phyir ro ma smas pa la bdag gis rma dbyung ba'am /
translated: Do not have another make a wound.🔽Do not make a wound yourself or have another make a wound in order to take substances from an undamaged corpse.

original: gzhan rma dbyung du mi gzhug / rma phyung ngam 'byin du bcug na nyes byas /
analyzed: gzhan rma dbyung du mi gzhug / rma phyung ngam 'byin du bcug na nyes byas /
translated: Making a wound or having one made is a minor infraction.

original: ngal bsos pa nyid so shing dang chu dang / go 'dun dang lci ba dang sa dag ci bder bya'o //
analyzed: ngal bsos pa nyid so shing dang chu dang / go 'dun dang lci ba dang sa dag ci bder bya'o //
translated: Relaxing, using a tooth stick, washing, rinsing the mouth, and using ashes are to be done as one likes.

original: dge slong zhig ga zhig nas 'ongs te grogs po snga na 'dug pa na re /
analyzed: dge slong zhig ga zhig nas 'ongs te grogs po snga na 'dug pa na re /
translated: If a monk comes from somewhere else, his friend who is already there should say, “Relax.”🔽If he says, “Relax,” the five aspects are to be practiced.

original: ngal sos shig ces zer na rnam pa 'di lnga spyod cig ma bsgo yang ngal sos shig ces byas pa'i tshig rkyen gyis ci bder spyod cig pa'i nang du chud de /
analyzed: ngal sos shig ces zer na rnam pa 'di lnga spyod cig ma bsgo yang ngal sos shig ces byas pa'i tshig rkyen gyis ci bder spyod cig pa'i nang du chud de /
translated: If he says, “Relax,” even though he has not given the order, it is included in the phrase “as one likes.”

original: ma blangs ma zhugs par spyod kyang nyes med do //
analyzed: ma blangs ma zhugs par spyod kyang nyes med do //
translated: Even if one uses it without taking it or without entering it, there is no fault.

original: gnyen gyis mi 'dod bzhin du dge slong ngam dge sbyong 'phrog na bzung /
analyzed: gnyen gyis mi 'dod bzhin du dge slong ngam dge sbyong 'phrog na bzung /
translated: If a monk or a renunciant is seized by relatives unwillingly,

original: rab tu 'byung ba'am bsnyen par rdzogs pa zhig las /
analyzed: rab tu 'byung ba'am bsnyen par rdzogs pa zhig las /
translated: whether one is ordained or fully ordained,

original: phu nu gnyen bshes kyis mi ster te /
analyzed: phu nu gnyen bshes kyis mi ster te /
translated: if relatives and friends do not give him up,

original: 'phrog tu 'ongs na dge slong gis lag pa ya gcig nas bzung /🔽'phrog @58a * //
analyzed: 'phrog tu 'ongs na dge slong gis lag pa ya gcig nas bzung / 'phrog @58a * //
translated: and if they come to seize him, the monk should hold on to one arm.🔽If the one who is being seized holds on to the other arm and pulls,

original: tu 'ongs pas lag pa ya gcig bzung ste drangs na dge slong gis gzung ba'i lag pa na zhes zer na btang /
analyzed: tu 'ongs pas lag pa ya gcig bzung ste drangs na dge slong gis gzung ba'i lag pa na zhes zer na btang /
translated: if the monk says, My arm hurts, he should let go.

original: 'phrog pas bzung ba'i lag pa na zhes zer na mi gtad /
analyzed: 'phrog pas bzung ba'i lag pa na zhes zer na mi gtad /
translated: If the one who is seizing says, My arm hurts, he should not let go.

original: ma byin par len pa'i phas pham pa'i phran tshegs su gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: ma byin par len pa'i phas pham pa'i phran tshegs su gtogs pa'o //
translated: This is included in the minor offenses of the defeating offense of taking what was not given.

original: ma byin par len pa'i phas pham pa ste /
analyzed: ma byin par len pa'i phas pham pa ste /
translated: This is the defeating offense of taking what was not given.

original: 'dul ba'i sde phran tshegs kyi nang nas 'byung ba'i mdo /
analyzed: 'dul ba'i sde phran tshegs kyi nang nas 'byung ba'i mdo /
translated: The Sutra that Arises from the Minor Collection of the Vinaya

original: // / ka ka ni bzhi la ma sha ka'o //
analyzed: // / ka ka ni bzhi la ma sha ka'o //
translated: Four kakanis are a māṣa.

original: dngul zho'i brgyad cha'i thang du brtsi ba ni dngul srang gcig la ge der lnga /
analyzed: dngul zho'i brgyad cha'i thang du brtsi ba ni dngul srang gcig la ge der lnga /
translated: One-eighth of a silver dharaṇa is calculated as one silver paṇa.

original: ge der gcig la ka'u ni bzhi /
analyzed: ge der gcig la ka'u ni bzhi /
translated: One silver paṇa is four kṛṣṇala.🔽One kṛṣṇala is sixteen small beans.

original: ka'u ni gcig la pa na bcu drug / pa na gcig la 'gron bu brgyad cu /🔽'gron bu nye shu la /🔽ka ka ni gcig / ka ka ni bcu drug la /
analyzed: ka'u ni gcig la pa na bcu drug / pa na gcig la 'gron bu brgyad cu / 'gron bu nye shu la / ka ka ni gcig / ka ka ni bcu drug la /
translated: One small bean is eighty barley seeds.🔽Twenty small beans is one kākini.

original: 'gron bu sum brgya nyi shu ste /
analyzed: 'gron bu sum brgya nyi shu ste /
translated: Sixteen kākini is three hundred and twenty small beans.

original: dngul zho'i brgyad cha gcig yod do //
analyzed: dngul zho'i brgyad cha gcig yod do //
translated: This is one-eighth of a silver dharaṇa.

original: 'di ltar brtsis na 'gron bu dngul zho brgyad chas pham /
analyzed: 'di ltar brtsis na 'gron bu dngul zho brgyad chas pham /
translated: If calculated in this way, eighty small beans is one dharaṇa.

original: lnga ni gtan par te k'ar sh'a pa na'i bzhi chas so //
analyzed: lnga ni gtan par te k'ar sh'a pa na'i bzhi chas so //
translated: Five paṇas is one quarter kārṣāpaṇa.

original: sangs rgyas bzhugs pa'i tshe ni k'a ra sh'a pa na bzhi cha gcig la ma sha ka lnga yod de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bzhugs pa'i tshe ni k'a ra sh'a pa na bzhi cha gcig la ma sha ka lnga yod de /
translated: When the Buddha was alive, one quarter kārṣāpaṇa had five māsaka.🔽If calculated in this way, there is one-eighth of a silver dharaṇa.🔽This is one dharaṇa.

original: de la brtsis na dngul zho'i brgyad cha gcig yod de des pham deng sang ni ma sha ka bzhi la dngul zho'i brgyad cha gcig ste /
analyzed: de la brtsis na dngul zho'i brgyad cha gcig yod de des pham deng sang ni ma sha ka bzhi la dngul zho'i brgyad cha gcig ste /
translated: Now, one-eighth of a silver dharaṇa is four māsaka.

original: ma sha ka bzhis pham par 'gyur /
analyzed: ma sha ka bzhis pham par 'gyur /
translated: Four māsaka is one dharaṇa.

original: gang na de la ma sha ka nyi shu pa de la gnas pa ba na'o //🔽sangs rgyas bzhugs pa'i tshe ma sha ka nyi shu la /
analyzed: gang na de la ma sha ka nyi shu pa de la gnas pa ba na'o // sangs rgyas bzhugs pa'i tshe ma sha ka nyi shu la /
translated: Where? In a place where twenty māṣas are considered to be one kārṣāpaṇa.🔽When the Buddha was alive, twenty māṣas were considered to be one kārṣāpaṇa.

original: k'ar sh'a pa na gcig tu brtsi ba'i tshe /🔽ma sha ka lngas pham mo zhes chad btsugs pa bzhin du deng sang yul gang na'ang rung ste /
analyzed: k'ar sh'a pa na gcig tu brtsi ba'i tshe / ma sha ka lngas pham mo zhes chad btsugs pa bzhin du deng sang yul gang na'ang rung ste /
translated: When the value of twenty māṣas was equal to one kārṣāpaṇa,🔽the rule was established that five māṣas were equal to one paṇa.

original: sngon bzhin du ma bri ba zhig yod na yang de bzhin du brtsi'o //
analyzed: sngon bzhin du ma bri ba zhig yod na yang de bzhin du brtsi'o //
translated: Even today, in any country where the value of twenty māṣas has not decreased as in the past, it should be calculated in the same way.

original: rku ba'i tshe gnas dang dus su brtsi zhing bca'/
analyzed: rku ba'i tshe gnas dang dus su brtsi zhing bca'/
translated: When stealing, the value is calculated according to place and time.

original: dge slong gis rkun po zhig byas na gnas ga la 'dug pa'i yul thang dang / dbyar dgun ston dpyid kyi dus na /
analyzed: dge slong gis rkun po zhig byas na gnas ga la 'dug pa'i yul thang dang / dbyar dgun ston dpyid kyi dus na /
translated: If a monk commits a theft, the value is calculated according to the place where he resides and the season—whether it is summer, winter, autumn, or spring.

original: pa na'i rin che chung cir gyur pa bzhin du rin thang brtsi'o //
analyzed: pa na'i rin che chung cir gyur pa bzhin du rin thang brtsi'o //
translated: The value is calculated according to the current price of the stolen item.

original: ltag nas mdo 'di dang 'dra ba zhig 'byung ba dang gnyis la ltag ma ni nas 'bras lta bu gnas dang dus su brtsi ba la bya /
analyzed: ltag nas mdo 'di dang 'dra ba zhig 'byung ba dang gnyis la ltag ma ni nas 'bras lta bu gnas dang dus su brtsi ba la bya /
translated: There is a similar passage at the end of the text, but the end refers to calculating the value according to place and time, like barley and rice.

original: 'di ni pa na nyid gnas dang dus su brtsi ba la bya /
analyzed: 'di ni pa na nyid gnas dang dus su brtsi ba la bya /
translated: This refers to calculating the value of the paṇa itself according to place and time.

original: mchog gi mthar gyur pa rin gcod mi nus ba chen po yang ngo //🔽nor rin po che rin mi chod pa zhig brkus na yang pham par mi 'gyur ba ma yin te srang grangs mang zhes pham pa'i grangs mang ba ma yin te pham pa ni gcig / de chung du yang 'khyams @58b pa la yin gyi nang du chud do
analyzed: mchog gi mthar gyur pa rin gcod mi nus ba chen po yang ngo // nor rin po che rin mi chod pa zhig brkus na yang pham par mi 'gyur ba ma yin te srang grangs mang zhes pham pa'i grangs mang ba ma yin te pham pa ni gcig / de chung du yang 'khyams @58b pa la yin gyi nang du chud do
translated: The supreme limit is the great one that cannot be evaluated.🔽Even if one steals a precious jewel of great value, it is not that one does not commit a transgression.🔽But it is not that the number of defeats is many, for there is only one defeat.🔽If one steals a jewel of great value, one is expelled from the order.

original: // rin thang ma tshang ba til gyi 'brum bu yan chad brkus kyang nyes par mi 'gyur ba la yin gyi sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: // rin thang ma tshang ba til gyi 'brum bu yan chad brkus kyang nyes par mi 'gyur ba la yin gyi sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: If one steals a jewel of small value, one commits a serious transgression.

original: sangs rgyas kyi ring bsrel gdab tu med pa'i rin po che de'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ring bsrel gdab tu med pa'i rin po che de'o //
translated: The jewel of the Buddha's relics is priceless.

original: sangs rgyas kyi ring bsrel yang rin thang gdab tu med par che ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ring bsrel yang rin thang gdab tu med par che ste /
translated: The relics of the Buddha are also of great value.

original: brkus na nor bu rin po che rin gdab tu med pa brkus pa dang 'dra ste pham par 'gyur /
analyzed: brkus na nor bu rin po che rin gdab tu med pa brkus pa dang 'dra ste pham par 'gyur /
translated: If one steals them, it is like stealing a priceless jewel and one commits a defeat.

original: mchod pa'i phyir na nyes byas pa'o //
analyzed: mchod pa'i phyir na nyes byas pa'o //
translated: If one steals them for the purpose of worship, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: rku sems med par sangs rgyas kyi ring bsrel mchod pa'i phyir khyer na nyes byas /
analyzed: rku sems med par sangs rgyas kyi ring bsrel mchod pa'i phyir khyer na nyes byas /
translated: If one takes it without a thieving mind in order to worship the Buddha’s relics, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: rku sems kyis khyer na pham /
analyzed: rku sems kyis khyer na pham /
translated: If one takes it with a thieving mind, there is a root downfall.

original: bris pa ni nyes med do //
analyzed: bris pa ni nyes med do //
translated: If it is a drawing, there is no offense.

original: lha'i yi ge dpe brnyar mi ster ba thug thub tu blangs te dpe 'dris te slar bskyal ba ni nyes med do //
analyzed: lha'i yi ge dpe brnyar mi ster ba thug thub tu blangs te dpe 'dris te slar bskyal ba ni nyes med do //
translated: If one borrows a divine text without permission, but returns it after memorizing it, there is no offense.

original: lha'i yi ger rku sems kyis thal byung khyer na pham /
analyzed: lha'i yi ger rku sems kyis thal byung khyer na pham /
translated: If one takes a divine text with a thieving mind, there is a root downfall.

original: chud gsan nas rku na de'i tshe rku ba'i dngos po /
analyzed: chud gsan nas rku na de'i tshe rku ba'i dngos po /
translated: If one steals after having memorized it, then at that time the object of the theft

original: nor phral la bcom dral te brkus na bcom zin pa la ci ri ba'i rin thang gi thang du brtsi /
analyzed: nor phral la bcom dral te brkus na bcom zin pa la ci ri ba'i rin thang gi thang du brtsi /
translated: is the value of the text, which is determined by the price of the paper, ink, and so on.

original: mdo 'di yan chad ni nor gyi dngos po las pham par 'gyur ram mi 'gyur ba 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: mdo 'di yan chad ni nor gyi dngos po las pham par 'gyur ram mi 'gyur ba 'chad pa'o //
translated: Up to this point, this chapter has explained whether or not there is a root downfall in relation to the object of theft.

original: bdag po med pa ni byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi'o //
analyzed: bdag po med pa ni byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi'o //
translated: That which belongs to no one is that of Uttarakuru.

original: byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi nor lta bu ni bdag gi yin par sems pa med pa'i phyir bdag po med pa'i nor dang 'dra ste ci bder spyad du rung ngo //
analyzed: byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi nor lta bu ni bdag gi yin par sems pa med pa'i phyir bdag po med pa'i nor dang 'dra ste ci bder spyad du rung ngo //
translated: The wealth of Uttarakuru is like wealth without an owner, for no one thinks of it as his own. It is like a public park.

original: rku sems kyis spyad na sbom po'o //
analyzed: rku sems kyis spyad na sbom po'o //
translated: If one uses it with the intention of stealing it, there is a serious transgression.

original: de ni bdag gi bzhin no //
analyzed: de ni bdag gi bzhin no //
translated: It is like my own wealth.

original: byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi nor ni bdag gi nor brkus na sbom por 'gyur ba bzhin du rku sems kyis blangs na sbom po /
analyzed: byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi nor ni bdag gi nor brkus na sbom por 'gyur ba bzhin du rku sems kyis blangs na sbom po /
translated: If one takes the wealth of Uttarakuru with the intention of stealing it, there is a serious transgression.

original: de'i tshe bdag nyid bdag po'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe bdag nyid bdag po'o //
translated: At that time, one is oneself the owner.

original: dge slong gcig cig lhung bzed la chags te shi ba dang lhung bzed de'i nang du sprul du skyes so //
analyzed: dge slong gcig cig lhung bzed la chags te shi ba dang lhung bzed de'i nang du sprul du skyes so //
translated: A certain monk, attached to his begging bowl, died. He was reborn as a snake in that begging bowl.

original: lhung bzed de lta bu zhig brkus na sngon gyi dge slong gi nor du mi brtsi'i sbrul gyi yin par brtsi'o //
analyzed: lhung bzed de lta bu zhig brkus na sngon gyi dge slong gi nor du mi brtsi'i sbrul gyi yin par brtsi'o //
translated: If one steals such a begging bowl, it is not considered the wealth of the former monk, but the wealth of the snake.

original: lha bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: lha bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: It is like the wealth of the gods.

original: sh'a ri'i bu dang / mood gal gyi ci ti'i gdugs dang rgyan la sogs pa phul ba ni brkus ma sbom po'o //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu dang / mood gal gyi ci ti'i gdugs dang rgyan la sogs pa phul ba ni brkus ma sbom po'o //
translated: The offering of the parasol and ornaments, etc. to Śāriputra and Maudgalyāyana is a serious transgression of stealing.

original: nor rdzas lta bu phul ba brkus na dge 'dun dbang bas pham /
analyzed: nor rdzas lta bu phul ba brkus na dge 'dun dbang bas pham /
translated: If one steals what has been offered, such as wealth and property, it is a downfall because the Sangha is the owner.

original: 'di yan chad ni nor gyi bdag po las pham mi pham 'chad pa /
analyzed: 'di yan chad ni nor gyi bdag po las pham mi pham 'chad pa /
translated: Up to this point, it has been explained whether or not there is a downfall in relation to the owner of the property.

original: gnang ste btang ba'o zhes bcad na sbyor ba bzhin /
analyzed: gnang ste btang ba'o zhes bcad na sbyor ba bzhin /
translated: If one decides that something has been given as a gift and then uses it, it is as if one had committed the act.

original: gos la sogs pa skad cig brnyas pa las yun ring du spyad de zad dam dengs par byas na sbom po //
analyzed: gos la sogs pa skad cig brnyas pa las yun ring du spyad de zad dam dengs par byas na sbom po //
translated: If one uses for a long time, until it is worn out or lost, something such as a piece of clothing that was only meant to be used for a short time, it is a serious violation.

original: gcig tu na sems kyis ma btang bar shes la /🔽nor thun mong yin no zhes te snying mi @59a * //
analyzed: gcig tu na sems kyis ma btang bar shes la / nor thun mong yin no zhes te snying mi @59a * //
translated: If one uses the property of the Sangha, thinking that it is not being used by anyone, it is a serious violation.

original: brtse bar spyad na sbom po //
analyzed: brtse bar spyad na sbom po //
translated: If one uses it without any feeling of compassion, thinking that the property is common to all, it is a serious violation.

original: sman dang sngags kyis sbyin du bcug na yang ngo //
analyzed: sman dang sngags kyis sbyin du bcug na yang ngo //
translated: If one makes someone else give by using spells or medicine, it is also a serious violation.

original: kho'i sems bsgyur ba'i phyir sngags sam sman byin te bdag la nor sbyin du bcug na sbom po'o //🔽pha rol gyi phyir na yang rtsa ba'i brtsams pa'o //
analyzed: kho'i sems bsgyur ba'i phyir sngags sam sman byin te bdag la nor sbyin du bcug na sbom po'o // pha rol gyi phyir na yang rtsa ba'i brtsams pa'o //
translated: If one gives spells or medicine to someone in order to make him give one’s own property, it is a serious violation.🔽If one steals in order to give to others, it is a serious violation.

original: gzhan gyi nor du bya ba'i phyir brkus na yang sbom po //🔽brtags pa yang ngo //
analyzed: gzhan gyi nor du bya ba'i phyir brkus na yang sbom po //🔽brtags pa yang ngo //
translated: If one steals in order to make a profit, it is a serious violation.

original: mi chus khyer ba phyung ba lta bu khos srog blug ma byin pa la 'di tsam gyis chod cig bdag dbang grang zhes te thug thub tu nor khyer na sbom po //
analyzed: mi chus khyer ba phyung ba lta bu khos srog blug ma byin pa la 'di tsam gyis chod cig bdag dbang grang zhes te thug thub tu nor khyer na sbom po //
translated: If one carries off the wealth of a thief who has stolen the wealth of another, it is a serious transgression.

original: 'dod pa bdams la rku bar 'dod na yang ngo //
analyzed: 'dod pa bdams la rku bar 'dod na yang ngo //
translated: If one steals with the intention of choosing what one wants, it is also serious.🔽If one thinks, “There is much wealth here,” and chooses the best, and then steals it, it is a serious transgression.🔽If one stakes a bet and loses, it is a serious transgression.🔽If one stakes a bet and wins, it is a serious transgression.🔽If one stakes a bet and wins, it is a serious transgression.

original: nor mang po zhig 'dug pa la bzang po bdams te phyis rku bar bsams nas rkur bla bar spags te bzhag na sbom po nor re re blta zhing theg cing bzhag pa thams cad sbom po re re'o //
analyzed: nor mang po zhig 'dug pa la bzang po bdams te phyis rku bar bsams nas rkur bla bar spags te bzhag na sbom po nor re re blta zhing theg cing bzhag pa thams cad sbom po re re'o //
translated: If one stakes a bet and wins, it is a serious transgression.

original: rgyan po dor gyis rgyal bar ma gyur gyi bar du na sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: rgyan po dor gyis rgyal bar ma gyur gyi bar du na sbyor ba'o //
translated: If one stakes a bet and wins, it is a serious transgression.🔽If one stakes a bet and wins, it is a serious transgression.🔽If one stakes a bet and wins, it is a serious transgression.🔽If one stakes a bet and wins, it is a serious transgression.🔽If one stakes a bet and wins, it is a serious transgression.

original: skugs btsugs te rgyan po'am cho lo 'gyed pa la rgyal bar bya ba'i phyir thabs chung du thabs chen por bsnor nas sgyu byas pa ni sbom po //
analyzed: skugs btsugs te rgyan po'am cho lo 'gyed pa la rgyal bar bya ba'i phyir thabs chung du thabs chen por bsnor nas sgyu byas pa ni sbom po //
translated: If one stakes a bet and wins, it is a serious transgression.🔽If one stakes a bet and wins, it is a serious transgression.🔽If one stakes a bet and wins, it is a serious transgression.🔽If one stakes a bet and wins, it is a serious transgression.🔽If one stakes a bet and wins, it is a serious transgression.🔽If one stakes a bet and wins, it is a serious transgression.🔽If one stakes a bet and wins, it is a serious transgression.🔽If one stakes a bet and wins, it is a serious transgression.🔽If one stakes a bet and wins, it is a serious transgression.🔽If one stakes a bet and wins, it is a serious transgression.🔽If one stakes a bet and wins, it is a serious transgression.🔽If one stakes a bet and wins, it is a serious transgression.🔽If one stakes a bet and wins, it is a serious transgression.🔽If one stakes a bet and wins, it is a serious transgression.🔽If one stakes a bet and wins, it is a serious transgression.🔽If one stakes a bet and wins, it is a serious transgression.🔽If one stakes a bet and wins, it is a serious transgression.🔽If one stakes a bet and wins, it is a serious transgression.🔽If one stakes a bet and wins, it is a serious transgression.

original: thabs bsnor cing g-yo du byas pa re re sbom po //🔽de ni der ba brkus pa'o //
analyzed: thabs bsnor cing g-yo du byas pa re re sbom po //🔽de ni der ba brkus pa'o //
translated: If one stakes a bet and wins, it is a serious transgression.🔽If one stakes a bet and wins

original: mdo ltag ma ltar g-yo byas nas de'i stobs kyis bdag rgyal ba'i ltang ma tshang na pham /🔽grangs kyi na'ang de'i'o //
analyzed: mdo ltag ma ltar g-yo byas nas de'i stobs kyis bdag rgyal ba'i ltang ma tshang na pham / grangs kyi na'ang de'i'o //
translated: If one moves the tally stick in the manner of the tally stick of the king, and by its power one wins, then one loses.🔽If one steals the tally stick of the king, one loses.

original: bdag rgyal bar bya 'dod pa'i phyir rgyan po'i rdo grangs brkus pa dang nor rdzas bgrang ba'i grangs brkus pa ni rku ba'i tshe nyes byas /
analyzed: bdag rgyal bar bya 'dod pa'i phyir rgyan po'i rdo grangs brkus pa dang nor rdzas bgrang ba'i grangs brkus pa ni rku ba'i tshe nyes byas /
translated: If one steals the tally stick of the king in order to win, then at the time of stealing it is a misdeed.

original: shod las bsnan tam phri na de bzhin no //
analyzed: shod las bsnan tam phri na de bzhin no //
translated: If one adds or subtracts from the tally, it is the same.

original: bdag rgyal bar bya ba'i phyir rtsis byed blta bu la shod las bsnan tam phrin na de'i tshe nyes byas gnas bsnor te bzhag na rtsis byed pa la /
analyzed: bdag rgyal bar bya ba'i phyir rtsis byed blta bu la shod las bsnan tam phrin na de'i tshe nyes byas gnas bsnor te bzhag na rtsis byed pa la /
translated: If one adds or subtracts from the tally in order to win, then at the time of adding or subtracting it is a misdeed.

original: bdag rgyal bar byed pa'i phyir bcu shod dang brgya shod kyi go bsnor na nyes byas /
analyzed: bdag rgyal bar byed pa'i phyir bcu shod dang brgya shod kyi go bsnor na nyes byas /
translated: If one exchanges the tally of a hundred for the tally of ten in order to win, then it is a misdeed.

original: de dag grub na brkus /
analyzed: de dag grub na brkus /
translated: If one accomplishes those, one steals.

original: mdo ltag ma gsum ltar g-yo byas te grub nas nor bdag gi lag tu thob na pham mo //
analyzed: mdo ltag ma gsum ltar g-yo byas te grub nas nor bdag gi lag tu thob na pham mo //
translated: If one moves the tally stick in the manner of the three tally sticks of the king, and one accomplishes it, and the owner of the wealth obtains it in his hand, then one loses.

original: sbom po re re yang yod do //
analyzed: sbom po re re yang yod do //
translated: There is also a serious violation for each.

original: sde'i nang du brtsis na yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: sde'i nang du brtsis na yang de bzhin no //
translated: If one counts it in the midst of the Saṅgha, it is the same.

original: yon bdag gis dge 'dun kha gnyis nas spyan drangs te yon kyang so sor phul ba las kha gnyis ka nas skal ba blang ba'i phyir pha rol tshul rol gnyis kar gtogs par g-yo byas nas de'i tshe nyes byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yon bdag gis dge 'dun kha gnyis nas spyan drangs te yon kyang so sor phul ba las kha gnyis ka nas skal ba blang ba'i phyir pha rol tshul rol gnyis kar gtogs par g-yo byas nas de'i tshe nyes byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: If a patron invites two or more saṅghas and offers gifts to each, then if one receives a share from both, one commits an offense of wrong conduct for deceiving both sides.

original: sgyus snga mar na phyi mar phyi mar na snga mar yang ngo //
analyzed: sgyus snga mar na phyi mar phyi mar na snga mar yang ngo //
translated: If one deceives by saying the opposite, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: dge 'dun yon snga phyir @59b 'god pa la snga ma'i nang du yang /
analyzed: dge 'dun yon snga phyir @59b 'god pa la snga ma'i nang du yang /
translated: If the saṅgha is offered gifts at different times, one should not say,🔽“I belong to the earlier saṅgha,” and then receive a share from the later saṅgha, or say,

original: nga 'di'i nang du gtogs so zhes zer phyi ma'i nang du snga ma las ma thob ste 'dir gtogs so zhes zer zhing /
analyzed: nga 'di'i nang du gtogs so zhes zer phyi ma'i nang du snga ma las ma thob ste 'dir gtogs so zhes zer zhing /
translated: “I belong to the later saṅgha,” and then receive a share from the earlier saṅgha.

original: yon kha gnyis blangs shing sgyu byed pa'i tshe nyes byas /
analyzed: yon kha gnyis blangs shing sgyu byed pa'i tshe nyes byas /
translated: If one receives a share from both, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: gang du de thams cad de thog mar byung ba de skal pa'o //
analyzed: gang du de thams cad de thog mar byung ba de skal pa'o //
translated: The share that one receives from the saṅgha that one belongs to is one’s own share.

original: mdo ltag ma gnyis ltar yon kha gnyis su 'god pa la gang nas kyang rung bdag gi skal ba gang sngar thob pa las mi dbang ngo //
analyzed: mdo ltag ma gnyis ltar yon kha gnyis su 'god pa la gang nas kyang rung bdag gi skal ba gang sngar thob pa las mi dbang ngo //
translated: If one receives a share from both saṅghas, as in the two previous cases, one should not receive a share from the saṅgha that one belongs to.

original: kha gnyis ka las blangs na pham par 'gyur /
analyzed: kha gnyis ka las blangs na pham par 'gyur /
translated: If one accepts it from both, one is defeated.

original: mi 'thob pa las thob po zhes zer ba yang ngo //
analyzed: mi 'thob pa las thob po zhes zer ba yang ngo //
translated: If one says, “I have obtained it from one who has not obtained it,” one is defeated.

original: tshul du zhugs nas zla ba phyed dang gnyis su ma lon par tshul dral ba la yang bla /🔽tshul gyi tshe gud nas 'ongs te /
analyzed: tshul du zhugs nas zla ba phyed dang gnyis su ma lon par tshul dral ba la yang bla / tshul gyi tshe gud nas 'ongs te /
translated: If one says, “I have entered the system, but I have not completed the two and a half months and I have left the system,” one is defeated.🔽If one says, “I have entered the system, but I have not completed the two and a half months and I have come from another monastery,” one is defeated.

original: zla ba phyed dang gnyis su ma lon pa dge 'dun zas ma gtogs par nor 'god do cog la mi dbang /
analyzed: zla ba phyed dang gnyis su ma lon pa dge 'dun zas ma gtogs par nor 'god do cog la mi dbang /
translated: If one says, “I have completed the two and a half months, but I have no authority over the wealth of the saṅgha except for food,” one is defeated.

original: zla ba phyed dang gnyis lon pa ni mi gcig gi skal ba phyed dbang /
analyzed: zla ba phyed dang gnyis lon pa ni mi gcig gi skal ba phyed dbang /
translated: If one says, “I have completed the two and a half months and I have authority over half of the portion of one person,” one is defeated.🔽If one says, “I have completed the two and a half months and I have authority over more than that,” one is defeated.

original: phyed dang gnyis las lhag pa ni gzhan dang 'dra bar dbang de ltar mi thob par shes bzhin du dbang ngo zhes zer zhing 'thob par byed pa'i tshe nyes byas /
analyzed: phyed dang gnyis las lhag pa ni gzhan dang 'dra bar dbang de ltar mi thob par shes bzhin du dbang ngo zhes zer zhing 'thob par byed pa'i tshe nyes byas /
translated: If one says, “I have not obtained the authority, but I will obtain it,” one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: ma bsgo bar slong ba yang ngo //
analyzed: ma bsgo bar slong ba yang ngo //
translated: If one asks for something without permission, one is defeated.

original: nor bdag gis khyer cig par ma bsgo bar g-yog lta bu'i gan du nor 'di yang byings kyis blang ngo zhes byas na slong ba'i tshe nyes byas thob na pham /🔽bsnyon pa ni brnyas pa dang bskyis pa dang gtams pa ni sbyor ba'o //🔽gzhan gyi rdzas las brnyas sam bskyis sam gtams pa las bsdigs pa'i phyir bsnyon te ma sbyin par byas na sbom po //🔽chang na 'phrogs pa'o //

original: rku ba'i sems med na mthar mi 'grub po //
analyzed: rku ba'i sems med na mthar mi 'grub po //
translated: If there is no thought of stealing, the defeat is not incurred.

translated: If one thinks of stealing some wealth, but then releases it without taking it up, thinking, “I will not steal it,” there is a serious violation, but not a defeat.

original: de'i sbyor ba ni med na yang gyur pa'i tshe na ma byas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i sbyor ba ni med na yang gyur pa'i tshe na ma byas pa ma yin no //

original: rku sems med par nor zhig blangs nas 'phral la rku sems byung ste /
analyzed: rku sems med par nor zhig blangs nas 'phral la rku sems byung ste /

original: brkus na nyes byas dang sbom po ni med de pham par ni 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brkus na nyes byas dang sbom po ni med de pham par ni 'gyur ro //
translated: if one steals it, there is a serious violation and a downfall, but not a defeat.

original: yi ge la sogs pas kyang mi 'dri'o //
analyzed: yi ge la sogs pas kyang mi 'dri'o //

original: yi ge dang lag brda lta bus rkus shig par bstan nas des brkus na yang pham /
analyzed: yi ge dang lag brda lta bus rkus shig par bstan nas des brkus na yang pham /
translated: If one indicates by means of writing, gestures, and so on, “Steal this,” and the other person steals it, there is a defeat.

original: mthu dang bcad na yang ma brkus pa ma yin /
analyzed: mthu dang bcad na yang ma brkus pa ma yin /
translated: Even if one steals by force, it is not the case that there is no stealing.

original: glar blangs te las byed byas pa las mthu bsnyems te gla ma byin na pham mo //
analyzed: glar blangs te las byed byas pa las mthu bsnyems te gla ma byin na pham mo //
translated: If one says, “I will pay you a wage,” and then, after the work is done, one does not pay the wage, there is a defeat.

original: gnas dang bcas na'ang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gnas dang bcas na'ang mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not suitable even if the place is included.

original: nor nyid bteg na pham gyis dogs pa'i phyir gzhi dang bcas te brkus na yang pham /
analyzed: nor nyid bteg na pham gyis dogs pa'i phyir gzhi dang bcas te brkus na yang pham /
translated: If one steals with the basis, that is, if one steals the wealth of a human, one commits a partial defeat, because one fears defeat.

original: bsad pa ni brkus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bsad pa ni brkus pa ma yin no //
translated: Killing is not stealing.

original: mi'i nor du gtogs pa'i sems can gyol song chud gsan pa'i phyir bsad na'ang rin che chung mtshungs te sbom po mi ma yin pa'i nor byol song bsad na'ang ltung ba'o //

translated: If one kills a sentient being that is included in human wealth, such as a cow, one commits a serious violation, because the value is the same as that of a human. If one kills an animal that is not human wealth, one commits an offense.

original: phyogs gcig gnas nas ma 'phags na'ang ma yin /
analyzed: phyogs gcig gnas nas ma 'phags na'ang ma yin /
translated: If one does not move it from its place, one does not commit a partial defeat.

original: nor rdzas rku ba'i phyir bteg pa ngos gcig ni bteg ngos gcig ni gzhi las ma 'phags kyi bar du na pham par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: nor rdzas rku ba'i phyir bteg pa ngos gcig ni bteg ngos gcig ni gzhi las ma 'phags kyi bar du na pham par mi 'gyur /
translated: If one steals wealth, but does not move it from its place, one does not commit a partial defeat as long as one does not move it from its place.

original: sprugs te lhung na'ang de brkus pa'o //
analyzed: sprugs te lhung na'ang de brkus pa'o //
translated: If one shakes it and it falls, one commits a partial defeat.

original: ra ba so so la rtsig sga kha gcig ste rab gcig gi nang nas bza' shing skyes te /
analyzed: ra ba so so la rtsig sga kha gcig ste rab gcig gi nang nas bza' shing skyes te /
translated: If a tree grows in a fence,

analyzed: yal ga dag gi rtsig sgal 'das te 'dug pa la shing thog rku ba'i phyir shing sprugs te bdag gi ra ba'i nang du ltung ste /
