original: rin thang tshang na pham /
analyzed: rin thang tshang na pham /
translated: If the value is complete, there is a defeat.

original: sprugs pa ni phru lu lu tsha ra ra 'ongs na'o //
analyzed: sprugs pa ni phru lu lu tsha ra ra 'ongs na'o //
translated: Shaking means when the barley or wheat is shaken and the chaff flies away.

original: chang ngam nas lta bu'i snod rdol te phru lu lu tsa ra ra 'ongs pa mjug ma chad kyi bar du bdag gi snod du 'ongs pa rin thang tshang yang mi pham rdzas de mjug rdzogs nas spyir ro //
analyzed: chang ngam nas lta bu'i snod rdol te phru lu lu tsa ra ra 'ongs pa mjug ma chad kyi bar du bdag gi snod du 'ongs pa rin thang tshang yang mi pham rdzas de mjug rdzogs nas spyir ro //
translated: If a vessel such as a beer or grain container has a hole and the barley or wheat is shaken and flies away, until the tail of the barley or wheat is cut, the barley or wheat that comes into one’s vessel is not defeated even if the value is complete.

original: mdo ltag ma ltar phru lu lur 'ong ba rgyun chad de bdag gi lag tu 'ongs pa na rin thang tshang na pham /
analyzed: mdo ltag ma ltar phru lu lur 'ong ba rgyun chad de bdag gi lag tu 'ongs pa na rin thang tshang na pham /
translated: If the barley or wheat that is shaken and flies away from the top of the container is cut off and comes into one’s hand, if the value is complete, there is a defeat.

original: phung po las yang yang len na rku ba tha dad do //
analyzed: phung po las yang yang len na rku ba tha dad do //
translated: If one takes it again and again from a heap, the stealing is separate.

original: nas lta bu phung por 'dug pa las blangs te brkus nas yang rku sems skyes te blangs pa lta bur rku sems res lan du mar blangs na /
analyzed: nas lta bu phung por 'dug pa las blangs te brkus nas yang rku sems skyes te blangs pa lta bur rku sems res lan du mar blangs na /
translated: For example, if one takes it from a heap of barley and steals it, and then again a thought to steal arises and one takes it, if one takes it many times with each thought to steal,

analyzed: blangs pa de'i so sor rin thang brtsis te tshang na pham /

original: ma tshang na sbom po //
analyzed: ma tshang na sbom po //

analyzed: phung po las yang yang re re phung po gcig ril gyis brku bar bsams te len du ma zhig @61a * //

analyzed: blangs te so sor rin thang tshang yang mi pham /

original: phung po zad na pham /
analyzed: phung po zad na pham /

original: phral ba du ma na so so de'i cha'o //
analyzed: phral ba du ma na so so de'i cha'o //
translated: If they are divided into many parts, each part is a portion of that.

original: mi mang po zhig gi spyi la nor 'dug pa zhig brkus na /
analyzed: mi mang po zhig gi spyi la nor 'dug pa zhig brkus na /
translated: If many people steal a treasure that belongs to the community,

analyzed: nor bdag gcig gi nor la dge slong mang po zhig gis brkus na /

analyzed: rin thang tshang na pham / ma byin par len pa'i phas pham pa ste dris par gtogs pa'o //

original: ma byin par len pa'i phas pham pa ste /
analyzed: ma byin par len pa'i phas pham pa ste /
translated: This is the father-like defeat of taking what was not given.

analyzed: 'phags pa au p'a lis dris pa'i 'dul ba'i mdo /

translated: When the Saṅgha is distributing property,🔽if a sick monk dies, the nurse should distribute the property and take it.🔽If the sick person has died before the distribution,

analyzed: nad pa dbugs chad pa ni nor skal de dge 'dun dbang ste slar dbul lo //

original: nor 'god pa'i tshe khyim par babs pa zhig na'ang nor de khyim par babs pa sbyin no //
analyzed: nor 'god pa'i tshe khyim par babs pa zhig na'ang nor de khyim par babs pa sbyin no //
translated: When wealth is distributed, if the deceased was a layperson, the wealth is given to laypeople.

original: dge 'dun spun bzhin pas de'i phyir brkus na'ang bdag gir ma byas pa ma yin no //🔽dge 'dun pa 'tsho ba'i yo byad gcig tu sbyar ba la de'i nang nas dge slong gcig gis /🔽dge 'dun de rnams kyi phyir gzhan las nor zhig brkus na yang rin thang brtsis te rin thang tshang na bdag kyang der gtogs pas pham /
analyzed: dge 'dun spun bzhin pas de'i phyir brkus na'ang bdag gir ma byas pa ma yin no // dge 'dun pa 'tsho ba'i yo byad gcig tu sbyar ba la de'i nang nas dge slong gcig gis / dge 'dun de rnams kyi phyir gzhan las nor zhig brkus na yang rin thang brtsis te rin thang tshang na bdag kyang der gtogs pas pham /
translated: If it is stolen by a monk who is like a brother of the Saṅgha, then it is not considered to be not taken.🔽If a single article is applied to the Saṅgha’s requisites for living, then if a single monk steals wealth from that for the sake of the Saṅgha, then if the value is complete, he is defeated, because he is included in that.🔽If a single monk steals wealth from that for the sake of the Saṅgha, then if the value is complete, he is defeated, because he is included in that.

original: dge 'dun 'tsho ba'i yo byad gcig tu sbyar ba de'i dge slong gcig gis dge 'dun de nyid kyi nor las gzhan sbyin pa'i phyir brkus pa ni sbom po /
analyzed: dge 'dun 'tsho ba'i yo byad gcig tu sbyar ba de'i dge slong gcig gis dge 'dun de nyid kyi nor las gzhan sbyin pa'i phyir brkus pa ni sbom po /
translated: If a single monk steals wealth from that for the sake of the Saṅgha, then if the value is complete, he is defeated, because he is included in that.

original: bdag po tha mi dad na bdag gi bzhin no //
analyzed: bdag po tha mi dad na bdag gi bzhin no //
translated: If the owners are not distinct, then it is like that of the owner.

original: yon bdag gcig la dge 'dun kha gnyis su 'khod de kha zas kyis mi thub na /
analyzed: yon bdag gcig la dge 'dun kha gnyis su 'khod de kha zas kyis mi thub na /
translated: If two factions of the saṅgha are seated in the presence of a single patron and are unable to eat because of a lack of food,

original: rgyu dag brel brel du 'chugs pa zhig na /
analyzed: rgyu dag brel brel du 'chugs pa zhig na /
translated: if one faction is in a hurry to leave,

original: @61b nor rdzas gcig las brkus te gcig tu bsnan na sbom po /
analyzed: @61b nor rdzas gcig las brkus te gcig tu bsnan na sbom po /
translated: if one takes and adds to the other what was stolen from a single source, it is a serious transgression.

original: mi len par chad de byung nas lhag nas brkus na de'i yan lag tu ma yin no //🔽rkun po byed pa zhig tu bdag rkun zlar nan gyis bcug ste rkun po mi bya bar bsams pa las rkun zlas bsad kyis dogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi len par chad de byung nas lhag nas brkus na de'i yan lag tu ma yin no // rkun po byed pa zhig tu bdag rkun zlar nan gyis bcug ste rkun po mi bya bar bsams pa las rkun zlas bsad kyis dogs pa'i phyir /
translated: If one steals what remains after the other has taken without taking it oneself, it is not a branch of that.🔽If one is forced to join a group of thieves, but does not intend to steal,🔽one may go along with the thieves for fear of being killed by them.

original: rkun po byed pa'i nang du 'drol te /🔽song nas rku sems kyang med /
analyzed: rkun po byed pa'i nang du 'drol te / song nas rku sems kyang med /
translated: If one goes along with them, but has no intention of stealing,

original: nor skal yang ma blangs na nyes med /
analyzed: nor skal yang ma blangs na nyes med /
translated: and does not take any of the loot, there is no fault.

original: shas bdag gir byed par 'dod na mi len pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shas bdag gir byed par 'dod na mi len pa ma yin no //
translated: If one wishes to take a share, it is not the case that one does not take it.

original: bdag rkun por ni ma song gi / rkun shas 'dod pa'i phyir gros la gtogs te gzhan gyis brkus pa'i shas blangs na'ang pham /
analyzed: bdag rkun por ni ma song gi / rkun shas 'dod pa'i phyir gros la gtogs te gzhan gyis brkus pa'i shas blangs na'ang pham /
translated: If one has not gone over to the thieves, but joins them in order to get a share, and takes a share when others have stolen, one commits an offense entailing defeat.

original: de'i las su gtogs na de ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i las su gtogs na de ma yin no //
translated: If one is included in their group, it is not the case that one is not.

original: rkun po byed pa'i las la gtogs te chung du bya ra tsam byas kyang rung ste /
analyzed: rkun po byed pa'i las la gtogs te chung du bya ra tsam byas kyang rung ste /
translated: If one engages in the action of stealing, even if one steals a small amount, it is sufficient.

original: rkun shas blangs na yang pham /
analyzed: rkun shas blangs na yang pham /
translated: If one takes the value of the theft, one commits a defeating offense.

original: lhan cig tu spyod pa dang nye gnas brkus na'ang mi 'byung zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: lhan cig tu spyod pa dang nye gnas brkus na'ang mi 'byung zhes mi bya'o //
translated: It is not the case that if one's companion or student steals, one does not commit a defeating offense.

original: bdag gi slob ma dang nye gnas kyis brkus pa las slar thug thub tu phrogs na pham mo zhes byi shu tas bshad /
analyzed: bdag gi slob ma dang nye gnas kyis brkus pa las slar thug thub tu phrogs na pham mo zhes byi shu tas bshad /
translated: Vishnu says that if one's student or companion steals and one takes it back, one commits a defeating offense.

original: nyes byas so zhes byi tsa ya bar mas bshad /
analyzed: nyes byas so zhes byi tsa ya bar mas bshad /
translated: Vishnu's son says that it is a minor offense.

original: chung ba ni mtshams brtsan no //
analyzed: chung ba ni mtshams brtsan no //
translated: The small one is the boundary.

original: zhing rku ba ni 'di tsam tshun chad brku 'o zhes mtshan ma btsugs te brkus pas pham /
analyzed: zhing rku ba ni 'di tsam tshun chad brku 'o zhes mtshan ma btsugs te brkus pas pham /
translated: If one steals a field, having set a boundary marker, saying, I will steal up to this point, one commits a defeating offense.

original: nor bdag gis ma btang ste zhal ce 'gyed pa ni ltag ma dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: nor bdag gis ma btang ste zhal ce 'gyed pa ni ltag ma dang 'dra'o //
translated: If the owner does not give permission and one disputes the matter, it is like the previous case.

original: mtshams ni btsugs pa las bskyod na 'dir ma gtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mtshams ni btsugs pa las bskyod na 'dir ma gtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: If one moves the boundary marker, one commits a defeating offense, but not if one moves it from its original location.

original: zhing gi mu'am mtshams sam mtshan ma bsgyur te btsugs nas /
analyzed: zhing gi mu'am mtshams sam mtshan ma bsgyur te btsugs nas /
translated: If one changes the field's boundary marker or boundary and sets a new one,

original: de tshun chad la rin thang brtsis te tshang na pham /
analyzed: de tshun chad la rin thang brtsis te tshang na pham /
translated: if the value of the field exceeds the threshold, one commits a defeating offense.

original: mngon par blangs kyang mi snang na brkus pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par blangs kyang mi snang na brkus pa'o //
translated: If one takes it, but it does not appear, it is stealing.

original: mthong bzhin du brkus nas song ba ni nor bdag mi snang bar gyur na pham /
analyzed: mthong bzhin du brkus nas song ba ni nor bdag mi snang bar gyur na pham /
translated: If one steals after seeing it, but the owner of the treasure does not see it, there is a defeat.

original: mi stobs kyis gzung na dbang du byas na'o //
analyzed: mi stobs kyis gzung na dbang du byas na'o //
translated: If one steals after being seized by a powerful man, there is a defeat.🔽If one steals after being seized by a powerful man, but does not flee, there is a defeat.

original: mi mthus bzung ste brkus pa ni slar mi 'bros par gyur na pham /🔽gcig tu na bdag gis ci byas pa bzhin du nyan cing byed na pham /🔽bdag ni de ltar ma yin no //
analyzed: mi mthus bzung ste brkus pa ni slar mi 'bros par gyur na pham / gcig tu na bdag gis ci byas pa bzhin du nyan cing byed na pham / bdag ni de ltar ma yin no //
translated: If one steals after being seized by a powerful man, but does not flee, there is a defeat.

original: bdag gzhan zhig gis brkus na'ang slar bros te 'ongs pa la nyes med /🔽gang rku bar byas pa de la 'brel pa ma bsams pa ni mi chud do //
analyzed: bdag gzhan zhig gis brkus na'ang slar bros te 'ongs pa la nyes med / gang rku bar byas pa de la 'brel pa ma bsams pa ni mi chud do //
translated: If one steals after being seized by a powerful man, but does not flee, there is a defeat.🔽If one steals after being seized by a powerful man, but does not flee, there is a defeat.🔽If one steals after being seized by a powerful man, but does not flee, there is a defeat.🔽If one steals after being seized by a powerful man, but does not flee, there is a defeat.🔽If one steals after being seized by a powerful man, but does not flee, there is a defeat.🔽If one steals after being seized by a powerful man, but does not flee, there is a defeat.🔽If one steals after being seized by a powerful man, but does not flee, there is a defeat.🔽If one steals after being seized by a powerful man, but does not flee, there is a defeat.🔽If one steals after being seized by a powerful man, but does not flee, there is a defeat.🔽If one steals after being seized by a powerful man, but does not flee, there is a defeat.🔽If one steals after being seized by a powerful man, but does not flee, there is a defeat.🔽If one steals after being seized by a powerful man, but does not flee, there is a defeat.🔽If one steals after being seized by a powerful man, but does not flee, there is a defeat.🔽If one steals after being seized by a powerful man, but does not flee, there is a defeat.

original: mi pham par bya ba'i phyir ras ngan pa rin thang ma tshang ba brkus pa las nang nas bzang po zhig byung ste /
analyzed: mi pham par bya ba'i phyir ras ngan pa rin thang ma tshang ba brkus pa las nang nas bzang po zhig byung ste /
translated: If one steals after being seized by a powerful man, but does not flee, there is a defeat.🔽If one steals after being seized by a powerful man, but does not flee, there is a defeat.🔽If one steals after being seized by a powerful man, but does not flee, there is a defeat.

original: slar bskyal na pham pa med de sbom po'o //🔽ltag @62a * //
analyzed: slar bskyal na pham pa med de sbom po'o // ltag @62a * //
translated: If one steals after being seized by a powerful man, but does not flee, there is a defeat.

original: nas kyang mdo 'di 'dra ba zhig 'byung ste gong ma ni gser dang bum pa la bya /
analyzed: nas kyang mdo 'di 'dra ba zhig 'byung ste gong ma ni gser dang bum pa la bya /
translated: If one steals after being seized by a powerful man, but does not flee

original: 'di na ras bzang ngan lta bu la bya ste bcas pa tha dad tsam du zad do //
analyzed: 'di na ras bzang ngan lta bu la bya ste bcas pa tha dad tsam du zad do //
translated: Here, it is like good or bad cloth, and it is merely a different rule.

original: sbom po ni gang gis ci blangs pa de de'i 'o zhes bcas pa las gzhan gyir brkus na'o //
analyzed: sbom po ni gang gis ci blangs pa de de'i 'o zhes bcas pa las gzhan gyir brkus na'o //
translated: Gross is when one steals what belongs to another, having agreed that whatever is taken belongs to that person.

original: dge slong mang zhing rkun por 'dod de /
analyzed: dge slong mang zhing rkun por 'dod de /
translated: Many monks are considered thieves.🔽They agree that whatever is obtained by any means is to be taken individually.

original: lag thabs su ci thob pa so sor khyer ro zhes 'thams nas gzhan gyis ni thob bdag gis ni ma thob kyang sbom po zhes byi shu tas bshad /
analyzed: lag thabs su ci thob pa so sor khyer ro zhes 'thams nas gzhan gyis ni thob bdag gis ni ma thob kyang sbom po zhes byi shu tas bshad /
translated: If one thinks, “I did not obtain it, but another did,” and says, “It is gross,” this is explained by Bhikṣu Tsha.

original: bdag rkun zlas nan gyis bcug ste /
analyzed: bdag rkun zlas nan gyis bcug ste /
translated: If one is forced by a thief to steal,🔽and if one does not wish to steal, but goes along with the thief out of fear of being killed,

original: rku bar mi 'dod na bsad kyis dogs pa'i phyir rkun zlar ni 'gro skal ba ni rkun zla la sbyin no zhes bsams te /
analyzed: rku bar mi 'dod na bsad kyis dogs pa'i phyir rkun zlar ni 'gro skal ba ni rkun zla la sbyin no zhes bsams te /
translated: one should give one’s share to the thief.

original: rku ba'i khrod du song ste shas ma blangs na sbom po zhes byi tsa ya bar mas bshad /
analyzed: rku ba'i khrod du song ste shas ma blangs na sbom po zhes byi tsa ya bar mas bshad /
translated: If one goes among the thieves and does not take a share, it is gross. This is explained by Bhikṣu Tsha.

original: bdag po dang bcas pa'i dur khrod nas blangs na'o //
analyzed: bdag po dang bcas pa'i dur khrod nas blangs na'o //
translated: If one takes from a charnel ground that has an owner.

original: dur khrod kyi ro'i rdzas bdag po yod pa la rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: dur khrod kyi ro'i rdzas bdag po yod pa la rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four types of substances of a corpse in a charnel ground that have an owner.

original: rgyal pos 'tsho ba ro'i rdzas la gtad pa dang las byed pa'i phyir /🔽ro'i rdzas la gtad pa dang dpya 'bul ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyal pos 'tsho ba ro'i rdzas la gtad pa dang las byed pa'i phyir / ro'i rdzas la gtad pa dang dpya 'bul ba'i phyir /
translated: Because the king is entrusted with the substance of life and is the agent of punishment.🔽Because he is entrusted with the substance of life and is the one who pays taxes.

original: ro'i rdzas la gtad pa dang gsad pa'i bshed mar gtad de ro'i rdzas la byin pa'o //
analyzed: ro'i rdzas la gtad pa dang gsad pa'i bshed mar gtad de ro'i rdzas la byin pa'o //
translated: Because he is entrusted with the substance of life and is the one who is entrusted with the executioner, he is given the substance of life.

original: tha ma gshed ma dbang ba las brkus na sbom po //
analyzed: tha ma gshed ma dbang ba las brkus na sbom po //
translated: If one steals from the lowest, the one who is under the control of the executioner, it is serious.

original: gong ma gsum ni pham mo zhes t'i ka las bshad /
analyzed: gong ma gsum ni pham mo zhes t'i ka las bshad /
translated: The three above are defeats, it is explained in the Tikaka.

original: mkhan po kha cig na re ro rdzas mi gtsang zhing 'dod pa'i shas chung ba'i phyir sbom po zhes kyang bshad /
analyzed: mkhan po kha cig na re ro rdzas mi gtsang zhing 'dod pa'i shas chung ba'i phyir sbom po zhes kyang bshad /
translated: Some preceptors explain that it is serious because the substance of life is impure and has little of the quality of desire.

original: rtsa ba dang rngo gu dang sdong po dang lo ma dang / me tog dang 'bras bu dang skye shing la sogs pa sngags kyis bskams na yang ngo //
analyzed: rtsa ba dang rngo gu dang sdong po dang lo ma dang / me tog dang 'bras bu dang skye shing la sogs pa sngags kyis bskams na yang ngo //
translated: If one dries up roots, tubers, trunks, leaves, flowers, fruits, trees, and so on, with mantra, it is also so.

original: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams lta bu mi'i nor zhig la chud gsan pa'i phyir sngags btab ste skams sam rul bar byas na sbom po //
analyzed: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams lta bu mi'i nor zhig la chud gsan pa'i phyir sngags btab ste skams sam rul bar byas na sbom po //
translated: If one dries up or rots with mantra the wealth of humans, such as that mentioned by name, for the sake of causing loss, it is serious.

original: 'bru'am yal ga so so gcig nas bskams na yang skam pa re re sbom po re re /🔽rta la kham gyis brid cing sbyin nam bzhon te rku bar 'di ltar rku bar ro zhes nas lus kyis zhon na'o //🔽rta brku ba'i phyir rtsvas brid de bzhon pa'am bkri ba'am 'di ltar spyad do zhes sems kyis brku'o zhes bsams na /
analyzed: 'bru'am yal ga so so gcig nas bskams na yang skam pa re re sbom po re re / rta la kham gyis brid cing sbyin nam bzhon te rku bar 'di ltar rku bar ro zhes nas lus kyis zhon na'o // rta brku ba'i phyir rtsvas brid de bzhon pa'am bkri ba'am 'di ltar spyad do zhes sems kyis brku'o zhes bsams na /
translated: If one dries a single grain or branch, it is a serious offense for each dried one.🔽If one steals a horse by deceiving it with grass, or by riding it, or by stealing it, thinking, “I will steal it in this way,” then one commits a serious offense by riding it with one’s body.

original: rta la ma reg kyang sbom po /
analyzed: rta la ma reg kyang sbom po /
translated: If one steals a horse by deceiving it with grass, thinking, “I will ride it or lead it in this way,” or if one steals it by thinking, “I will steal it in this way,” then even if one does not touch the horse, it is a serious offense.

original: gru yang ngo //
analyzed: gru yang ngo //
translated: A boat is also like that.

original: gru mig snga na 'dug la lus kyis skya ba'i thabs dang drang ba 'dra bar spyad de 'di ltar byas te brku'o zhes sems la bsams na ma reg kyang sbom po /
analyzed: gru mig snga na 'dug la lus kyis skya ba'i thabs dang drang ba 'dra bar spyad de 'di ltar byas te brku'o zhes sems la bsams na ma reg kyang sbom po /
translated: If one steals a boat, thinking, “I will steal it in this way,” by using one’s body to row and steer it, then even if one does not touch it, it is a serious offense.

original: de dang 'di dag las kyang ngo //
analyzed: de dang 'di dag las kyang ngo //
translated: It is also like that in the case of a boat.

original: @62b gru'i nang du nor 'dug pa dang / rta la rgyan yod par mig snga na snang ba zhig la 'di ltar brku'o zhes lus kyis sad de brku'o zhes bsams na ma reg kyang sbom po /
analyzed: @62b gru'i nang du nor 'dug pa dang / rta la rgyan yod par mig snga na snang ba zhig la 'di ltar brku'o zhes lus kyis sad de brku'o zhes bsams na ma reg kyang sbom po /
translated: If one steals a boat in which there is wealth, or which has ornaments on the horse, thinking, “I will steal it in this way,” by using one’s body to row it, then even if one does not touch it, it is a serious offense.

original: pha dang ma dang spun dang sring mo dang mkhan po dang slob dpon dang mchod rten dang dge 'dun la sogs pa'i brtags te sho gam du bya ba bzlas na yang ngo //
analyzed: pha dang ma dang spun dang sring mo dang mkhan po dang slob dpon dang mchod rten dang dge 'dun la sogs pa'i brtags te sho gam du bya ba bzlas na yang ngo //
translated: If one is accused of having stolen from one's father, mother, brother, sister, preceptor, teacher, stupa, the Sangha, and so on, and one denies it, saying,

original: 'di rnams lta bu zhig las sho gam du 'gyur ba'i rdzas shig khyer khyer ba las sho gam pas ma gnang bar ci dbang ba ma sbyin na sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di rnams lta bu zhig las sho gam du 'gyur ba'i rdzas shig khyer khyer ba las sho gam pas ma gnang bar ci dbang ba ma sbyin na sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: I did not take it, then if one has taken some substance that is subject to customs duty, but the customs official does not allow it and one does not pay the duty, one commits a serious offense.

original: brnyas pa dang bskyis pa mi sbyin par brtags pa yang ngo //
analyzed: brnyas pa dang bskyis pa mi sbyin par brtags pa yang ngo //
translated: It is also if one is accused of having given a gift with contempt or having given a gift with a sense of ownership.🔽If one thinks,

original: nor rdzas shig brnyas sam bskyis pa las mi sbyin no zhes bsams pa'i tshe na sbom po //
analyzed: nor rdzas shig brnyas sam bskyis pa las mi sbyin no zhes bsams pa'i tshe na sbom po //
translated: I will not give a gift with contempt or with a sense of ownership, then at the time of giving, one commits a serious offense.🔽If one thinks,🔽I will give it later, and one denies it, saying,

original: ltag nas kyang mdo 'di 'dra ba zhig byas te ltag ma ni nor bdag lan du 'ongs pa'i tshe sbyin no snyam du sems shing bsnyon pa'i byir nga la med do zhes smras pas sbom po //
analyzed: ltag nas kyang mdo 'di 'dra ba zhig byas te ltag ma ni nor bdag lan du 'ongs pa'i tshe sbyin no snyam du sems shing bsnyon pa'i byir nga la med do zhes smras pas sbom po //
translated: I do not have it, then one commits a serious offense.

original: gzhan gyi phyir byin pa bgos na yang ngo //
analyzed: gzhan gyi phyir byin pa bgos na yang ngo //
translated: It is also if one has given to another and then takes it back.

original: dge 'dun gyi phyir spyan gzigs bskur ba las /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi phyir spyan gzigs bskur ba las /
translated: If one sends a gift for the sake of the Saṅgha,

original: dge 'dun lam phul bar bar du bgos te khyer na sbom po //
analyzed: dge 'dun lam phul bar bar du bgos te khyer na sbom po //
translated: but it is divided up and taken by the Saṅgha on the road, it is a serious offense.

original: dge slong gcig gis shing tog aa ltu ka zhig dge 'dun la bskur ba las /
analyzed: dge slong gcig gis shing tog aa ltu ka zhig dge 'dun la bskur ba las /
translated: A monk sent a single mango to the Saṅgha.🔽Before the monk died, he sent it to the Saṅgha of monks.🔽The monks who divided it up and took it committed a serious offense.

original: dge slong ni shi dge slong dge 'dun la ma phul gyi bar du bskur bskur ba'i dge slong dag gis bgos pa las bcas te nor bskur ba'ang de dang 'dra /
analyzed: dge slong ni shi dge slong dge 'dun la ma phul gyi bar du bskur bskur ba'i dge slong dag gis bgos pa las bcas te nor bskur ba'ang de dang 'dra /
translated: The same is true if one sends a gift to the Saṅgha of nuns.

original: bdag po med pa bdag po yod par 'du shes na yang ngo //
analyzed: bdag po med pa bdag po yod par 'du shes na yang ngo //
translated: If one steals something that has no owner, but one perceives that it has an owner, it is also like that.

original: nor stor ba lta bu nor bdag gi sems kyis btang ba zhig las brkus na sbom po //
analyzed: nor stor ba lta bu nor bdag gi sems kyis btang ba zhig las brkus na sbom po //
translated: If one steals something that has been lost, but the owner has not given up on it mentally, it is a serious offense.

original: nor bdag gi sems la nor yod par kyang mi dran stor bar yang mi dran pa zhig las brkus na /
analyzed: nor bdag gi sems la nor yod par kyang mi dran stor bar yang mi dran pa zhig las brkus na /
translated: If one steals something that has been lost, and the owner does not remember that he had the property, nor that it was lost,

original: thog ma nor bdag gi sems la bdag gi yin par bsams pas phyis mi dran kyang pham bsdus 'bras sran phye nya sha bca' ba la sogs pa mi 'thob pa'i bsod snyoms blangs na yang ngo //
analyzed: thog ma nor bdag gi sems la bdag gi yin par bsams pas phyis mi dran kyang pham bsdus 'bras sran phye nya sha bca' ba la sogs pa mi 'thob pa'i bsod snyoms blangs na yang ngo //
translated: If one takes alms that are not to be given, such as grain, flour, fish, or pastries, one commits a serious violation.

original: kha zas 'di rnams lta bu las dge 'dun gyi nang nas bdag gi skal ba nyid blangs la gung du spyan drangs pa'i zan skal la'ang blangs na'ang sbom po /
analyzed: kha zas 'di rnams lta bu las dge 'dun gyi nang nas bdag gi skal ba nyid blangs la gung du spyan drangs pa'i zan skal la'ang blangs na'ang sbom po /
translated: If one takes one’s own share from the Sangha’s food and then invites others to eat it, one commits a serious violation.

original: las mi 'dod pa'i phyir dge 'dun gyi nang nas byung la zan zla phogs su nos te /
analyzed: las mi 'dod pa'i phyir dge 'dun gyi nang nas byung la zan zla phogs su nos te /
translated: If one does not wish to work, one may accept food for a month from the Sangha.

original: dge 'dun las mi byed na'ang sbom po /🔽dge 'dun gyi nang du las byed kyang zan zla phogs su nos te zla phogs kyi zan skal bsags pa'i phyir @63a * //
analyzed: dge 'dun las mi byed na'ang sbom po / dge 'dun gyi nang du las byed kyang zan zla phogs su nos te zla phogs kyi zan skal bsags pa'i phyir @63a * //
translated: If one does not work for the Sangha, one commits a serious violation.🔽If one works for the Sangha, but accepts food for a month, and then stores it,

original: slar dge 'dun la ma phul bar bzhag la mgron du bos pa'i zan skal kyang zos na sbom po /
analyzed: slar dge 'dun la ma phul bar bzhag la mgron du bos pa'i zan skal kyang zos na sbom po /
translated: and if one eats the food that one has been invited to eat without offering it back to the Sangha, one commits a serious violation.

original: mi shes par gzhan gyis mi 'thob par blangs na ma yin no //
analyzed: mi shes par gzhan gyis mi 'thob par blangs na ma yin no //
translated: If one takes food that is not to be given because one is ignorant of the rule, one does not commit a misdeed.

original: bdag gud du gzhan gyis zan byin la mi shes par grogs pos zan skal nor su zin na yang slar phul na nyes med do //
analyzed: bdag gud du gzhan gyis zan byin la mi shes par grogs pos zan skal nor su zin na yang slar phul na nyes med do //
translated: If a monk, without being invited, eats the food of a fellow monk, there is no offense if he eats the share of the one who invited him.

original: ma bsgo ba na yang ma yin /
analyzed: ma bsgo ba na yang ma yin /
translated: There is no offense if he is not invited.

original: dge slong grogs shig gud du zan zar song ste bdag la zan skal ma nod cig ces ma bsgo bar bdag gis skal ba nas grogs zan zos zin par gyur te slar phul na nyes med do //
analyzed: dge slong grogs shig gud du zan zar song ste bdag la zan skal ma nod cig ces ma bsgo bar bdag gis skal ba nas grogs zan zos zin par gyur te slar phul na nyes med do //
translated: If a monk goes to eat in the house of a layperson, and the layperson does not invite him to eat, but the monk eats the share of the one who invited him, there is no offense.

original: nyes byas pa ni ma bos pa'i chos bstan to //
analyzed: nyes byas pa ni ma bos pa'i chos bstan to //
translated: There is an offense of wrong conduct for teaching the Dharma to those who have not requested it.

original: dge slong mgron du ma bos par mchod ston gyi zan zos na nyes byas /
analyzed: dge slong mgron du ma bos par mchod ston gyi zan zos na nyes byas /
translated: If a monk eats at a communal feast without being invited, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: ma bos shing ma byin par thug thub tu zos pa ci'i phyir pham par mi 'gyur zhes zer ba yod do //
analyzed: ma bos shing ma byin par thug thub tu zos pa ci'i phyir pham par mi 'gyur zhes zer ba yod do //
translated: Some say, “Why is eating without being invited or given not a defeating offense?”

original: yon bdag gi mig snga na za zhing mi sbyin pa'i sems med pas pham par mi 'gyur //
analyzed: yon bdag gi mig snga na za zhing mi sbyin pa'i sems med pas pham par mi 'gyur //
translated: Because he eats in the presence of the donor, and because he has no intention of stealing, it is not a defeating offense.

original: brku bar 'gro ba yang ngo /
analyzed: brku bar 'gro ba yang ngo /
translated: Also, when going to steal.

original: rku bar 'gro ba'i tshe nyes byas /
analyzed: rku bar 'gro ba'i tshe nyes byas /
translated: When going to steal, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: gros byed pa'ang de las tha mi dad do //
analyzed: gros byed pa'ang de las tha mi dad do //
translated: Also, when plotting, it is not different from that.

original: rku bar 'gro bar bsams nas rkun zla dang gros byed pa'i tshe yang snga ma bsams pa'i nyes byas su gtogs par zad do /
analyzed: rku bar 'gro bar bsams nas rkun zla dang gros byed pa'i tshe yang snga ma bsams pa'i nyes byas su gtogs par zad do /
translated: When you think of stealing and discuss it with an accomplice, you have committed only a fault of preparation.

original: bdag po med par rab tu brtag pa bya ste blang /🔽phyag dar khrod kyi gos blangs pa lta bu la bzang po zhig na /
analyzed: bdag po med par rab tu brtag pa bya ste blang / phyag dar khrod kyi gos blangs pa lta bu la bzang po zhig na /
translated: You should think that the object has no owner and then take it.🔽If you take a good discarded object, such as a piece of cloth, you should examine it carefully to see whether it has an owner.

original: bdag po gang yin bdag po yod dam med zhib tu brtags te blangs ngan pa rnams ni ma brtags kyang nyes med /
analyzed: bdag po gang yin bdag po yod dam med zhib tu brtags te blangs ngan pa rnams ni ma brtags kyang nyes med /
translated: If it is a good one, you should not take it.

original: lus kyis nyal bar mi bya /
analyzed: lus kyis nyal bar mi bya /
translated: You should not lie down in the place where you have committed the act of stealing.

original: bu lon chags pa lta bu phyir mdun du then cing nyal bar mi bya /
analyzed: bu lon chags pa lta bu phyir mdun du then cing nyal bar mi bya /
translated: You should not lie down in front of the object, as if you were in debt to it.

original: bram ze zhig la dge slong zhig gi bu lon chags te bram ze zhing rmed pa la bdas nas ma ster de zhing rmo ba'i rol khar then te nyal ba las bcas /
analyzed: bram ze zhig la dge slong zhig gi bu lon chags te bram ze zhing rmed pa la bdas nas ma ster de zhing rmo ba'i rol khar then te nyal ba las bcas /
translated: A monk once borrowed money from a brahman. When the monk did not repay the loan, the brahman chased him and would not let him go. The monk lay down in the furrow the brahman was plowing.

original: bya tshang mi gzhig / gtsug lag khang na bya tshang 'dug pa sgo nga med pa /
analyzed: bya tshang mi gzhig / gtsug lag khang na bya tshang 'dug pa sgo nga med pa /
translated: You should not destroy a bird’s nest. If there is a bird’s nest in a temple, and it is empty,

original: dge 'dun gyi las su ma bskos par bshig kyang nyes med /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi las su ma bskos par bshig kyang nyes med /
translated: you may destroy it without being appointed to do so by the saṅgha.

original: de ma gtogs par bya tshang bshig na nyes byas /
analyzed: de ma gtogs par bya tshang bshig na nyes byas /
translated: If one steals the nest of a bird other than that, it is a minor infraction.

original: der ma gnas par dbyar gyi gos kyi shas la mi 'jug / dbyar tshul du ma zhugs pa'i dge 'dun tshul du zhugs pa'i yon dang / gos 'god pa'i yon du ma gtogs te rku sems kyis nor skal blangs na /
analyzed: der ma gnas par dbyar gyi gos kyi shas la mi 'jug / dbyar tshul du ma zhugs pa'i dge 'dun tshul du zhugs pa'i yon dang / gos 'god pa'i yon du ma gtogs te rku sems kyis nor skal blangs na /
translated: If one takes the property of a monk who has not entered the rains retreat, or the property of a monk who has entered the rains retreat as a gift for the robes, or the property that is set aside for the robes, with the intention to steal,

original: rin thang tshang na pham rku sems med na sbom po /
analyzed: rin thang tshang na pham rku sems med na sbom po /
translated: if the value is complete, it is a defeating offense. If the value is not complete, it is a serious offense.🔽If one takes the property of a thief thinking that he is the benefactor, there is no offense.

original: rkun po las sbyin bdag tu bsams te blangs na ma nyes rkun por grags @63b pa'i mi zhig len na de las nor zhig len na de la sbyin bdag tu bsams te blangs na nyes med /
analyzed: rkun po las sbyin bdag tu bsams te blangs na ma nyes rkun por grags @63b pa'i mi zhig len na de las nor zhig len na de la sbyin bdag tu bsams te blangs na nyes med /
translated: If one takes the property of a thief thinking that he is the benefactor, there is no offense.

original: nor blangs pa de ngos zin na yang rkun po de la khungs phyung na kun gyis shes pa'i phyir bdag gtsang mar 'gyur bas blang du rung /
analyzed: nor blangs pa de ngos zin na yang rkun po de la khungs phyung na kun gyis shes pa'i phyir bdag gtsang mar 'gyur bas blang du rung /
translated: If one recognizes the stolen property, but if one does not accuse the thief, it is permissible to take it because one will be pure.

original: g-yung ma rgod rkun po'i rgyal mtshan ma thogs pa las rdzas mi blangs /
analyzed: g-yung ma rgod rkun po'i rgyal mtshan ma thogs pa las rdzas mi blangs /
translated: One should not take property from a thief who is not carrying the banner of a thief.

original: rku mkhas te bu smad lta bus kyang rkun po byas par mi tshor te khrims 'dzin cing sdig chung du la yang 'dzem pa ltar byed pa la rku ba'i mi dang 'di rnams gnyis lta bu g-yung ma rgod las rdzas blangs pa ni nyes byas nor de blangs🔽te nor bdag gis ngos zin na g-yung ma rgod la khungs phyung du zin kyang yul mis rku bar ma spyad pas /🔽dge slong gtsang mar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir mi blang ngo //🔽blangs nas mtshon gyis bcad cing kha dog bsgyur la bcang /
analyzed: rku mkhas te bu smad lta bus kyang rkun po byas par mi tshor te khrims 'dzin cing sdig chung du la yang 'dzem pa ltar byed pa la rku ba'i mi dang 'di rnams gnyis lta bu g-yung ma rgod las rdzas blangs pa ni nyes byas nor de blangs te nor bdag gis ngos zin na g-yung ma rgod la khungs phyung du zin kyang yul mis rku bar ma spyad pas / dge slong gtsang mar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir mi blang ngo // blangs nas mtshon gyis bcad cing kha dog bsgyur la bcang /
translated: Even though a thief is skilled in stealing and his wife and children do not notice that he is a thief, he is still punished.🔽In the same way, if a monk acts as if he were afraid of even the slightest negative action, he is like a thief.🔽If he takes a lost article, he commits an offense.🔽If the owner recognizes the article, he must return it.🔽Even if the owner is not found, the monk should not keep the article.🔽If he does keep it, he should cut it with a knife, change its color, and then use it.🔽

original: rkun por grags pa las nor blangs pa de kha tshar bcad de kha dog bsgyur te bcang /🔽de ltar byas kyang slong na byin cig / mdo ltag ma ltar rdzas blangs ba kha dog bsgyur te /🔽bcangs pa de nor bdag gis ngo shes te slar song na sbyin /
analyzed: rkun por grags pa las nor blangs pa de kha tshar bcad de kha dog bsgyur te bcang /🔽de ltar byas kyang slong na byin cig / mdo ltag ma ltar rdzas blangs ba kha dog bsgyur te /🔽bcangs pa de nor bdag gis ngo shes te slar song na sbyin /

original: ma sbyin na nyes byas /
analyzed: ma sbyin na nyes byas /
translated: If one does not give, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: sgyu mi bya /🔽las lta bu byed byed pa'i gla mtho byogs pa'i phyir med ces sam /
analyzed: sgyu mi bya / las lta bu byed byed pa'i gla mtho byogs pa'i phyir med ces sam /
translated: One should not deceive.

original: ma 'byor ces mi sbyin par sgyu mi bya /
analyzed: ma 'byor ces mi sbyin par sgyu mi bya /
translated: One should not deceive by saying, “I do not have it” or “I have not received it” in order to avoid paying a high wage to a worker who is demanding it.

original: byas na nyes byas /
analyzed: byas na nyes byas /
translated: If one does so, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: sngags kyis btang na ni nyes med /
analyzed: sngags kyis btang na ni nyes med /
translated: If one gives it after reciting a mantra, there is no offense.

original: bdag gi rdzas gzhan gyis brkus nas chos bshad de blangs kyang mi ster na /
analyzed: bdag gi rdzas gzhan gyis brkus nas chos bshad de blangs kyang mi ster na /
translated: If one does not give to someone who has stolen one’s property and then demands it back,

original: sngags byas te sems bsgyur la /
analyzed: sngags byas te sems bsgyur la /
translated: one should recite a mantra and change one’s mind.

original: bdag la sbyin du bcug pa ni nyes med do //
analyzed: bdag la sbyin du bcug pa ni nyes med do //
translated: If one makes him give it back, there is no offense.

original: byi bas brkus pa dag gi ni blangs na yang ngo //
analyzed: byi bas brkus pa dag gi ni blangs na yang ngo //
translated: If one takes back what was stolen by a mouse,

original: bdag gi nor rdzas lta bu byi bas khyer ba las slar phrogs shing blangs pa ni nyes med /
analyzed: bdag gi nor rdzas lta bu byi bas khyer ba las slar phrogs shing blangs pa ni nyes med /
translated: there is no offense if one takes back one’s own property that was carried off by a mouse.

original: de bzhin du khyi dang bya la sogs pa las phrogs kyang nyes med /
analyzed: de bzhin du khyi dang bya la sogs pa las phrogs kyang nyes med /
translated: Similarly, there is no offense if one takes back what was stolen by a dog, a bird, and so on.

original: dge slong gzhan gyi don de'i phyir yang ngo //
analyzed: dge slong gzhan gyi don de'i phyir yang ngo //
translated: If one does so for the sake of another monk, there is no offense.

original: dge slong gzhan gyi nor rdzas shig byi ba dang khyi la sogs pas khyer ba blangs shing phrogs pa yang slar byin na nyes med /
analyzed: dge slong gzhan gyi nor rdzas shig byi ba dang khyi la sogs pas khyer ba blangs shing phrogs pa yang slar byin na nyes med /
translated: If a monk takes and steals the property of another monk, which is carried off by mice, dogs, etc., and then returns it, there is no offense.

original: bdag dang dge slong zhes 'byung bas khyim pa dang / dge slong la ni nyes yod pa 'dra'o //
analyzed: bdag dang dge slong zhes 'byung bas khyim pa dang / dge slong la ni nyes yod pa 'dra'o //
translated: Since it says “another monk” and “monk,” it seems that there is an offense for a layperson and a novice monk.

original: rngon pas ri dags smas pa gnas su 'ongs te khyer na yang ngo //
analyzed: rngon pas ri dags smas pa gnas su 'ongs te khyer na yang ngo //
translated: If a hunter brings a wounded animal to a monastery and takes it away, there is no offense.

original: lings mi'am rngon pa lta bus ri dags smas te bdag cag gi gan du 'ongs pa ni snying rje zhing skyabs bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: lings mi'am rngon pa lta bus ri dags smas te bdag cag gi gan du 'ongs pa ni snying rje zhing skyabs bya ba'i phyir /
translated: If a hunter or a thief brings a wounded animal to a monastery, it is out of compassion and to protect it.

original: @64a * // ri dags bsnyags pa'i bdag po slar ma byin yang nyes med do //
analyzed: @64a * // ri dags bsnyags pa'i bdag po slar ma byin yang nyes med do //
translated: If the owner of the animal that is being pursued comes and takes it away, there is no offense in not returning it.🔽If it dies, give it to them.

original: de shi na de dag la byin cig / mdo ltag ma ltar ma byin pa de shin sha slar byin sha bdag ring zhig tu ma 'ongs na yang bdag cag gis /
analyzed: de shi na de dag la byin cig / mdo ltag ma ltar ma byin pa de shin sha slar byin sha bdag ring zhig tu ma 'ongs na yang bdag cag gis /
translated: If the owner does not come for a long time, give it to the monks.

original: sha brkus shing ma zos par shes par bya ba'i phyir rul rul du khengs rus mngon par gzhag / ma byin par len pa'i phas pham pa'i bye brag tu gdon mi za ba'o //
analyzed: sha brkus shing ma zos par shes par bya ba'i phyir rul rul du khengs rus mngon par gzhag / ma byin par len pa'i phas pham pa'i bye brag tu gdon mi za ba'o //
translated: In order to know that the meat was stolen and not eaten, it is displayed rotten and putrid.

original: ma byin par len pa'i phas pham pa ste /
analyzed: ma byin par len pa'i phas pham pa ste /
translated: This is the definite downfall of stealing.

original: 'dul ba bye brag tu gdon mi za ba'i nang nas 'byung ba'i mdo /
analyzed: 'dul ba bye brag tu gdon mi za ba'i nang nas 'byung ba'i mdo /
translated: The Sutra that is Definitely the Vinaya

original: ma byin par len pa'i phas pham pa rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: ma byin par len pa'i phas pham pa rdzogs pa'o //
translated: The definite downfall of stealing is complete.

original: ma byin par len pa'i phas pham pa 'dul ba so so nas 'chad cing 'byung ba'i mdo kun rdzogs so /
analyzed: ma byin par len pa'i phas pham pa 'dul ba so so nas 'chad cing 'byung ba'i mdo kun rdzogs so /
translated: The Sutra that is Definitely the Vinaya, which is taught and appears in the individual explanations of the definite downfalls of stealing, is complete.

original: // / gsod pa'i phas pham pa'o //
analyzed: // / gsod pa'i phas pham pa'o //
translated: The definite downfall of killing.

original: nad pa 'chi bar 'dod pa la de dang mthun pa'i bsnyen pa mi bsnyen /
analyzed: nad pa 'chi bar 'dod pa la de dang mthun pa'i bsnyen pa mi bsnyen /
translated: For a sick person who wishes to die, do not give them the proper care.

original: dge slong nad pa shi yang bla snyam sems pa la 'chi na ci nyes zhes bya ba'i tshig mi bya /
analyzed: dge slong nad pa shi yang bla snyam sems pa la 'chi na ci nyes zhes bya ba'i tshig mi bya /
translated: For a sick monk who thinks, “Death is better,” do not ask, “What is wrong if you die?”

original: dge slong nad pa zhig bkres zhes zer ba la nad g-yog dang sman pa la zas ci sbyin zhes 'dri song ba'i 'og tu /
analyzed: dge slong nad pa zhig bkres zhes zer ba la nad g-yog dang sman pa la zas ci sbyin zhes 'dri song ba'i 'og tu /
translated: A monk who was sick said, “I am hungry.” The attendant asked the doctor, “What food should I give him?”

original: dge slong gzhan dag gis so so nas zan sna mang du byin te 'grangs nas /
analyzed: dge slong gzhan dag gis so so nas zan sna mang du byin te 'grangs nas /
translated: After that, other monks each gave him many kinds of food, and he became full.

original: nad g-yog gis sman pas zer ba bzhin du zan g-yos te byin pa dang / kham gsum tsam zos nas ma yog nas nad g-yog mi dga' zhing 'dug pa la /
analyzed: nad g-yog gis sman pas zer ba bzhin du zan g-yos te byin pa dang / kham gsum tsam zos nas ma yog nas nad g-yog mi dga' zhing 'dug pa la /
translated: The attendant prepared food as the doctor had said and gave it to him. The sick monk ate only three mouthfuls and then said, “I can’t eat any more.” The attendant was displeased.

original: zan gzhan gyi byin te 'grangs so zhes byas pa dang nad g-yog khros te nga de srid du 'bad 'bad na lto de tsam zhig kyang mi thub na dug zos te shi na ci nyes zhes byas pa dang nad pas dug zos te shi ba las bcas /
analyzed: zan gzhan gyi byin te 'grangs so zhes byas pa dang nad g-yog khros te nga de srid du 'bad 'bad na lto de tsam zhig kyang mi thub na dug zos te shi na ci nyes zhes byas pa dang nad pas dug zos te shi ba las bcas /
translated: The sick monk said, “I was given other food and became full.” The attendant became angry and said, “I have been working hard for so long, and you can’t even eat that much food. What’s wrong with you? Why don’t you just eat poison and die?” The sick monk then ate poison and died.

original: de skad byas te shi na pham /
analyzed: de skad byas te shi na pham /
translated: If you say that and he dies, you commit an offense entailing expulsion.

original: de la mi shes pa 'chi ba gogs shig pa ma bsgo bar g-yog tu mi gzhag / dge slong nad pa zhig shi yang bla snyam sems te /
analyzed: de la mi shes pa 'chi ba gogs shig pa ma bsgo bar g-yog tu mi gzhag / dge slong nad pa zhig shi yang bla snyam sems te /
translated: You should not employ as an attendant someone who does not know how to care for the sick. A monk who was sick thought, “I would rather die.”

original: nad g-yog gi tsha bo rngon pa spun gnyis shig yod pa 'di ni bdag la gsod du btub snyam bsams te nad g-yog la de gnyis khugs te khyod kyi rogs su nga'i nad g-yog byed du chu gcig ces bsgo nas nang g-yog gis bkug ste nad pa zer
analyzed: nad g-yog gi tsha bo rngon pa spun gnyis shig yod pa 'di ni bdag la gsod du btub snyam bsams te nad g-yog la de gnyis khugs te khyod kyi rogs su nga'i nad g-yog byed du chu gcig ces bsgo nas nang g-yog gis bkug ste nad pa zer
translated: The sick man thought, I can get these two nephews of the nurse who are hunters to kill me. He told the nurse, Bring them here. They will help me and be my attendants. The nurse summoned them and said, Attend the sick man as he instructs.

original: ba bzhin du g-yog gyis shig ces bsgo nas bzhag ste /
analyzed: ba bzhin du g-yog gyis shig ces bsgo nas bzhag ste /
translated: The sick man said, You two must stay here and attend me.

original: nad g-yog dge slong gud du song ba'i 'og tu /
analyzed: nad g-yog dge slong gud du song ba'i 'og tu /
translated: After the nurse, the monk, had gone elsewhere,

original: nad pas rngon pa la nga bsad na mtho ris su bde bar 'ong zhes chos bshad nas gsod du bcug nas @64b gsad pa las bcas te /
analyzed: nad pas rngon pa la nga bsad na mtho ris su bde bar 'ong zhes chos bshad nas gsod du bcug nas @64b gsad pa las bcas te /
translated: the sick man said to the hunters, If you kill me, I will go to the higher realms. He taught them the Dharma and had them kill him.

original: nad g-yog tu mi blun po de lta bu mi gzhag / nad g-yog sgrin po gzhag tu spus med na yang blun po la nad pa 'chir ma gzhug cig ces bya ba la sogs pas gtams te gzhag / thabs gzhan yod na ma yin /
analyzed: nad g-yog tu mi blun po de lta bu mi gzhag / nad g-yog sgrin po gzhag tu spus med na yang blun po la nad pa 'chir ma gzhug cig ces bya ba la sogs pas gtams te gzhag / thabs gzhan yod na ma yin /
translated: The sick man said, Do not leave such a stupid nurse. Even if you have no other choice, do not let a fool kill the patient. He instructed them in this way and then died.

original: nad g-yog tu bzhag pa mi sgrin po tshig zur bye brag phyed cing legs nyes shes pa dang / thabs mkhas pa ni ma bsgo zhing ma gtams pa nyes med /🔽'chi ba'i yo byad mi gzhag / nad pa'i drung du 'geg thag dang mtshon la sogs pa 'chi bar 'gyur ba mi gzhag / de 'chi ba'i phyir rtsol na g-yog gis zlog shig / nad pa kho bdag 'chi bar rtsol na nad g-yog gis mi lus rnyed dka'
analyzed: nad g-yog tu bzhag pa mi sgrin po tshig zur bye brag phyed cing legs nyes shes pa dang / thabs mkhas pa ni ma bsgo zhing ma gtams pa nyes med / 'chi ba'i yo byad mi gzhag / nad pa'i drung du 'geg thag dang mtshon la sogs pa 'chi bar 'gyur ba mi gzhag / de 'chi ba'i phyir rtsol na g-yog gis zlog shig / nad pa kho bdag 'chi bar rtsol na nad g-yog gis mi lus rnyed dka'
translated: The nurse should be skilled, discerning, and able to distinguish between the words of the sick person and his or her complaints.🔽The nurse should not leave the dying person alone, nor should he or she leave in the dying person’s presence any objects that might encourage suicide, such as a rope or a weapon.🔽If the dying person attempts suicide, the nurse should stop him or her. If the dying person tries to commit suicide, the nurse should encourage him or her by saying that it is difficult to obtain a human body and that it is a pity to lose the body that is the basis for the practice of virtue.

original: ba dang / bsod nams spyod pa'i lus phangs so zhes yid bsrings la 'chi bar mi gzhug cing dgag / pha rol gyi don phyir 'chi ba ma dad cig / dge slong pha rol po zhig la lhung bzed dam chos gos bzang po yod pa la /
analyzed: ba dang / bsod nams spyod pa'i lus phangs so zhes yid bsrings la 'chi bar mi gzhug cing dgag / pha rol gyi don phyir 'chi ba ma dad cig / dge slong pha rol po zhig la lhung bzed dam chos gos bzang po yod pa la /
translated: The nurse should not allow the dying person to commit suicide for the sake of others.

original: de shi na ngas 'thob pa'i phyir shi yang bla'o zhes dad pa mi skyed de de ltar bsams na nyes byas /
analyzed: de shi na ngas 'thob pa'i phyir shi yang bla'o zhes dad pa mi skyed de de ltar bsams na nyes byas /
translated: If a monk thinks, “If that other monk dies, I will get his good begging-bowl or robe,” and does not generate faith, thinking, “It would be better if he died,” he commits an offense.

original: mi bya ba byed pa la sems kyis kyang byed pa la rjes su yi rang bar mi bya /
analyzed: mi bya ba byed pa la sems kyis kyang byed pa la rjes su yi rang bar mi bya /
translated: One should not even mentally rejoice in the performance of what should not be done.

original: pha rol po srog gcod pa dang rdeg pa dang / srog gcod pa'i thabs byed pa la sogs pa bya ba mi rigs pa yin te /
analyzed: pha rol po srog gcod pa dang rdeg pa dang / srog gcod pa'i thabs byed pa la sogs pa bya ba mi rigs pa yin te /
translated: It is not right to do such things as kill, beat, or devise a means to kill another person.

original: de lta bu zhig byed pa la bdag gis kyang de bzang zhing yi rang ngo zhes mi bya byas na nyes byas so //
analyzed: de lta bu zhig byed pa la bdag gis kyang de bzang zhing yi rang ngo zhes mi bya byas na nyes byas so //
translated: If one does such a thing, saying, “I am good and rejoice in this,” one commits an offense.

original: 'tsho ba bgags /
analyzed: 'tsho ba bgags /
translated: The life is blocked.

original: srog gcad pa dang / der sems /
analyzed: srog gcad pa dang / der sems /
translated: One thinks of killing,

original: srog bcad par bsams pa dang / mi'i rgyud na'o //
analyzed: srog bcad par bsams pa dang / mi'i rgyud na'o //
translated: and one thinks of killing a human being.

original: mi'i rgyud kyang yin pa dang yan lag 'di gsum dang ldan par mi bsad na pham par 'gyur /
analyzed: mi'i rgyud kyang yin pa dang yan lag 'di gsum dang ldan par mi bsad na pham par 'gyur /
translated: If one kills a human being who has these three limbs, one incurs a defeating offense.

original: lus bdag gi lus dang lus kyi yan lag dang po la sogs pa bsad pa dang / der gtogs pa /
analyzed: lus bdag gi lus dang lus kyi yan lag dang po la sogs pa bsad pa dang / der gtogs pa /
translated: One kills one’s own body or a limb of one’s own body, and so on.

original: mtshon cha dang rdo dbyig lag pa na thogs te bsad pa dang / btang ba /
analyzed: mtshon cha dang rdo dbyig lag pa na thogs te bsad pa dang / btang ba /
translated: One kills with a weapon, a stone, a club, or one’s hand, and one sends.

original: mtshon cha dang rdo dbyig 'phangs te bsad pa dang / gzhan la bsgo ba rnams kyang tha mi dad do //
analyzed: mtshon cha dang rdo dbyig 'phangs te bsad pa dang / gzhan la bsgo ba rnams kyang tha mi dad do //
translated: It is not different to kill by throwing weapons and stones, or by ordering others to do so.

original: gzhan la bsgo ste gsod du bcug pa dang de rnams ltar bdag gis bsad pa mtshungs te pham mo /🔽dug dang / dug blud de bsad pa dang / phye ma dang / dug phye mas lus la bskus te bsad pa dang / rlubs dang / rlubs kyi nang du bsad pa dang / shing dang / shing dbang du btsir @65a * //
analyzed: gzhan la bsgo ste gsod du bcug pa dang de rnams ltar bdag gis bsad pa mtshungs te pham mo / dug dang / dug blud de bsad pa dang / phye ma dang / dug phye mas lus la bskus te bsad pa dang / rlubs dang / rlubs kyi nang du bsad pa dang / shing dang / shing dbang du btsir @65a * //
translated: It is the same whether one kills by ordering others to do so or by killing oneself.

original: te bsad pa dang / rang bzhin stor te btang ba dang / thul lta bu byas te smyo ste brag dang chu la sogs pa'i nang du shi bar byas pa dang / brang skam bar byed pa dang / sa mda' lta bus bsad pa dang /
analyzed: te bsad pa dang / rang bzhin stor te btang ba dang / thul lta bu byas te smyo ste brag dang chu la sogs pa'i nang du shi bar byas pa dang / brang skam bar byed pa dang / sa mda' lta bus bsad pa dang /
translated: It is the same whether one kills by poison or by administering poison, by dust or by anointing the body with poisonous dust, by a pit or by killing in a pit, by a tree or by crushing to death between trees, by losing one’s nature or by letting go, by making one’s mind confused or by causing one to die in a cliff, water, and so on, by causing one’s chest to dry up, or by killing with an arrow.
