analyzed: grang ba lhags pa dang tshad khungs lta bu la bzung dam bcings te bzhag nas bsad pa yang pham /🔽pho nyar btang ba la sogs pa yang ngo //
translated: killing by a spell,🔽killing by a spell

original: gcan gzan za ba'am dgra'i khrod lta bur bsad pa'i phyir bsngags te btang nas shi na yang pham pa'o //
analyzed: gcan gzan za ba'am dgra'i khrod lta bur bsad pa'i phyir bsngags te btang nas shi na yang pham pa'o //
translated: If one sends him to be killed by wild animals or in a battle, and he dies, there is a defeat.

original: chung zad du gtogs na yang ngo //
analyzed: chung zad du gtogs na yang ngo //
translated: If he dies a little later, there is also a defeat.

original: bsad pa'i phyir bem tol lam khab kyis btsugs pa'am yungs 'brus 'phangs te shi na yang pham /
analyzed: bsad pa'i phyir bem tol lam khab kyis btsugs pa'am yungs 'brus 'phangs te shi na yang pham /
translated: If he dies from being stabbed with a weapon, or from being pricked with a needle, or from being hit with a mustard seed, there is a defeat.

original: skyes pa dang bud med dang ma ning bsad na'o //
analyzed: skyes pa dang bud med dang ma ning bsad na'o //
translated: If a man, a woman, or a neuter is killed.

original: skyes pa dang bud med dang ma ning gang bsad kyang rung pham mo //
analyzed: skyes pa dang bud med dang ma ning gang bsad kyang rung pham mo //
translated: Whether a man, a woman, or a neuter is killed, there is a defeat.

original: de'i phyir phyis shi yang ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir phyis shi yang ngo //
translated: If he dies later.

original: gsod pa'i phyir mtshon cha la sogs pas btab ste /🔽'phral du ni ma shi'i de'i zhar gyis phyis shi na yang pham mo //
analyzed: gsod pa'i phyir mtshon cha la sogs pas btab ste / 'phral du ni ma shi'i de'i zhar gyis phyis shi na yang pham mo //
translated: If one stabs him with a weapon, etc., for the purpose of killing him,🔽and he dies later from that, there is a defeat.

original: bzlog pa las phyis na mtshan ma ma yin /
analyzed: bzlog pa las phyis na mtshan ma ma yin /
translated: If he does not die immediately, but later, it is not a downfall.

original: khyod shi na skyid do zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngar bsgo ste phyis /
analyzed: khyod shi na skyid do zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngar bsgo ste phyis /
translated: If one says to him, “You will be happy if you die,” etc., and later

original: nga 'khrul pa yin te shi ba'i mi rigs so zhes bzlog na shi yang rung /
analyzed: nga 'khrul pa yin te shi ba'i mi rigs so zhes bzlog na shi yang rung /
translated: he says, “I was mistaken. It is not right to die,” and he dies,

original: ma shi yang rung sbom po /
analyzed: ma shi yang rung sbom po /
translated: whether or not he dies, there is a serious transgression.

original: sbom po ni ma'i lto ma nye ste mngal na pha ma dmigs pa na'o //
analyzed: sbom po ni ma'i lto ma nye ste mngal na pha ma dmigs pa na'o //
translated: The heavy one is when the mother is not near, that is, when the mother and father are not in the womb.

original: bud med rum na bu yod pa zhig bu bsad pa'i phyir ma'i lho mnyes te ma shi na sbom po /
analyzed: bud med rum na bu yod pa zhig bu bsad pa'i phyir ma'i lho mnyes te ma shi na sbom po /
translated: If a woman with a child in her womb is massaged in order to kill the child, and the mother dies, it is a heavy offense.

original: ma bsad pa'i phyir bu shi na yang sbom po /
analyzed: ma bsad pa'i phyir bu shi na yang sbom po /
translated: If the child dies in order to kill the mother, it is also a heavy offense.

original: gang gsad par byas pa nyid shi na pham /
analyzed: gang gsad par byas pa nyid shi na pham /
translated: If the one who is to be killed dies, it is a defeat.

original: gsod par 'jug pa de'i mtshan mar mos pa yang ngo //
analyzed: gsod par 'jug pa de'i mtshan mar mos pa yang ngo //
translated: If one is inspired by the signs of engaging in killing, it is also a heavy offense.

original: gzhan zhig gis mi 'di gsad @65b do zhes dris pa dang / dge slong gis sod cig ces ma smras kyang gsad par dga' ba'i phyir lus kyis dad pa'i brda byas na sbom po /
analyzed: gzhan zhig gis mi 'di gsad @65b do zhes dris pa dang / dge slong gis sod cig ces ma smras kyang gsad par dga' ba'i phyir lus kyis dad pa'i brda byas na sbom po /
translated: If someone asks, “Kill this person,” and although the monk does not say “Kill,” he gives a sign of assent with his body because he likes killing, it is a heavy offense.

original: khyim bdag au pa se sbun gnyis las pho bo tshong la song ba'i 'og tu pho bo'i chung ma la nu bos rgyos nas bur chags te ngo tsha ba'i phyir thar par zhugs pa dang / grogs po sman pa zhig 'ongs te khyod ngo tsha na sman gyis bu med par bya'o zhes byas pa dang /
analyzed: khyim bdag au pa se sbun gnyis las pho bo tshong la song ba'i 'og tu pho bo'i chung ma la nu bos rgyos nas bur chags te ngo tsha ba'i phyir thar par zhugs pa dang / grogs po sman pa zhig 'ongs te khyod ngo tsha na sman gyis bu med par bya'o zhes byas pa dang /
translated: A friend who was a physician came and said, If you are ashamed, I will give you medicine to make you childless.

original: lus kyis sod cig pa'i brda byas pa las bcas /🔽khyod kyi ming gis 'chi ba'i yo byad sbyin no zhes na yang ngo //🔽mi zhig na re khyod kyi ming nas phyung ste /
analyzed: lus kyis sod cig pa'i brda byas pa las bcas / khyod kyi ming gis 'chi ba'i yo byad sbyin no zhes na yang ngo // mi zhig na re khyod kyi ming nas phyung ste /
translated: She made a gesture with her body to kill the child.🔽If you give me the means to kill it, I will give you the price of the medicine.🔽A man said, 'I will take your name and say to the physician, Give this poison to your friend to drink.'

original: khyod na re dug 'di 'thung shig ces zer ro zhes bya'o zhes byas pa dang / gsad par dga' ba'i phyir kha rog 'dug na sbom po /
analyzed: khyod na re dug 'di 'thung shig ces zer ro zhes bya'o zhes byas pa dang / gsad par dga' ba'i phyir kha rog 'dug na sbom po /
translated: If you remain silent out of a desire to kill, it is a serious transgression.

original: gzhan phyugs ma yin pa dang / mi dang byol song gi rgyud ma yin pa na reg pa dang 'dre dang lha'i lam dang gsum gyi rgyud la gang yang rung ste bsad na sbom po /
analyzed: gzhan phyugs ma yin pa dang / mi dang byol song gi rgyud ma yin pa na reg pa dang 'dre dang lha'i lam dang gsum gyi rgyud la gang yang rung ste bsad na sbom po /
translated: If one kills any being in the three realms of non-human animals, humans and gods, it is a serious transgression.

original: sprul pa bsad na yang ngo //
analyzed: sprul pa bsad na yang ngo //
translated: If one kills an emanation, it is also a serious transgression.

original: sems can gyi gzugs su sprul te sems med pa zhig bsad na nyes byas /
analyzed: sems can gyi gzugs su sprul te sems med pa zhig bsad na nyes byas /
translated: If one kills a non-sentient being that one has emanated in the form of a sentient being, it is a minor infraction.

original: sprul pa sems yod pa zhig bsad na sbom po /🔽byol song mir sprul ba bsad na'ang sbom po /
analyzed: sprul pa sems yod pa zhig bsad na sbom po / byol song mir sprul ba bsad na'ang sbom po /
translated: If one kills a sentient being that one has emanated, it is a serious transgression.🔽If one kills an animal that has emanated in the form of a human, it is a serious transgression.

original: mi byol song du sprul pa bsad na sbom po ni med de pham pa'o //
analyzed: mi byol song du sprul pa bsad na sbom po ni med de pham pa'o //
translated: If one kills a human who has emanated in the form of an animal, it is a downfall of defeat.

original: dri bsam bsgo bar nad pa la sman mi sbyin /🔽nad pa sman cig sbyin na shes pa'i sman pa la dri ba'i rigs te ma dris shing /
analyzed: dri bsam bsgo bar nad pa la sman mi sbyin / nad pa sman cig sbyin na shes pa'i sman pa la dri ba'i rigs te ma dris shing /
translated: Not giving medicine to the sick without asking or being ordered.🔽If one does not ask a physician who knows medicine to give medicine to a sick person, it is a minor infraction.

original: sman pas ma bsgo bar nad pa la sman mi sbyin /
analyzed: sman pas ma bsgo bar nad pa la sman mi sbyin /
translated: If one does not give medicine to a sick person without being ordered to do so by a physician, it is a minor infraction.

original: byin na nyes byas ci lta bu la dri ba 'og nas bshad /
analyzed: byin na nyes byas ci lta bu la dri ba 'og nas bshad /
translated: What kind of minor infraction is this? It will be explained below.

original: sman pa dang / sman pa nyid dang / de las rab tu byung ba dang / sman pa las rab tu byung ba dang / de dang 'grogs po dang / sman pa dang rtag tu 'grogs 'grogs te sman dpyad shes pa dang / der dri'o //
analyzed: sman pa dang / sman pa nyid dang / de las rab tu byung ba dang / sman pa las rab tu byung ba dang / de dang 'grogs po dang / sman pa dang rtag tu 'grogs 'grogs te sman dpyad shes pa dang / der dri'o //
translated: or one who knows medical treatment from having asked about it.

original: 'di rnam gsum lta bu la dris te sman byin pa ni nyes med do //
analyzed: 'di rnam gsum lta bu la dris te sman byin pa ni nyes med do //
translated: If one gives medicine after asking about these three types, there is no offense.

original: nad bu can la yang ngo //
analyzed: nad bu can la yang ngo //
translated: Also, one who is chronically ill.

original: nad bu can ni rtag tu nad kyis gtses kyi sman dpyad shes pa'i rigs te de la dris te nad pa la sman sbyin pa'ang nyes med do //
analyzed: nad bu can ni rtag tu nad kyis gtses kyi sman dpyad shes pa'i rigs te de la dris te nad pa la sman sbyin pa'ang nyes med do //
translated: One who is chronically ill is always afflicted by illness, so it is appropriate to know medical treatment. If one gives medicine to a patient after asking about it, there is no offense.

original: dge slong rgan po /
analyzed: dge slong rgan po /
translated: An elder monk.

original: dge slong rgan po ni na rgan pa dang / rgan po shes rab dang bcas pa rnams la yang ngo //
analyzed: dge slong rgan po ni na rgan pa dang / rgan po shes rab dang bcas pa rnams la yang ngo //
translated: An elder monk is one who is old in years and old in wisdom.

original: khrims rgan po mang du myong zhing shes pa legs nyes kyi bye brag phyed pa dag dris te /
analyzed: khrims rgan po mang du myong zhing shes pa legs nyes kyi bye brag phyed pa dag dris te /
translated: If one asks those who are old in the rules, who have experienced many things, and who can distinguish right from wrong,

original: nad pa la sman byin yang nyes @66a * //
analyzed: nad pa la sman byin yang nyes @66a * //
translated: and gives medicine to a patient, there is no offense.

original: med ; gong ma med na 'og ma la yang ngo //
analyzed: med ; gong ma med na 'og ma la yang ngo //
translated: If there is no one above, then one may ask someone below.

original: sman pa ming gis smos pa 'di rnams las rim bzhin du ltag ma dag med na 'og ma dag la dris te nad pa la sman sbyin /
analyzed: sman pa ming gis smos pa 'di rnams las rim bzhin du ltag ma dag med na 'og ma dag la dris te nad pa la sman sbyin /
translated: If the doctor named first is not available, then the patient should be treated by the one listed next.

original: shi ba'i phyir phan par sman byin na 'bri ba med do //
analyzed: shi ba'i phyir phan par sman byin na 'bri ba med do //
translated: If a doctor gives medicine that is helpful but the patient dies anyway, there is no offense.

original: mi nad kyis nyon mongs shing 'dug pa la /
analyzed: mi nad kyis nyon mongs shing 'dug pa la /
translated: If a person is suffering from a disease,

original: shi na bde bar 'gyur zhes bsams te shi bar 'ong ba'i sman sbyin par mi bya /
analyzed: shi na bde bar 'gyur zhes bsams te shi bar 'ong ba'i sman sbyin par mi bya /
translated: it is not right to give him medicine that will kill him, thinking, “If he dies, it will be better.”

original: mi de shi na pham /
analyzed: mi de shi na pham /
translated: If the person dies, there is a defeat.

original: dge slong ma gcig cig gis mi rgod kyi rkang lag gtubs te /
analyzed: dge slong ma gcig cig gis mi rgod kyi rkang lag gtubs te /
translated: A nun cut off the arms and legs of a bandit🔽who was suffering from a disease, thinking, “If he dies, he will be happy and at ease.”

original: nyon mongs shing 'dug pa la shi na bde zhing skyid ces 'bras kyi khu ba'i sman zhes bya ba byin te bsad pa las bcas /
analyzed: nyon mongs shing 'dug pa la shi na bde zhing skyid ces 'bras kyi khu ba'i sman zhes bya ba byin te bsad pa las bcas /
translated: She gave him what was called “rice water medicine” and he died.

original: khur mi thag pa la grogs mi bya /
analyzed: khur mi thag pa la grogs mi bya /
translated: Do not help carry a load that is too heavy.

original: mi bcu tsam gyis bteg dgos pa'i khur la /
analyzed: mi bcu tsam gyis bteg dgos pa'i khur la /
translated: If a load is so heavy that it takes ten people to carry it,

original: mi brgyad tsam gyis bskur bar rtsol na mi theg cing snang bar 'gyur ba'i phyir nang du zhugs shing bteg pa'i grogs mi bya /
analyzed: mi brgyad tsam gyis bskur bar rtsol na mi theg cing snang bar 'gyur ba'i phyir nang du zhugs shing bteg pa'i grogs mi bya /
translated: it is not right to help carry it if only eight people are carrying it, because it will break.

original: byas na nyes byas /
analyzed: byas na nyes byas /
translated: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

original: bya ba ni de ste de'i rkyen gcig na khyim pa dang sbrel te bskos la mnyam du theg cig / mdo ltag ma ltar mi bcu tsam gyis bskur dgos pa cig la mi brgyad las med de /
analyzed: bya ba ni de ste de'i rkyen gcig na khyim pa dang sbrel te bskos la mnyam du theg cig / mdo ltag ma ltar mi bcu tsam gyis bskur dgos pa cig la mi brgyad las med de /
translated: If there are less than ten people, such as eight, to carry a load as heavy as the one described in the sūtra, then

original: mi bskur du mi rung ba'i rkyen gcig byung na khyim pa dang / dge slong spel la stobs mnyam par bteg cing bskur de ltar ma byas na nyes byas /
analyzed: mi bskur du mi rung ba'i rkyen gcig byung na khyim pa dang / dge slong spel la stobs mnyam par bteg cing bskur de ltar ma byas na nyes byas /
translated: if there is one condition, such as a lay person, that makes it unsuitable to carry it, then alternate with a fully ordained monk and carry it together. If you do not do it this way, then there is an offense.🔽Also, you should put it down together.

original: gzhag pa yang mnyam du gyis shig / mdo ltag ma ltar mnyam du theg pa'i khur de slar gzhag pa'i tshe na yang stobs mnyam par gyis te pheg tu 'byor bar gyis shig / de ltar ma byas na nyes byas /
analyzed: gzhag pa yang mnyam du gyis shig / mdo ltag ma ltar mnyam du theg pa'i khur de slar gzhag pa'i tshe na yang stobs mnyam par gyis te pheg tu 'byor bar gyis shig / de ltar ma byas na nyes byas /
translated: If, when you put down the load that you carried together as described in the sūtra, you do not do it evenly, then there is an offense.

original: pha gu mi dor pha gu long btags shing skyed pa lta bu la gcig la gcig mi dor pha rol po'i lag gis zin nas gtad /
analyzed: pha gu mi dor pha gu long btags shing skyed pa lta bu la gcig la gcig mi dor pha rol po'i lag gis zin nas gtad /
translated: Do not let go of the rope. When the rope is tied in a knot or a loop, do not let go of it and hand it to the next person.

original: de ltar ma byas na nyes byas grum pa dang gas pa ma bsgo bar de mi gtad /
analyzed: de ltar ma byas na nyes byas grum pa dang gas pa ma bsgo bar de mi gtad /
translated: If you do not do it this way, then there is an offense. Do not hand it to someone with a limp or a broken leg.

original: pha gu grum mam chag ste gas pa zhig na pha gu chag go zhes bya ste pha rol gyi lag tu sbyin /
analyzed: pha gu grum mam chag ste gas pa zhig na pha gu chag go zhes bya ste pha rol gyi lag tu sbyin /
translated: If the fence is broken or damaged, it is called a broken fence and one should give it to the other party.

original: ma byas na nyes byas /
analyzed: ma byas na nyes byas /
translated: If one does not do so, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: rkun po la 'jigs pa'i phyir bsdigs mo byos shig / gtsug lag khang du rkun po 'ongs na 'dus te sgra bskyed de lhung bzed dang / rkun 'di dang yi ge'i po ti la sogs pa long la rgyob ces bsdigs /
analyzed: rkun po la 'jigs pa'i phyir bsdigs mo byos shig / gtsug lag khang du rkun po 'ongs na 'dus te sgra bskyed de lhung bzed dang / rkun 'di dang yi ge'i po ti la sogs pa long la rgyob ces bsdigs /
translated: If thieves come to the monastery, one should shout out in order to frighten them, saying, “Gather together and make noise! Take the begging bowls, the books of letters, and so forth, and chase out the thieves!”

original: gand'i la sogs pas ma phog par 'phongs shig / rkun po la ma phog pa tsam du gand'i la sogs pa 'phongs la bsdigs mo gyis shig / rlung phyogs @66b su sa'am thal bas gang ba'i gyo mos so //
analyzed: gand'i la sogs pas ma phog par 'phongs shig / rkun po la ma phog pa tsam du gand'i la sogs pa 'phongs la bsdigs mo gyis shig / rlung phyogs @66b su sa'am thal bas gang ba'i gyo mos so //
translated: One should throw clods of earth and so forth without hitting the thieves. One should shout out, throwing clods of earth and so forth without hitting the thieves.

original: rkun po 'ongs na rlung ga las langs pa'i phyogs nas thal ba dang / sa la sogs pas gtor te mig tu song bar bya /
analyzed: rkun po 'ongs na rlung ga las langs pa'i phyogs nas thal ba dang / sa la sogs pas gtor te mig tu song bar bya /
translated: If thieves come, one should scatter dust and clods of earth from the direction the wind is blowing, causing it to enter their eyes.

original: chongs shig 'ur rdo //
analyzed: chongs shig 'ur rdo //
translated: One should shout out, “Take this!”

original: rkun po la bsdigs pa'i phyir 'ur rdo bcangs kyang nyes med /
analyzed: rkun po la bsdigs pa'i phyir 'ur rdo bcangs kyang nyes med /
translated: It is not a fault to hold up a clod of earth in order to frighten thieves.

original: ngal ba'i dge slong la mi phul /
analyzed: ngal ba'i dge slong la mi phul /
translated: Do not offer to a tired monk.🔽A father and son both entered the path of liberation. The younger son was unable to go to the temple to beat the time for the midday meal. The father was too old to go. The son offered to go and lead the father. The son died on the way.

original: mi pha spad gnyis shig thar bar zhugs pa las 'jo ta ba ni lha khang na gdugs tshod kyi gand'i brdung ba mi sleb pa'i phyir pha rgan pa 'gro mi phod pa bus phul zhing khrid ba las bu ba ste shi ba las bcas te de ltar byas
analyzed: mi pha spad gnyis shig thar bar zhugs pa las 'jo ta ba ni lha khang na gdugs tshod kyi gand'i brdung ba mi sleb pa'i phyir pha rgan pa 'gro mi phod pa bus phul zhing khrid ba las bu ba ste shi ba las bcas te de ltar byas
translated: The father did as the son had requested.

original: na nyes byas /
analyzed: na nyes byas /
translated: He did this and then committed a minor offense.

original: mgon dang bcas par bya /
analyzed: mgon dang bcas par bya /
translated: You should have a protector.

original: dge slong nad pa'am rgan po 'gro ma phod pa zhig khrid na lus kyi rim gro lus bsti pa dang mnye ba la sogs pa rim gro bya /
analyzed: dge slong nad pa'am rgan po 'gro ma phod pa zhig khrid na lus kyi rim gro lus bsti pa dang mnye ba la sogs pa rim gro bya /
translated: If you lead a sick or old monk who is unable to go, you should serve him physically by massaging his body and so forth.🔽You should rest him.

original: ngal sor gzhug / dge slong nad pa'am rgan po de 'gro mi phod na ngal sor gzhug cing bkri /
analyzed: ngal sor gzhug / dge slong nad pa'am rgan po de 'gro mi phod na ngal sor gzhug cing bkri /
translated: If that sick or old monk is unable to go, you should rest him and lead him.

original: snod dag blang /
analyzed: snod dag blang /
translated: You should carry his things.

original: dge slong nad pa 'gro mi phod pa de'i lhung bzed dang / chos gos dang rdzas la sogs pa bdag gis khur /
analyzed: dge slong nad pa 'gro mi phod pa de'i lhung bzed dang / chos gos dang rdzas la sogs pa bdag gis khur /
translated: You should carry the sick monk’s begging bowl, Dharma robes, and so forth.

original: 'on te lhan cig tu gnas su zas dang skom gyi dus su 'gro mi nus na yang ngo //
analyzed: 'on te lhan cig tu gnas su zas dang skom gyi dus su 'gro mi nus na yang ngo //
translated: If you are unable to go to the place where you are staying at the time of eating and drinking, you should do the same.

original: nad pa rgan po dang 'grogs te gdong du pha rol gyi gnas su gdugs tshod dag mi slebs na bdag sngar song yang nyes med /
analyzed: nad pa rgan po dang 'grogs te gdong du pha rol gyi gnas su gdugs tshod dag mi slebs na bdag sngar song yang nyes med /
translated: If you are with an old or sick person, it is not a downfall to go ahead to the next place if you will not arrive in time for the midday meal.

original: lhung bzed bkru /
analyzed: lhung bzed bkru /
translated: Wash the begging bowls.

original: bdag sngar gnas su 'ongs nas nad pa phyis 'ong ba'i lhung bzed dang snod spyad la sogs pa bkru /
analyzed: bdag sngar gnas su 'ongs nas nad pa phyis 'ong ba'i lhung bzed dang snod spyad la sogs pa bkru /
translated: If you arrive at the place where you are staying before the old or sick person, wash his or her begging bowl and any other utensils.🔽Arrange the seats.

original: gral la gzhag / rgan po phyis 'ong pa'i gral thabs gar bab pa gzhag / byin len bya /
analyzed: gral la gzhag / rgan po phyis 'ong pa'i gral thabs gar bab pa gzhag / byin len bya /
translated: If the old or sick person arrives later, set out his or her seat in the place that is appropriate for his or her rank.🔽Do the invitation to eat.

original: zas brims na rgan po phyis 'ong ba'i zan skal mnos te byin len bya /
analyzed: zas brims na rgan po phyis 'ong ba'i zan skal mnos te byin len bya /
translated: If you have received your food portion, take the share of the old or sick person and do the invitation to eat.🔽Check the food.

original: brtag rgan po phyis 'ong ba'i zan skal la shang tse la sogs pa brtag dgos pa yod na'ang brtag /'on te dus su na khyer te bsu /
analyzed: brtag rgan po phyis 'ong ba'i zan skal la shang tse la sogs pa brtag dgos pa yod na'ang brtag /'on te dus su na khyer te bsu /
translated: If there is a need to check the food portion of the old or sick person for insects, etc., do so. Otherwise, take it to him or her.

original: rgan po phyis 'ong bas gdugs tshod mi slebs pa tsam gyi tshod na zan skal mnos la gar phrad phrad du bsu /
analyzed: rgan po phyis 'ong bas gdugs tshod mi slebs pa tsam gyi tshod na zan skal mnos la gar phrad phrad du bsu /
translated: If the old or sick person will not arrive in time for the midday meal, take his or her food portion and meet him or her on the way.

original: gsod pa'i phas pham pa ste rnam par 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: gsod pa'i phas pham pa ste rnam par 'byed pa'o //
translated: This was the chapter on the defeating offenses that require expulsion.

original: gsod pa'i phas pham pa 'dul ba rnam par 'byed pa'i nang nas 'byung ba'i mdo /
analyzed: gsod pa'i phas pham pa 'dul ba rnam par 'byed pa'i nang nas 'byung ba'i mdo /
translated: The Sutra from the Vinaya that Differentiates the Defeat of Killing says:

original: // / mi'i rgyud kyi lag pa bcad na sbom po'o //
analyzed: // / mi'i rgyud kyi lag pa bcad na sbom po'o //
translated: If one cuts off the hand of a human being, it is a serious offense.

original: mi'i rgyud du gtogs pa'i sems can gsod sems med par lag pa bcad na sbom po'o //
analyzed: mi'i rgyud du gtogs pa'i sems can gsod sems med par lag pa bcad na sbom po'o //
translated: If one cuts off the hand of a sentient being belonging to the human species without the intention to kill, it is a serious offense.

original: de bzhin du rkang pa dang lag pa dang rkang lag gi sor mo @67a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du rkang pa dang lag pa dang rkang lag gi sor mo @67a * //
translated: Similarly, if one cuts off the foot, the hand, the fingers of the hand or foot,

original: bcad kyang sbom ste bram ze gcig cig gis drug sde au pa nan da'i slad du rgyug pa gcig bsnun nas /
analyzed: bcad kyang sbom ste bram ze gcig cig gis drug sde au pa nan da'i slad du rgyug pa gcig bsnun nas /
translated: it is a serious offense. For example, a brahmin struck one of the group of six with a stick for the sake of Upananda,

original: au pa nan das rgyal po la gsol te bram ze la smras pa dang bsnyon te khungs ma phyin nas bram ze lnga brgya 'am gcig ril gyis lag pa bcad pa las bcas /🔽gsod sems med na lag pa bcad pa shi yang sbom po'o //
analyzed: au pa nan das rgyal po la gsol te bram ze la smras pa dang bsnyon te khungs ma phyin nas bram ze lnga brgya 'am gcig ril gyis lag pa bcad pa las bcas / gsod sems med na lag pa bcad pa shi yang sbom po'o //
translated: and when Upananda complained to the king, the brahmin was accused and found guilty. All five hundred brahmins had their hands cut off.

original: span spun du me btang na'o //
analyzed: span spun du me btang na'o //
translated: If one cuts off the hand without the intention to kill, then even if the person dies, it is a serious offense.🔽If one does not consider them to be one's relatives,

original: rtsi shing la sogs pa span spun du me btang ste sems can yod par shes bzhin na sems can re re lhung ba re re spyir sbom po gcig / lha dang 'dre yod par shes te btang na sbom po gnyis su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtsi shing la sogs pa span spun du me btang ste sems can yod par shes bzhin na sems can re re lhung ba re re spyir sbom po gcig / lha dang 'dre yod par shes te btang na sbom po gnyis su 'gyur ro //
translated: If one gives them away, knowing that they are gods or ghosts, then it becomes two serious transgressions.

original: mi yod par shes te btang na pham /
analyzed: mi yod par shes te btang na pham /
translated: If one gives them away, knowing that they are human beings, then it is a defeating offense.

original: skra can btsongs na yang ngo //
analyzed: skra can btsongs na yang ngo //
translated: If one sells a human being with hair, it is also that.

original: mi bdag dbang ba btsong bar dga' ste btsongs na'ang sbom po /
analyzed: mi bdag dbang ba btsong bar dga' ste btsongs na'ang sbom po /
translated: If one sells a human being who is not one's master or is not one's property, it is a serious transgression.

original: gang gis brkus pa rgyal po'i 'khor du btad na yang ngo /
analyzed: gang gis brkus pa rgyal po'i 'khor du btad na yang ngo /
translated: If one hands over to the king's court someone who has been stolen, it is also that.

original: bdag gi rdzas rkun pos khyer ba las rkun po bzung ste nor slar dgug pa'i phyir gsad dam mi gsad gtol med par rgyal po la phul na sbom po /
analyzed: bdag gi rdzas rkun pos khyer ba las rkun po bzung ste nor slar dgug pa'i phyir gsad dam mi gsad gtol med par rgyal po la phul na sbom po /
translated: If one offers to the king, not knowing whether or not to kill a thief who has stolen one's property and who has been caught in order to get one's property back, it is a serious transgression.

original: gsod par shes bzhin du rgyal po la phul te bsad na sbom po dang pham pa gnyis ka yod /
analyzed: gsod par shes bzhin du rgyal po la phul te bsad na sbom po dang pham pa gnyis ka yod /
translated: If one offers to the king, knowing that he will be killed, then there are both a serious transgression and a defeating offense.

original: gsod pa'i phas pham pa phran tshegs su gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: gsod pa'i phas pham pa phran tshegs su gtogs pa'o //
translated: The father's defeating offense of killing is included in the minor offenses.

original: mi la gsod pa'i phas pham pa 'dul ba phran tshegs zhes bya ba'i nang nas 'byung ba'i mdo /
analyzed: mi la gsod pa'i phas pham pa 'dul ba phran tshegs zhes bya ba'i nang nas 'byung ba'i mdo /
translated: The Sutra from the Ksudraka Collection called “Subjugating the Father Who Is to Be Killed by His Son”

original: // / ston par bsgo ba'o //
analyzed: // / ston par bsgo ba'o //
translated: The Teacher’s order

original: gsad pa'i mi zhig bros te yib pa dge slong gis mthong ste /
analyzed: gsad pa'i mi zhig bros te yib pa dge slong gis mthong ste /
translated: A man to be killed ran away and hid. A fully ordained monk saw him.

original: snyegs ma mi 'ongs nas 'dri na gsad par shes te bsnyad na sbom po /
analyzed: snyegs ma mi 'ongs nas 'dri na gsad par shes te bsnyad na sbom po /
translated: If he is asked by the pursuers and he tells them, he commits a serious offense.

original: bstan pa las bzung ste bsad na pham mo //
analyzed: bstan pa las bzung ste bsad na pham mo //
translated: If he is seized by the pursuers and killed, he commits an offense entailing expulsion.

original: dper ma'i mngal lo //
analyzed: dper ma'i mngal lo //
translated: For example, in the womb.

original: gsod pa'i mi lnga drug gcig bros te yib pa las snyags ma mi 'dri ste /
analyzed: gsod pa'i mi lnga drug gcig bros te yib pa las snyags ma mi 'dri ste /
translated: Five or six men to be killed ran away and hid. The pursuers did not ask about them.

original: bdag dang mi mdza' ba gar yib pa bstan pa las gzhan zhig zin te gsad na sbom po /
analyzed: bdag dang mi mdza' ba gar yib pa bstan pa las gzhan zhig zin te gsad na sbom po /
translated: If someone else is seized and killed because of the monk’s indication of the whereabouts of his enemies, he commits a serious offense.

original: sbom po ni bdag gsod pa'o //
analyzed: sbom po ni bdag gsod pa'o //
translated: The serious offense is the killing of the monk himself.

original: dge slong bdag gis bdag bsad na sbom po /
analyzed: dge slong bdag gis bdag bsad na sbom po /
translated: If a fully ordained monk kills himself, he commits a serious offense.

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i sems kyis mi dge bar byas na nyes byas pa'o //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i sems kyis mi dge bar byas na nyes byas pa'o //
translated: If he commits a nonvirtuous action with a neutral mind, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: bsad pa'am rdeg pa'am gzhu ba'i sems med par kha nas byung rgyal du 'u ni gzhus sod rdegs zhes byas na nyes byas /
analyzed: bsad pa'am rdeg pa'am gzhu ba'i sems med par kha nas byung rgyal du 'u ni gzhus sod rdegs zhes byas na nyes byas /
translated: If you say, “Kill him,” “Beat him,” or “Strike him,” without any thought of killing, beating, or striking, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: gsod sems med par rdo bor ba la sogs pa'i khar mi la sogs pa shi'ang nyes byas /
analyzed: gsod sems med par rdo bor ba la sogs pa'i khar mi la sogs pa shi'ang nyes byas /
translated: If you throw a stone without any thought of killing, and someone dies, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: ma @67b dmigs pa'i phyir grub pa mi bya /
analyzed: ma @67b dmigs pa'i phyir grub pa mi bya /
translated: Since it is not definite, do not make it definite.

original: gsad sems med par rtsed mo la sogs pa lta bu byas te shi na nyes byas /
analyzed: gsad sems med par rtsed mo la sogs pa lta bu byas te shi na nyes byas /
translated: If you kill someone while playing, and so on, without any thought of killing, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: tshe rabs su las mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: tshe rabs su las mi 'byung ngo //
translated: It does not occur in other lifetimes.

original: mi gsad pa'i mtshon cha la sogs pas btab ste /
analyzed: mi gsad pa'i mtshon cha la sogs pas btab ste /
translated: If you strike someone with a weapon that is not meant to kill,

original: 'phral du ma shi ste bdag sngon du shi la mtshon gyis btab pa'i mi de nyid kyi lan bon gyis phyis shi na'ang pham pa med de sbom por zad do //
analyzed: 'phral du ma shi ste bdag sngon du shi la mtshon gyis btab pa'i mi de nyid kyi lan bon gyis phyis shi na'ang pham pa med de sbom por zad do //
translated: and the person does not die immediately but dies later because of the wound, you do not commit a defeating offense.

original: gsod pa'i phas pham pa dris pa 'dir gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: gsod pa'i phas pham pa dris pa 'dir gtogs pa'o //
translated: The question of defeating offenses that involve killing is included in this.

original: mi la gsod pa'i phas pham pa ste 'dul ba'i sde dris pa zhes bya ba'i nang nas 'byung ba'i mdo /
analyzed: mi la gsod pa'i phas pham pa ste 'dul ba'i sde dris pa zhes bya ba'i nang nas 'byung ba'i mdo /
translated: The Vinaya question called “The Sutra That Presents the Questions”🔽says:

original: // / sbom po ni bdag 'chi ba 'di ltar 'gyur ro zhes smra ba ni yid mi ches te de ltar grub na'o //🔽nad pa tshabs po che sman dpyad bya ba'i phyir longs zhes bslangs pa las nad pa na re nga bslang na 'chi'o zhes zer ba bzhin du bslang na shi yang rung ma shi yang rung sbom po /
analyzed: // / sbom po ni bdag 'chi ba 'di ltar 'gyur ro zhes smra ba ni yid mi ches te de ltar grub na'o // nad pa tshabs po che sman dpyad bya ba'i phyir longs zhes bslangs pa las nad pa na re nga bslang na 'chi'o zhes zer ba bzhin du bslang na shi yang rung ma shi yang rung sbom po /
translated: The monk said, “I will die if I am roused.”🔽If he is roused, whether he dies or not, it is a serious transgression.

original: dge slong nad pa zhig tshabs che zhing 'dug pa la nad g-yog / dge slong zhig gis sman dpyad bya ba'i phyir bslangs nas nad pa na re bslang na ni gdon mi za bar 'chis zhog shig ces zer ba las ma gnang ste /
analyzed: dge slong nad pa zhig tshabs che zhing 'dug pa la nad g-yog / dge slong zhig gis sman dpyad bya ba'i phyir bslangs nas nad pa na re bslang na ni gdon mi za bar 'chis zhog shig ces zer ba las ma gnang ste /
translated: A monk who was nursing a very ill monk was asked to leave in order to treat the illness. The patient said, “If I am roused, I will certainly die. Please stay.”🔽He did not agree.

original: bslang ba dang nad pa shi nas nad g-yog pham par gyur snyam the tshom zos te //
analyzed: bslang ba dang nad pa shi nas nad g-yog pham par gyur snyam the tshom zos te //
translated: The patient died. The nurse thought, “I have been defeated,” and was unsure.

original: sangs rgyas la gsol pa dang / pham pa ma yin te sbom po'o zhes bcas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas la gsol pa dang / pham pa ma yin te sbom po'o zhes bcas /
translated: He asked the Buddha, who said, “It is not a defeat, but a serious transgression.”

original: shi shig par nad pa la g-yog ma byas na'ang sbom po /
analyzed: shi shig par nad pa la g-yog ma byas na'ang sbom po /
translated: If a monk does not nurse a patient who is not certain to die, it is a serious transgression.

original: dge slong nad pa la nad g-yog su byed par de ltar gsos kyang ma sos na shing zad mod ces bsams te /
analyzed: dge slong nad pa la nad g-yog su byed par de ltar gsos kyang ma sos na shing zad mod ces bsams te /
translated: If a monk who is nursing a sick monk thinks, “If I nurse him like this but he does not recover, the wood will be exhausted,”

original: nad g-yog ma byas par bor na shi'ang rung ma shi'ang rung sbom po /
analyzed: nad g-yog ma byas par bor na shi'ang rung ma shi'ang rung sbom po /
translated: and he abandons the patient, whether he dies or not, it is a serious transgression.

original: mi 'ju ba'i zas byin na yang ngo //
analyzed: mi 'ju ba'i zas byin na yang ngo //
translated: It is also the same if one gives food that is not suitable.

original: mi nad pa rlung nad na ba la rlung nad che ba'i kha zas byin pa dang / tsha ba la drod che ba'i kha zas mi rung bar shes bzhin du gsod sems med par byin kyang sbom po /
analyzed: mi nad pa rlung nad na ba la rlung nad che ba'i kha zas byin pa dang / tsha ba la drod che ba'i kha zas mi rung bar shes bzhin du gsod sems med par byin kyang sbom po /
translated: If one gives food that increases wind to a sick person who is ill with wind, or if one gives food that increases heat to one who is ill with heat, even if one does so without the intention to kill, it is a serious transgression.

original: dge slong nad pa zhig la nad g-yog gis zan ci bsod ces dris pa dang / nad pa na re sdun na ba'i che skyur po'i nang du lan tshva btab ste 'thungs na phan gyis byin cig ces zer ba las /
analyzed: dge slong nad pa zhig la nad g-yog gis zan ci bsod ces dris pa dang / nad pa na re sdun na ba'i che skyur po'i nang du lan tshva btab ste 'thungs na phan gyis byin cig ces zer ba las /
translated: A sick monk asked his nurse, “What food do you have?” The sick monk said, “If I drink sour gruel with salt in it, it will help me. Please give it to me.”

original: nad de rlung nad yin te skyur po dang lan tshva mi rung bar byin pa las shi ba'i phyir bcas /
analyzed: nad de rlung nad yin te skyur po dang lan tshva mi rung bar byin pa las shi ba'i phyir bcas /
translated: The nurse gave it to him, and because the illness was a wind illness, it was not suitable for him to drink sour gruel with salt, and he died.

original: phol mig ma smin par brtol na yang ngo //
analyzed: phol mig ma smin par brtol na yang ngo //
translated: It is also the same if one bursts a boil that is not ripe.

original: phol mig 'bras lta bu 'og ma byung zhing ma smin par brtol na sbom po /
analyzed: phol mig 'bras lta bu 'og ma byung zhing ma smin par brtol na sbom po /
translated: If a boil that has not yet ripened and is not ready to be lanced is lanced like an eye or a boil, it is a serious transgression.🔽A monk had a boil that had not yet ripened.

original: dge slong gcig cig 'bras byung ste ma @68a * //🔽smin pa la /🔽dge slong gcig gis brtol zhes byas pa dang / ma smin gyis ma brtol zhes zer bzhin du ma gnang ste /
analyzed: dge slong gcig cig 'bras byung ste ma @68a * // smin pa la / dge slong gcig gis brtol zhes byas pa dang / ma smin gyis ma brtol zhes zer bzhin du ma gnang ste /
translated: One monk lanced it.🔽The other said, “I did not lance it because it had not ripened.”🔽The one who lanced it died.

original: brtol nas shi ba las bcas te ma brtol zhes zer ba brtol ba dang / bdag gi phol mig ma smin pa brtol pa'ang sbom po /
analyzed: brtol nas shi ba las bcas te ma brtol zhes zer ba brtol ba dang / bdag gi phol mig ma smin pa brtol pa'ang sbom po /
translated: If one lances a boil that has not ripened, it is a serious transgression.

original: rlubs su 'jug pa dang sgo phrag tu 'tshir bas gnod par byed pa la sogs pa yang ngo //🔽gsad sems med par rlubs su bcug sgo phrag tu btsir ba la sogs pa rtsed mo'i phyir nyon mongs par byas pa dang / ched gar nan la bor ba mtshungs te sbom po /
analyzed: rlubs su 'jug pa dang sgo phrag tu 'tshir bas gnod par byed pa la sogs pa yang ngo //🔽gsad sems med par rlubs su bcug sgo phrag tu btsir ba la sogs pa rtsed mo'i phyir nyon mongs par byas pa dang / ched gar nan la bor ba mtshungs te sbom po /
translated: It is also a serious transgression to harm someone by throwing them into a pit or squeezing them in a doorway, and so on.🔽If one throws someone into a pit, squeezes them in a doorway, and so on, without the intention to kill, or if one does so out of playfulness, or if one throws someone into a pit as a joke, it is a serious transgression.

original: gtsug lag khang gnyis kyi bar na dge bsnyen gtum pa zhig 'dug pa las gtsug lag khang gcig gi dge slong la rtag tu shing rtog 'bul 'bul ba las dge 'dun lta mtshungs mod ces /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gnyis kyi bar na dge bsnyen gtum pa zhig 'dug pa las gtsug lag khang gcig gi dge slong la rtag tu shing rtog 'bul 'bul ba las dge 'dun lta mtshungs mod ces /
translated: Between the two temples there was a fierce upasaka. He always offered fruit to the monks of one temple, but said, “The Sangha is equal.

original: gtsug lag khang gcig gi dge 'dun la yang phul lo //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gcig gi dge 'dun la yang phul lo //
translated: I will also offer to the Sangha of the other temple.”

original: de nas yang sngon 'bul 'bul ba'i dge slong la 'bul du song song ba las /
analyzed: de nas yang sngon 'bul 'bul ba'i dge slong la 'bul du song song ba las /
translated: Then he went to offer to the monks who had previously received the offerings.

original: dge slong de dag gis khyod lta shing tog gud du 'bul 'bul zhes sgo phrag tu btsir ba las bcas te sbom po /
analyzed: dge slong de dag gis khyod lta shing tog gud du 'bul 'bul zhes sgo phrag tu btsir ba las bcas te sbom po /
translated: The monks pushed him through the door and said, “You offer fruit separately.”

original: g-yang du 'dor ba dang 'geg pa la sogs te 'chi ba'i phyir rtsol ba yang ngo //
analyzed: g-yang du 'dor ba dang 'geg pa la sogs te 'chi ba'i phyir rtsol ba yang ngo //
translated: Also, if one makes an effort to kill oneself by jumping off a cliff, drowning in water, or by means of a weapon, and so on, it is also a serious violation.

original: bdag 'chi ba'i phyir gad ka dang / brag ka dang / mtshon ka dang / chu'i nang du mchang bar brtsal te ma shi ba yang sbom po /
analyzed: bdag 'chi ba'i phyir gad ka dang / brag ka dang / mtshon ka dang / chu'i nang du mchang bar brtsal te ma shi ba yang sbom po /
translated: If one makes an effort to kill oneself by jumping off a cliff, a rock, a weapon, or into water, and one does not die, it is a serious violation.

original: gzhan la'ang de lta bu shi na rung ngo zhes bstan te ma shi na sbom po shi na pham /
analyzed: gzhan la'ang de lta bu shi na rung ngo zhes bstan te ma shi na sbom po shi na pham /
translated: If one teaches another to kill themselves, saying, “It is right to die,” and they do not die, it is a serious violation. If they die, it is a defeating offense.

original: na ba'i phyir bab chol du mtshon tam theg bu mi sbyin /
analyzed: na ba'i phyir bab chol du mtshon tam theg bu mi sbyin /
translated: Do not give a sick person a weapon or a rope for the purpose of suicide.

original: dge slong nad pa'i drung du mtshon cha 'am theg bu la sogs pa 'chi ba'i yo byad mi gzhag /
analyzed: dge slong nad pa'i drung du mtshon cha 'am theg bu la sogs pa 'chi ba'i yo byad mi gzhag /
translated: Do not place near a sick monk a weapon or a rope that could be used to kill oneself.

original: gsad sems med kyang gzhag na nyes byas /
analyzed: gsad sems med kyang gzhag na nyes byas /
translated: If you do so without the intention to kill, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

original: shes bzhin du gtogs par bya /
analyzed: shes bzhin du gtogs par bya /
translated: You should know how to handle such situations.

original: nad pa'i sman dang zas la sogs pa la tshos sam ma tshos pa dang / sga spod bro'am mi bro ba la sogs pa snga nas shes bzhin du zhal ta bya /
analyzed: nad pa'i sman dang zas la sogs pa la tshos sam ma tshos pa dang / sga spod bro'am mi bro ba la sogs pa snga nas shes bzhin du zhal ta bya /
translated: If you know that a sick person’s medicine or food is spoiled, or that the food is poisonous, you should not prepare it for him, even if you are the manager of the monastery.

original: bdag dang dge 'dun gyi las ce byed kyang rung ste nyes par 'gyur ram mi 'gyur shes bzhin du brtag ste bya /
analyzed: bdag dang dge 'dun gyi las ce byed kyang rung ste nyes par 'gyur ram mi 'gyur shes bzhin du brtag ste bya /
translated: If you know that a certain action will result in a downfall, you should not do it, even if you are asked to do it by the community or by an individual monk.

original: de ltar ma byas na nyes byas sngags kyi phyir thal mos bsnun na yang ngo //
analyzed: de ltar ma byas na nyes byas sngags kyi phyir thal mos bsnun na yang ngo //
translated: If you do not follow these rules, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

original: nad pa la sngags gdab pa la sogs pa thal mos btab dgos pa zhig yod na yang mi drag par shes bzhin du bya /
analyzed: nad pa la sngags gdab pa la sogs pa thal mos btab dgos pa zhig yod na yang mi drag par shes bzhin du bya /
translated: If a sick person needs to be hit with the hand or with a spell, you should do it without anger.

original: shes bzhin du ma byas na nyes byas /
analyzed: shes bzhin du ma byas na nyes byas /
translated: If you do not do it, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

original: brnangs pa la @68b 'byung ba'i phyir brdeg pa yang ngo //
analyzed: brnangs pa la @68b 'byung ba'i phyir brdeg pa yang ngo //
translated: Also, if one is choking, one should beat him.

original: kha zas kyis brnangs te ltag par brdeg dgos na'ang mi drag par ran par shes bzhin du bya /
analyzed: kha zas kyis brnangs te ltag par brdeg dgos na'ang mi drag par ran par shes bzhin du bya /
translated: If one is choking on food, one should beat him on the back, but not too hard. One should know the right amount.

original: gsod sems med par shes bzhin du mi byas par shi na yang nyes byas /
analyzed: gsod sems med par shes bzhin du mi byas par shi na yang nyes byas /
translated: If one does not do this knowingly, without the intention to kill, and the other dies, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: sbab tu gtang na de bzhin du rab tu brtags te'o //
analyzed: sbab tu gtang na de bzhin du rab tu brtags te'o //
translated: If one is to be taken to a place of execution, one should do so after examining the situation.

original: shing dang rdo la sogs pa sbab tu btang dgos na yang sems can la sogs pa yod dam med pa brtags te btang ngo //
analyzed: shing dang rdo la sogs pa sbab tu btang dgos na yang sems can la sogs pa yod dam med pa brtags te btang ngo //
translated: If one is to be taken to a place of execution by means of a tree, a stone, or something else, one should examine whether or not there are sentient beings there, and then proceed.

original: ma brtags na nyes byas /🔽khur chen po la cha nyung dus brtsal bar mi bya /
analyzed: ma brtags na nyes byas / khur chen po la cha nyung dus brtsal bar mi bya /
translated: If one does not examine, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.🔽One should not make a heavy load too light.

original: bdag gi rdzas lta bu khur chen po lci ba la mi theg bzhin du mi nyung dus mi bskur spyir bo bkug ste mi 'gro //
analyzed: bdag gi rdzas lta bu khur chen po lci ba la mi theg bzhin du mi nyung dus mi bskur spyir bo bkug ste mi 'gro //
translated: If one has a heavy load like one’s own possessions, one should not make it too light, as if one is unable to carry it. One should not go with a load that is too heavy.

original: spyi bor thur du bkug ste lag 'gros mi bya dgu ste spyi bo bkug la'ang mi 'gro lag 'gros ni drug sde gcig rkang pa bkrus pa rdul gyis mi reg par bya ba dang rtsal ngom pa'i phyir lag 'gros byas pa las bcas /🔽spyi bo bkug pa na /🔽dge slong gcig spyi bo bkug ste song song ba las lug gis brdung ba las bcas /
analyzed: spyi bor thur du bkug ste lag 'gros mi bya dgu ste spyi bo bkug la'ang mi 'gro lag 'gros ni drug sde gcig rkang pa bkrus pa rdul gyis mi reg par bya ba dang rtsal ngom pa'i phyir lag 'gros byas pa las bcas / spyi bo bkug pa na / dge slong gcig spyi bo bkug ste song song ba las lug gis brdung ba las bcas /
translated: Do not shake the head up and down while walking.🔽Do not shake the head up and down while walking.🔽Do not shake the head up and down while walking.🔽Do not shake the head up and down while walking.🔽Do not shake the head up and down while walking.🔽Do not shake the head up and down while walking.🔽Do not shake the head up and down while walking.🔽Do not shake the head up and down while walking.🔽Do not shake the head up and down while walking.🔽Do not shake the head up and down while walking.🔽Do not shake the head up and down while walking.🔽Do not shake the head up and down while walking.🔽Do not shake the head up and down while walking.🔽Do not shake the head up and down while walking.🔽Do not shake the head up and down while walking.🔽Do not shake the head up and down while walking.🔽Do not shake the head up and down while walking.🔽Do not shake the head up and down while walking.🔽Do not shake the head up and down while walking.🔽Do not shake the head up and down while walking.

original: ma bslabs pas bslabs par mi bsgo'o //
analyzed: ma bslabs pas bslabs par mi bsgo'o //
translated: Do not shake the head up and down while walking.🔽Do not shake the head up and down while walking.

original: bdag gtar dpyad la sogs ba ma bslabs shing mi shes par gzhan la 'di ltar thob shig ces kyang mi bsgo bdag nyid kyis kyang mi gdab /🔽btab cing bcos na nyes byas /
analyzed: bdag gtar dpyad la sogs ba ma bslabs shing mi shes par gzhan la 'di ltar thob shig ces kyang mi bsgo bdag nyid kyis kyang mi gdab / btab cing bcos na nyes byas /
translated: Do not shake the head up and down while walking.

original: gdab pa 'phen par mi bsgo //
analyzed: gdab pa 'phen par mi bsgo //
translated: Do not shake the head up and down while walking.🔽Do not shake the head up and down while walking.🔽Do not shake the head up and down while walking.🔽Do not shake the head up and down while walking.🔽Do not shake the head up and down while walking.🔽Do not shake the head up and down while walking.🔽Do not shake the head up and down while walking.🔽Do not shake the head up and down while walking.🔽Do not shake the head up and down while walking.🔽Do not shake the head up and down while walking.🔽Do not shake the head up and down while walking.🔽Do not shake the head up and down while walking.🔽Do not shake the head up and down while walking.🔽Do not shake the head up and down while walking.

original: mda' dang mdud dang rdo la sogs pa ltad mo lta ba'i phyir yang 'phen du mi gzhug thabs bslab pa'i phyir yang /
analyzed: mda' dang mdud dang rdo la sogs pa ltad mo lta ba'i phyir yang 'phen du mi gzhug thabs bslab pa'i phyir yang /
translated: Do not shake the head up and down while walking.

original: 'di ltar phongs zhes kyang mi bsgo //
analyzed: 'di ltar phongs zhes kyang mi bsgo //
translated: Do not shake the head up and down

original: nad pa mi nus pa las mi bkri /
analyzed: nad pa mi nus pa las mi bkri /
translated: Do not lead a sick person who is unable to walk.

original: nad pa 'gro mi nus pa dang / mi na'ang dal zhing nyal nyal ba'i mi lam du na bar 'gyur ba mi bkri khrid na nyes byas /
analyzed: nad pa 'gro mi nus pa dang / mi na'ang dal zhing nyal nyal ba'i mi lam du na bar 'gyur ba mi bkri khrid na nyes byas /
translated: If the sick person is unable to walk, or is slow and lying down, do not lead them on the path. If you do, there is an offense.

original: gsod pa'i phas pham pa ste rnam par gdon mi za'o //
analyzed: gsod pa'i phas pham pa ste rnam par gdon mi za'o //
translated: The defeat of killing is certain.

original: mi la gnod pa'i phas pham pa ste 'dul ba'i sde rnam par gdon mi za ba zhes bya ba'i nang nas 'byung ba'i mdo /
analyzed: mi la gnod pa'i phas pham pa ste 'dul ba'i sde rnam par gdon mi za ba zhes bya ba'i nang nas 'byung ba'i mdo /
translated: The defeat of harming a human is certain.

original: gsod pa'i phas pham pa rdzogs so //
analyzed: gsod pa'i phas pham pa rdzogs so //
translated: The defeat of killing is complete.

original: mi la gsod pa'i phas pham pa 'dul ba so so'i nang nas 'byung ba'i mdo rdzogs so /
analyzed: mi la gsod pa'i phas pham pa 'dul ba so so'i nang nas 'byung ba'i mdo rdzogs so /
translated: The defeat of killing a human is complete.

original: // / brdzun pa'i phas pham pa la 'chad de /
analyzed: // / brdzun pa'i phas pham pa la 'chad de /
translated: The defeat of lying is explained.

original: 'du shes sba ste /
analyzed: 'du shes sba ste /
translated: Concealing one's perception,

original: bdag ge sems la med de mi shes bzhin pa dang / 'og nas yan lag bzhi 'byung ba dang lnga ldan na brdzun gyi phas pham pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ge sems la med de mi shes bzhin pa dang / 'og nas yan lag bzhi 'byung ba dang lnga ldan na brdzun gyi phas pham pa'o //
translated: pretending to oneself that one does not know, and the four branches below, when complete with five, is the defeat of lying.🔽Speaking of the human Dharma of the guru,

original: bla ma mi'i chos kyi dang / bla ma mi'i chos la smra ba dang / @69a * //
analyzed: bla ma mi'i chos kyi dang / bla ma mi'i chos la smra ba dang / @69a * //
translated: and speaking of the human Dharma of the guru,

original: ldan pa ldan pa zhes dang / bdag la bdag gi phyir dang / smras na'o //
analyzed: ldan pa ldan pa zhes dang / bdag la bdag gi phyir dang / smras na'o //
translated: “Possessing” is said in the sense of “having” and “for the sake of oneself.”

original: pha rol brda phrad pa la smras pa dang 'di lnga dang ldan na pham /
analyzed: pha rol brda phrad pa la smras pa dang 'di lnga dang ldan na pham /
translated: If one says this to someone who understands the language, one possesses five things and is defeated.

original: mthong ngo // bdag gis lha dag mthong ngo //🔽bdag kyang mthong ngo //
analyzed: mthong ngo // bdag gis lha dag mthong ngo // bdag kyang mthong ngo //
translated: “I see” is said in the sense of “I see gods.”🔽“I am seen” is said in the sense of “gods see me.”

original: lha dag gis kyang bdag mthong ngo //🔽sgra thos lha dag gi sgra bdag gis thos bdag gi yang thos /
analyzed: lha dag gis kyang bdag mthong ngo // sgra thos lha dag gi sgra bdag gis thos bdag gi yang thos /
translated: “Gods see me” is said in the sense of “I see gods.”🔽“I hear” is said in the sense of “I hear the sounds of gods” and “they hear me.”

original: bdag gi sgra yang lha dag gis thos /
analyzed: bdag gi sgra yang lha dag gis thos /
translated: “Gods hear me” is said in the sense of “I hear the sounds of gods.”

original: nye bar 'gro / lha dag gi gan du bdag kyang nye bar 'gro //🔽bdag gan nye bar 'ong /
analyzed: nye bar 'gro / lha dag gi gan du bdag kyang nye bar 'gro // bdag gan nye bar 'ong /
translated: “I approach” is said in the sense of “I approach gods.”

original: lha dag kyang bdag gi gan du nye bar 'ong /
analyzed: lha dag kyang bdag gi gan du nye bar 'ong /
translated: “They approach me” is said in the sense of “gods approach me.”

original: lhan cig tu gtam byas /
analyzed: lhan cig tu gtam byas /
translated: “Together” is said in the sense of “together with gods.”

original: lha dag dang bdag lhan cig tu gtam byas /🔽gtam kun byas /
analyzed: lha dag dang bdag lhan cig tu gtam byas / gtam kun byas /
translated: “We converse” is said in the sense of “I converse with gods.”

original: lha dag dang lhan cig gtam kun zhib tu rgyus nas bshad /
analyzed: lha dag dang lhan cig gtam kun zhib tu rgyus nas bshad /
translated: “We converse completely” is said in the sense of “we converse completely with gods.”

original: kun mgu ba lha dag gis kyang bdag mgu bar byas bdag gis kyang lha dag mgu bar byas /
analyzed: kun mgu ba lha dag gis kyang bdag mgu bar byas bdag gis kyang lha dag mgu bar byas /
translated: “We are completely satisfied” is said in the sense of “gods satisfy me and I satisfy gods.”

original: rtag tu yang lhan cig tu bdag dang spyod cing zhes smras na der 'gyur /
analyzed: rtag tu yang lhan cig tu bdag dang spyod cing zhes smras na der 'gyur /
translated: If one says, I will always enjoy myself together with the god, it is the same.

original: bdag dang lha dag rtag tu lhan cig tu 'grogs shing spyod do zhes smras pa dang tshig gi rim pa ming gis smos pa 'di rnams gang smras kyang rung ste /
analyzed: bdag dang lha dag rtag tu lhan cig tu 'grogs shing spyod do zhes smras pa dang tshig gi rim pa ming gis smos pa 'di rnams gang smras kyang rung ste /
translated: If one says, I always associate and enjoy myself with the god, it is the same if one says any of these words in the order of the names.

original: mdo 'og ma lha dang klu la sogs pa ming gis smos pa /
analyzed: mdo 'og ma lha dang klu la sogs pa ming gis smos pa /
translated: The sutra mentions gods, nagas and so on by name.

original: gang la yang rung /
analyzed: gang la yang rung /
translated: It is the same for any of these.

original: de dang 'di ltar smras shing byas so zhes smras na phas pham pa'o //
analyzed: de dang 'di ltar smras shing byas so zhes smras na phas pham pa'o //
translated: If one says, I have done this and that, it is a downfall.

original: lha 'phrul zhing rim par gnas pa dang 'phrul med cing sa la gnas pa klu phyugs kyi khams su gtogs mod kyi 'phrul yod cing che ba la bya /
analyzed: lha 'phrul zhing rim par gnas pa dang 'phrul med cing sa la gnas pa klu phyugs kyi khams su gtogs mod kyi 'phrul yod cing che ba la bya /
translated: Gods are included in the realm of animals, whether they have magical power and live in the higher realms or not, and whether they have magical power or not, the term refers to the great gods.

original: gnod sbyin 'phags skyes po lta bu chen po dang phal la bya /
analyzed: gnod sbyin 'phags skyes po lta bu chen po dang phal la bya /
translated: Yakshas are the great yakshas such as Virupaksha and the ordinary ones.

original: dri za lnga phud par mi'i dri za dang lha la rol mo byed cing 'khor ba /
analyzed: dri za lnga phud par mi'i dri za dang lha la rol mo byed cing 'khor ba /
translated: Gandharvas are the human gandharvas and the gandharvas who serve the gods.

original: mi 'am ci lus mi la mgo rta dang sbrul du 'dug pa lto 'phye chen po gsus pa che la rkang lag thung la sbom por 'dag pa'i gzugs shig yod pa /
analyzed: mi 'am ci lus mi la mgo rta dang sbrul du 'dug pa lto 'phye chen po gsus pa che la rkang lag thung la sbom por 'dag pa'i gzugs shig yod pa /
translated: The body of a kinnara is human, but the head is that of a horse or a snake. The body of a mahoraga is large, with a huge belly and short, thick arms and legs.

original: yi dags 'dre dang / sha za mi la kyal ka byed pa ded dpon nam the'u rang lta bu ril bum lus gzugs ril ril po 'am zlum po zhig yod pa /
analyzed: yi dags 'dre dang / sha za mi la kyal ka byed pa ded dpon nam the'u rang lta bu ril bum lus gzugs ril ril po 'am zlum po zhig yod pa /
translated: The body of a hungry ghost is like a ghost or a flesh-eating demon. The body of a leader or a te’urong is round or spherical.

original: lus srul po dag la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: lus srul po dag la dmigs pa'o //
translated: These are the bodies of the various types of beings.

original: lus srul po la sogs pa ming gis smos pa 'di rnams gang yang rung ste /
analyzed: lus srul po la sogs pa ming gis smos pa 'di rnams gang yang rung ste /
translated: Any of these beings mentioned by name, such as a body-snatcher,

original: mdo ltag ma'i nang nas 'byung ba gcig dang ldan par byas so zhes smras na pham pa'o //
analyzed: mdo ltag ma'i nang nas 'byung ba gcig dang ldan par byas so zhes smras na pham pa'o //
translated: if you say, “I have one who appears in the back of my head,” you have committed a defeating offense.

original: mur 'dug gi rdzu 'phrul lnga lta bu shes so zhes byas na yang pham pa'o //
analyzed: mur 'dug gi rdzu 'phrul lnga lta bu shes so zhes byas na yang pham pa'o //
translated: If you say, “I know the five miracles of a body-snatcher,” you have committed a defeating offense.

original: sbom por byed pa ni phyag dar khung na gnas shing chub mar @69b brdzu nus pa zhig yod de mthong zhes byas na'ang sbom po //
analyzed: sbom por byed pa ni phyag dar khung na gnas shing chub mar @69b brdzu nus pa zhig yod de mthong zhes byas na'ang sbom po //
translated: If you say, “I have seen a body-snatcher who lives in a dust heap and can transform into a lamp,” you have committed a serious offense.

translated: If one reconciles a fight between any four of the wives, the wife who has power over the husband, the wife who is the mother of his children, the wife who is faithful and remains in his house and so on, and the wife who is the youngest, when the couple have separated and the wife who was abandoned has not yet returned, and one says, “The two of you are not to be reconciled,” one commits a serious violation.

original: khyo la dbang yod pa'i bud med gang yang rung gsum khyo shug 'thabs te rtsa bcad bzhin du mi 'dum mo zhes zer ba las bsdums na nyes byas gsum /

original: rdo gsum por ba dang / de gnas pa la sogs pa'i bud med bzhi gang yang rung khyo shug 'thabs te rdo gsum phyogs bzhir bor ba bzhin du nged gnyis kyang slar mi 'dum ste bye'o zhes zer ba la bsdums na lhag ma'o //

translated: If a woman who has power over her husband says, “We will not reconcile as long as we are like the four stones that were thrown in the four directions,” then there is a serious fault if she does not reconcile.

original: khyo la dbang yod pa'i chung ma gsum gang yang rung ste khyo shug 'thabs te phyogs bzhir rdo bor ba bzhin nga dang gnyis mi 'dum zhes zer ba la bsdums na nyes byas gsum sbom po gcig / spyod pa btang ba dang / dang de gnas pa la sogs pa chung ma bzhi gang yang rung ste khyo shug 'thabs nas so nam @81b dang spyod pa btang ste so so na 'khod pa las bsdums na lhag ma /

translated: If one reconciles a wife who has relinquished her duties and so on, any of the four wives who fight with their husbands, abandon their duties and farming, and live separately, then there is a residual fault.

analyzed: khyo la dbang yod pa'i chung ma gsum gang yang rung 'thabs te spyod pa btang ba las bsdums na nyes byas gsum sbom po gnyis /

analyzed: chung ma ma yin par bsgo ba dang / dang de gnas pa la sogs pa'i chung ma bzhi gang yang rung 'thabs pa nas mi mang po'i drung du bye ste /

original: khyo shug ma yin no zhes bsgo ba las bsdums na lhag ma khyo la dbang yod pa'i chung ma gsum gang yang rung chung ma ma yin par bsgo ba las bsdums na nyes byas gsum sbom po gsum lhag ma gcig / dril brdungs pa dag go //

analyzed: smyan gyi ste dris pa'i'o //

analyzed: chos kyi phyir nor gyis mdun du byas te bos na yang ngo //
