translated: If a man and a woman who have previously met are unable to meet again because of work,

original: dge slong gis mchod ston gyi nang du bkug ste sprad na yang sbom po /
analyzed: dge slong gis mchod ston gyi nang du bkug ste sprad na yang sbom po /
translated: if a monk invites them to a feast and they meet, it is a serious violation.

original: bud med dang skyes pa gnyis shig sngon phrad zin pa las 'thabs nas phrad mi spobs pa las /
analyzed: bud med dang skyes pa gnyis shig sngon phrad zin pa las 'thabs nas phrad mi spobs pa las /
translated: If a man and a woman who have previously met fight and are unable to meet again,

original: dge slong gis thabs byas te mchod ston gyi rgyu bud med sbyor du bcug nas skyes pa las mi brnyas te sprad par byas nas mi tshangs par spyod du bcug pa las bcas /
analyzed: dge slong gis thabs byas te mchod ston gyi rgyu bud med sbyor du bcug nas skyes pa las mi brnyas te sprad par byas nas mi tshangs par spyod du bcug pa las bcas /
translated: A monk used a stratagem to cause a woman to give the requisites for a feast and then to be disrespected by a man. He made them have sexual intercourse.

original: gzhan gyi phyir ldan na yang ngo //
analyzed: gzhan gyi phyir ldan na yang ngo //
translated: It is also a downfall to do this for another person.🔽A man who was a stranger married a woman whose husband was away from home.

original: khyim thab byes su song ba'i bud med gcig la mi dra ma zhig chung mar blangs par byas pa las bud med de ma btub nas khyim thab kyang byes su shi mi dra ma des sha nar byas te /
analyzed: khyim thab byes su song ba'i bud med gcig la mi dra ma zhig chung mar blangs par byas pa las bud med de ma btub nas khyim thab kyang byes su shi mi dra ma des sha nar byas te /
translated: Because the woman was uncooperative, the man killed her.

original: bud med de sman kun dong du bcug pa las chung ma de'i mas /
analyzed: bud med de sman kun dong du bcug pa las chung ma de'i mas /
translated: The woman’s mother hid her daughter’s body.

original: dge slong gcig la spring ste bdag cag ma smad ni khyod mnga' ste khyod kyis bka' ci stsal bar bas so zhes byas nas /
analyzed: dge slong gcig la spring ste bdag cag ma smad ni khyod mnga' ste khyod kyis bka' ci stsal bar bas so zhes byas nas /
translated: The mother sent a message to a monk, saying, “We are yours, mother and daughter. Do whatever you command.”

original: dge slong gis phrin byas te bsdus pa las bcas /
analyzed: dge slong gis phrin byas te bsdus pa las bcas /
translated: The monk went to the house and was killed.

original: de ltar byas na sbom po /
analyzed: de ltar byas na sbom po /
translated: If you act in this way, you have a serious transgression.

original: ma khros par sems can la ba gzhan du yang ma yin zhes par ma chud pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ma khros par sems can la ba gzhan du yang ma yin zhes par ma chud pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that it is not included in the other downfalls.

original: khro sems med par sems can nam rdo shing ci yang rung thal mo dang khu tshur gyis bsnun na nyes byas /
analyzed: khro sems med par sems can nam rdo shing ci yang rung thal mo dang khu tshur gyis bsnun na nyes byas /
translated: If one strikes a sentient being, a stone, or a tree with one's hand or a fist without an angry mind, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: bud med dang skyes pa sngon phrad pa zhig las skyes pas bud med la mi tshangs par spyod du dong zhes byas pa dang / bud med na re brel gyi dge slong @83a * //
analyzed: bud med dang skyes pa sngon phrad pa zhig las skyes pas bud med la mi tshangs par spyod du dong zhes byas pa dang / bud med na re brel gyi dge slong @83a * //
translated: A man who had previously met a woman said to her, “Let us go to have sex.” The woman said, “Wait, send a monk.”

original: zhig mngags te des khyed kyi rgyab tu khu tshur cig bsnun na shog shig ces byas te bud med kyis dge slong la skyes pa de'i rgyab tu khu tshur cig snun cig ces bsgos nas dge slong gis skyes pa la khu tshur cig bsnun pa dang /
analyzed: zhig mngags te des khyed kyi rgyab tu khu tshur cig bsnun na shog shig ces byas te bud med kyis dge slong la skyes pa de'i rgyab tu khu tshur cig snun cig ces bsgos nas dge slong gis skyes pa la khu tshur cig bsnun pa dang /
translated: The man sent a monk, saying, “Go to her and if she says, ‘Strike my back with your fist,’ then return.” The woman told the monk, “Strike his back with your fist.” The monk struck the man’s back with his fist.

original: skyes pa na re nged mi tshangs par spyod pa'i than khyod kyis byas kyi dge'o zhes byas /
analyzed: skyes pa na re nged mi tshangs par spyod pa'i than khyod kyis byas kyi dge'o zhes byas /
translated: The man said, “You have ruined our sexual relations. This is not good.”

original: 'dus pa'i 'og tu dge slong the tshom zos nas phyin chad khro sems med par sems can dang rdo shing la khu tshur gyis brdegs na nyes byas zhes bcas /🔽smyan gyis ta rnam par gdon mi za ba'i'o //🔽smyan gyi dge 'dun gyi lhag ma ste 'dul ba bye brag tu gdon mi za ba'i nang nas 'byung ba'i mdo //
analyzed: 'dus pa'i 'og tu dge slong the tshom zos nas phyin chad khro sems med par sems can dang rdo shing la khu tshur gyis brdegs na nyes byas zhes bcas / smyan gyis ta rnam par gdon mi za ba'i'o // smyan gyi dge 'dun gyi lhag ma ste 'dul ba bye brag tu gdon mi za ba'i nang nas 'byung ba'i mdo //
translated: After the assembly, a monk had doubts. Later, if one hits sentient beings or stones and wood with one's fist without an angry mind, it is a minor offense.🔽The chapter on matchmaking from the Vinaya Sutra of Irreversible Progress.

original: smyan gyi'o // smyan gyi dge 'dun gyi lhag ma ste 'dul ba sde so so'i nang nas 'byung ba'i mdo rdzogs so /
analyzed: smyan gyi'o // smyan gyi dge 'dun gyi lhag ma ste 'dul ba sde so so'i nang nas 'byung ba'i mdo rdzogs so /
translated: The chapter on matchmaking from the Vinaya Sutra of Individual Sections is complete.

original: // / khang pa'i dge 'dun gyi lhag ma la 'chad /
analyzed: // / khang pa'i dge 'dun gyi lhag ma la 'chad /
translated: The chapter on the Saṅgha's offense of building a house.

original: nyes med pa ni spyod lam bzhi'i snod med pa'o /
analyzed: nyes med pa ni spyod lam bzhi'i snod med pa'o /
translated: The faultless is the vessel of the four modes of conduct.

original: khang bu chur gom pa gsum mam lus 'phres na shong ba dang zheng du skyil mo krung bcas na bde blag tu shong ba dang 'phang du 'greng na spyi bo reg tsam byas te brtsigs pa ni nyes med do //
analyzed: khang bu chur gom pa gsum mam lus 'phres na shong ba dang zheng du skyil mo krung bcas na bde blag tu shong ba dang 'phang du 'greng na spyi bo reg tsam byas te brtsigs pa ni nyes med do //
translated: A hut that is three cubits in length, or where the body can fit, and in width, where one can easily sit cross-legged, and in height, where the head can just touch the ceiling when standing, if built, there is no fault.

original: bsgos pa dang ma bsgos pa'ang tha mi dad do //
analyzed: bsgos pa dang ma bsgos pa'ang tha mi dad do //
translated: Also, the stained and unstained are not different.

original: gang zag cig gi phyir khang pa brtsigs la bdag gis rgyu phyung ste sa mi gtsang yang glas rtsigs shig ces /
analyzed: gang zag cig gi phyir khang pa brtsigs la bdag gis rgyu phyung ste sa mi gtsang yang glas rtsigs shig ces /
translated: For the sake of a single person, build a house and I will give you the materials. Even if the ground is dirty, pay the workers and build it.

original: dge slong cig la bcol na lhag ma bcol ba'i dge slong gis kyang mi gtsang bzhin du brtsigs na lhag ma rgyu phog ste lhag mar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: dge slong cig la bcol na lhag ma bcol ba'i dge slong gis kyang mi gtsang bzhin du brtsigs na lhag ma rgyu phog ste lhag mar mi 'gyur /
translated: If a monk is told to do this, and the monk who is told to do the remainder builds it even though the ground is dirty, then the remainder is not a downfall even though the materials were given.

original: tshul bzhin du rtsigs shig byas pa las de bzhin du ma byas la rjes su yi rang ste rgyu phyi mas kyang bsnan te byed du bcug na lhag ma /
analyzed: tshul bzhin du rtsigs shig byas pa las de bzhin du ma byas la rjes su yi rang ste rgyu phyi mas kyang bsnan te byed du bcug na lhag ma /
translated: If he says, “Build it properly,” and it is not built properly, but he approves of it and makes the later giver give the materials, then it is a downfall.

original: tshul bzhin du rtsig tu bcug pa las nyes par brtsigs te nyes so zhes byas nas rgyu phyi ma yang ma yin par btang na nyes med /
analyzed: tshul bzhin du rtsig tu bcug pa las nyes par brtsigs te nyes so zhes byas nas rgyu phyi ma yang ma yin par btang na nyes med /
translated: If he says, “Build it properly,” and it is built improperly, and he says, “It is faulty,” and does not give the later materials, then there is no fault.

original: bcol ba yang bdag po bzhin no //
analyzed: bcol ba yang bdag po bzhin no //
translated: The one who is told to do it is like the owner.

original: mdo ltag ma ltar rgyu phog ste gzhan rtsig tu bcug pa bdag gis rgyu phyung yang lag dar te ma brtsigs pas lhag mar mi 'gyur ro snyam bsams kyang lhag mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mdo ltag ma ltar rgyu phog ste gzhan rtsig tu bcug pa bdag gis rgyu phyung yang lag dar te ma brtsigs pas lhag mar mi 'gyur ro snyam bsams kyang lhag mar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one thinks, “I will extract the materials and build the wall, but since I will not build it with my own hands, there will be no offense,” there will be an offense.

original: bcol pa'i dge slong des kyang bdag gis brtsigs kyang rgyu gzhan gyi yin pas lhag mar mi 'gyur ro snyam bsams kyang mi phan te lhag mar 'gyur ro //🔽smras pa bzhin du ma byas pa la lus dang ngag gis mos pa yang ngo //
analyzed: bcol pa'i dge slong des kyang bdag gis brtsigs kyang rgyu gzhan gyi yin pas lhag mar mi 'gyur ro snyam bsams kyang mi phan te lhag mar 'gyur ro // smras pa bzhin du ma byas pa la lus dang ngag gis mos pa yang ngo //
translated: If one thinks, “I will build it, but since the materials belong to another, there will be no offense,” there will be an offense.🔽If one does not act in accordance with one’s promise, there is also the motivation of body and speech.

original: @83b mdo ltag ma'i yang ltag ma'i nang nas 'byung ba bzhin du khang pa tshul bzhin du rtsigs shig ces bsgo ste rgyu byin pa las bsgo ba bzhin du ma byas te nyes par brtsigs pa la ngag gis de ltar brtsigs kyang rung ngo //
analyzed: @83b mdo ltag ma'i yang ltag ma'i nang nas 'byung ba bzhin du khang pa tshul bzhin du rtsigs shig ces bsgo ste rgyu byin pa las bsgo ba bzhin du ma byas te nyes par brtsigs pa la ngag gis de ltar brtsigs kyang rung ngo //
translated: If one thinks, “Build the house properly,” but does not act in accordance with one’s promise, there is the offense of speech.

original: rjes su yi rang bar smras pa dang lus kyis rjes su yi rang ste las byed pa'i grogs byas pa rtsam gyis lhag mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rjes su yi rang bar smras pa dang lus kyis rjes su yi rang ste las byed pa'i grogs byas pa rtsam gyis lhag mar 'gyur ro //
translated: It is a serious offense if one rejoices with the body, or if one assists in the action by saying, “Excellent!”

original: byas pa la gcig go //
analyzed: byas pa la gcig go //
translated: If one has done it, it is one offense.

original: khang pa lhag mar 'gyur ba zhig brtsigs te skabs skabs su bzhag cing brtsigs pa'am rmad bres pa'am thog bor ba lta bu re re la sbom po re rer mi 'gyur gyi sbom po gcig dang zin na lhag mar 'gyur du zad do //
analyzed: khang pa lhag mar 'gyur ba zhig brtsigs te skabs skabs su bzhag cing brtsigs pa'am rmad bres pa'am thog bor ba lta bu re re la sbom po re rer mi 'gyur gyi sbom po gcig dang zin na lhag mar 'gyur du zad do //
translated: If one builds a hut that exceeds the right size, and one puts it aside and builds it again, or if one builds it with a hole, or if one builds it with a hole in the roof, it is not a serious offense for each of these, but it is a serious offense if one completes it.

original: yan lag ni tha dad du mi byed do //
analyzed: yan lag ni tha dad du mi byed do //
translated: One does not receive a serious offense for each part.

original: sa ni gtsang ba dang tshad las 'das pa dang dge 'dun la ma gsol ba la sogs pa yan lag re re la sbom po re rer mi 'gyur gyi yan lag gcig dang ldan pa gzhan dang ma ldan na sbom po //
analyzed: sa ni gtsang ba dang tshad las 'das pa dang dge 'dun la ma gsol ba la sogs pa yan lag re re la sbom po re rer mi 'gyur gyi yan lag gcig dang ldan pa gzhan dang ma ldan na sbom po //
translated: If one does not request permission from the saṅgha, and so on, it is not a serious offense for each part, but if one has one part and does not have another, it is a serious offense.

original: bslangs pa des bsgo na'o //
analyzed: bslangs pa des bsgo na'o //
translated: If one asks for permission and then does it.

original: bdag gi phyir khang pa brtsigs pa'i rgyu bdag nyid kyis bslangs kyang rung gzhan btang ste slong du bcug kyang rung yan lag gcig / de'i rnam pas so //
analyzed: bdag gi phyir khang pa brtsigs pa'i rgyu bdag nyid kyis bslangs kyang rung gzhan btang ste slong du bcug kyang rung yan lag gcig / de'i rnam pas so //
translated: It is a part because it is the cause of building a house for oneself, whether one asks for it oneself or sends someone else to ask.🔽One part is gold, silver, wood, copper, etc.

original: gser dngul dang shing dang pha gu la sogs pa yan lag gcig / khang pa'i gzhi bslangs pa la yan lag gcig ste /
analyzed: gser dngul dang shing dang pha gu la sogs pa yan lag gcig / khang pa'i gzhi bslangs pa la yan lag gcig ste /
translated: One part is the site of the house.

original: yan lag 'di gnyis la gcig tu'ang brtsi /
analyzed: yan lag 'di gnyis la gcig tu'ang brtsi /
translated: These two parts are counted as one.

original: dngos po mi gtsang na'o //
analyzed: dngos po mi gtsang na'o //
translated: If the object is impure.

original: khang pa brtsigs pa'i sa mi gtsang ba dang / ma gsol na'o //
analyzed: khang pa brtsigs pa'i sa mi gtsang ba dang / ma gsol na'o //
translated: If the site of the house is impure, and if one does not ask permission.

original: khang pa brtsigs pa dang dge 'dun la ma gsol ba dang / gnas khang yin pa dang / byed du bcug na'o //
analyzed: khang pa brtsigs pa dang dge 'dun la ma gsol ba dang / gnas khang yin pa dang / byed du bcug na'o //
translated: If one builds a house, and does not ask the Saṅgha for permission, and if it is a dwelling, and if one has it built.

original: bdag gis byed dam gzhan byed du bcug pa dang / mtha' so khang pa zin par yang byas pa dang / bslangs pa ma gtogs te de ma thag pa'ang 'di bzhin no //
analyzed: bdag gis byed dam gzhan byed du bcug pa dang / mtha' so khang pa zin par yang byas pa dang / bslangs pa ma gtogs te de ma thag pa'ang 'di bzhin no //
translated: If one does it oneself or has someone else do it, and if one has finished the house, and if one has asked, and if it is immediate, it is the same as this.

original: dge 'dun gyi phyir khang chen brtsigs pa yan lag ltag tu smos pa rnams las mdo bslangs pa dang de'i rnam pa gnyis zhes zer ba gnyis ma gtogs par gzhan kun khang chen gyi yan lag tu gtogs so //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi phyir khang chen brtsigs pa yan lag ltag tu smos pa rnams las mdo bslangs pa dang de'i rnam pa gnyis zhes zer ba gnyis ma gtogs par gzhan kun khang chen gyi yan lag tu gtogs so //
translated: The exception is the two, requesting a sutra and its aspects, from the branches of the great house for the sake of the Saṅgha.

original: gcig gi phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig gi phyir ro //
translated: For one’s own sake.

original: bdag gcig pu'i phyir brtsigs kyang rung grogs dge slong gcig gi phyir brtsigs kyang rung yan lag gcig / tshad las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gcig pu'i phyir brtsigs kyang rung grogs dge slong gcig gi phyir brtsigs kyang rung yan lag gcig / tshad las 'das pa'o //
translated: Whether it is built for one’s own sake or for the sake of one friend, a fully ordained monk, it is one branch.🔽Exceeding the size.

original: tshad las kyang 'das par brtsigs pa dang yan lag dgu dang ldan na bdag gi phyir khang pa brtsigs pa'i lhag mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshad las kyang 'das par brtsigs pa dang yan lag dgu dang ldan na bdag gi phyir khang pa brtsigs pa'i lhag mar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is built exceeding the size and possessing nine branches, it becomes the remainder for building a house for one’s own sake.

original: ma brtags pa dang rtsod pa dang mi yangs pa ni mi gtsang ba'o //
analyzed: ma brtags pa dang rtsod pa dang mi yangs pa ni mi gtsang ba'o //
translated: Uninspected, disputed, and not spacious are unclean.

original: ltag na mdo @84a * //
analyzed: ltag na mdo @84a * //
translated: Above, the sutra.

original: mi gtsang zhes 'byung ba ni ma brtags pa dang rtsod pa dang mi yangs pa gsum ni mi gtsang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi gtsang zhes 'byung ba ni ma brtags pa dang rtsod pa dang mi yangs pa gsum ni mi gtsang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The occurrence of “unclean” is the three, uninspected, disputed, and not spacious, which are called unclean.

original: ji ltar ma brtags pa dang rtsod pa dang mi yangs pa ni mdo 'og ma las 'chad pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar ma brtags pa dang rtsod pa dang mi yangs pa ni mdo 'og ma las 'chad pa yin /
translated: As for the uninvestigated, the disputed, and the uninhabited, they are explained in the next sūtra.

original: 'gro ba phre'u'i tshad dang / khang pa brtsigs pa'i sa dang sprul lam sdig sbrul la sogs pa'i tshang yod pa ni ma brtags pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba phre'u'i tshad dang / khang pa brtsigs pa'i sa dang sprul lam sdig sbrul la sogs pa'i tshang yod pa ni ma brtags pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The uninvestigated is the size of a bird’s nest, the site for building a house, a snake’s burrow, and so on.

original: rgyal po dang / rgyal po'i khrims dang mi 'dra ba la sogs pa'i grong dang nye bar brtsigs pa dang / lha'i grong dang / mur 'dug gi gnas su nye ba dang / mur 'dug nyid kyi grong dang nye bar brtsigs pa dang / shing mi gtsang ba dang /
analyzed: rgyal po dang / rgyal po'i khrims dang mi 'dra ba la sogs pa'i grong dang nye bar brtsigs pa dang / lha'i grong dang / mur 'dug gi gnas su nye ba dang / mur 'dug nyid kyi grong dang nye bar brtsigs pa dang / shing mi gtsang ba dang /
translated: The disputed is building a house near a town that is not similar to the king’s town, near a town of gods, near a town of outcasts, or near a town of outcasts, or building a house in a place where unclean trees

original: yul mi spyod pa'i grib shing bcad cing mi brtsigs pa dang 'di rnams ni rtsod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yul mi spyod pa'i grib shing bcad cing mi brtsigs pa dang 'di rnams ni rtsod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and shade trees used by the people of the country are cut down. These are called the disputed.

original: 'dom gyi mtha' tshun chad dang / ming gis smos pa 'di rnams ni khang pa'i rmang la mi gnod na bar 'dom gang tsam gyis bcad nas brtsig / khang pa la gnod cing dog na 'dom dus bcad kyang mi phan te mi yangs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'dom gyi mtha' tshun chad dang / ming gis smos pa 'di rnams ni khang pa'i rmang la mi gnod na bar 'dom gang tsam gyis bcad nas brtsig / khang pa la gnod cing dog na 'dom dus bcad kyang mi phan te mi yangs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: If the house is too small, it is not helpful to build it more than an arm's length away from the house. This is called 'not spacious'.🔽One should not build a house on the bank of a river, a stream, a river, etc.🔽One should not build a house on a cliff, a cliff, a ravine, etc.

original: phyi rol gyi chu bo dang / 'bab chu dang gtsang po la sogs pa'i 'gram du mi brtsig / gad kha dang gad pa dang grog po la sogs pa'i khar nye bar mi brtsig / khron pas yog ste khron pa dang rdzing bu dang mtshe'u la sogs pa dang nye bar mi brtsig ste 'di
analyzed: phyi rol gyi chu bo dang / 'bab chu dang gtsang po la sogs pa'i 'gram du mi brtsig / gad kha dang gad pa dang grog po la sogs pa'i khar nye bar mi brtsig / khron pas yog ste khron pa dang rdzing bu dang mtshe'u la sogs pa dang nye bar mi brtsig ste 'di
translated: One should not build a house near a well, a pond, a lake, etc.

original: rnams ni mi yangs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnams ni mi yangs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called 'not spacious'.

original: 'di rnams ni grangs ji bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams ni grangs ji bzhin pa'o //
translated: These are in the same order as the above.

original: mdo ltag ma ma brtags pa rtsod pa dang mi yangs pa zhes 'byung ba la mdo 'dis go rims bzhin du 'chad cing gnyer song ba la bya /
analyzed: mdo ltag ma ma brtags pa rtsod pa dang mi yangs pa zhes 'byung ba la mdo 'dis go rims bzhin du 'chad cing gnyer song ba la bya /
translated: In the sutra, it is said that 'the back of the hill is not examined' and 'not spacious', which are explained in this sutra in order and are called 'the back of the hill'.

original: tshad ma'i khru phyed dang do la bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho'o //
analyzed: tshad ma'i khru phyed dang do la bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho'o //
translated: The measure of a cubit is half a cubit and a quarter of a sugata.

original: ltag nas mdo tshad las 'das zhes 'byung ba la 'chad de /
analyzed: ltag nas mdo tshad las 'das zhes 'byung ba la 'chad de /
translated: It is explained that the phrase “exceeding the measure of the sutra” means:

original: tshad ni mi 'bring po'i lus la khru phyed dang bzhi yod pa'i khru phyed dang do la bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang gi tshad du brtsi'o //
analyzed: tshad ni mi 'bring po'i lus la khru phyed dang bzhi yod pa'i khru phyed dang do la bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang gi tshad du brtsi'o //
translated: The measure of a cubit is half a cubit and a quarter of a sugata, which is considered to be the measure of one sugata cubit.

original: de'i mtho bcu gnyis dang bdun te nang rgya'i tshad do //
analyzed: de'i mtho bcu gnyis dang bdun te nang rgya'i tshad do //
translated: Twelve of those cubits is the measure of a sugata arm span.

original: khang pa'i chur ni bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho bcu gnyis /
analyzed: khang pa'i chur ni bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho bcu gnyis /
translated: The height of the house is twelve sugata cubits.

original: zheng du bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho bdun gyi tshad du rmang gi nang logs nas bcal /
analyzed: zheng du bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho bdun gyi tshad du rmang gi nang logs nas bcal /
translated: The width is seven sugata cubits, measured from the inside of the foundation.

original: gsol ba ni dge 'dun la gsol te thos na'o //
analyzed: gsol ba ni dge 'dun la gsol te thos na'o //
translated: The request is made to the saṅgha and is heard.

original: ltag na mdo ma gsol na zhes 'byung ba la 'chad de /
analyzed: ltag na mdo ma gsol na zhes 'byung ba la 'chad de /
translated: It is explained that the phrase “if the sutra is not requested” means:

original: gsol ba ni mtshams gcig gi dge 'dun thams cad la las byed pa'i dge slong gcig gis gsol te gnang na brtsigs /
analyzed: gsol ba ni mtshams gcig gi dge 'dun thams cad la las byed pa'i dge slong gcig gis gsol te gnang na brtsigs /
translated: The request is made to the entire saṅgha of one boundary by one monk who performs the rite. If they agree, it is measured.

original: gnang ba ma byin na @84b dge 'dun la nyes byas /
analyzed: gnang ba ma byin na @84b dge 'dun la nyes byas /
translated: If they do not give permission, there is an offense of wrong conduct for the saṅgha.

original: mi gtsang na mi gsol /
analyzed: mi gtsang na mi gsol /
translated: If it is not clean, do not accept it.

original: khang pa brtsig pa'i sa ma brtags pa dang mi yangs pa na khang pa su brtsig pa'i dge slong des mi gsol /
analyzed: khang pa brtsig pa'i sa ma brtags pa dang mi yangs pa na khang pa su brtsig pa'i dge slong des mi gsol /
translated: If the site for building a hut has not been examined and is not spacious, the monk who wants to build a hut should not request it.

original: gsol na gsol ba'i tshe nyes byas /🔽bdag cag gam dge slong dag la bskos te thong la yid ches par gyis shig / dge slong khang pa brtsigs par dge 'dun la gsol na khang pa'i sa dge 'dun gyis blta'o //
analyzed: gsol na gsol ba'i tshe nyes byas / bdag cag gam dge slong dag la bskos te thong la yid ches par gyis shig / dge slong khang pa brtsigs par dge 'dun la gsol na khang pa'i sa dge 'dun gyis blta'o //
translated: If he requests it, he commits an offense at the time of requesting.🔽If the monk who wants to build a hut requests the Sangha, the Sangha should examine the site for the hut.

original: dge 'dun la zad pa ltar nus na yang dge slong khrims la mkhas shing cong rol mi byed pa yid ches shing brtan pa las khang pa'i sa ltar dgye'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun la zad pa ltar nus na yang dge slong khrims la mkhas shing cong rol mi byed pa yid ches shing brtan pa las khang pa'i sa ltar dgye'o //
translated: If the Sangha is unable to do so, then a monk who is skilled in the rules, who does not cause trouble, who is trustworthy and steadfast, should be appointed by the Sangha or by the monks to examine the site for the hut.

original: gding ba yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: gding ba yang de bzhin no //
translated: The same applies to the site for a straw mat.

original: gding ba lo drug lon pa sar pas brje na /
analyzed: gding ba lo drug lon pa sar pas brje na /
translated: If a monk who has used a straw mat for six years wants to exchange it for a new one,

original: snying po spyad du bzod dam mi bzod dge 'dun gyis blta ba yang khang sa dge 'dun gyis blta ba dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: snying po spyad du bzod dam mi bzod dge 'dun gyis blta ba yang khang sa dge 'dun gyis blta ba dang 'dra'o //
translated: the Sangha should examine whether the old mat still has any essence left in it. The examination of the site for a hut and the examination of the straw mat are similar.

original: ltung ba med pa ni byas pa'i rnyed pa dang spyod pa'o //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ni byas pa'i rnyed pa dang spyod pa'o //
translated: There is no offense if the mat is used for a long time and is worn out.

original: khang pa la nyes par mi 'gyur ba ni brtsigs zin pa cig gzhan gyis sbyin pa dang gzhan gyis brtsigs pa'i nang nas gnas shing spyod pa ni nyes med do //
analyzed: khang pa la nyes par mi 'gyur ba ni brtsigs zin pa cig gzhan gyis sbyin pa dang gzhan gyis brtsigs pa'i nang nas gnas shing spyod pa ni nyes med do //
translated: There is no offense if the dwelling has already been built and another monk gives it to him, or if he lives and uses it in a dwelling built by another.

original: gding pa yang lo drug ma lon zhing spyad du bzod pa las gzhan gyis sar pa zhig byin te bcangs shing spyad kyang nyes med do //
analyzed: gding pa yang lo drug ma lon zhing spyad du bzod pa las gzhan gyis sar pa zhig byin te bcangs shing spyad kyang nyes med do //
translated: There is no offense if the mat has not been used for six years, and he uses it after having it given to him by another.

original: rnying pa la bcos na yang ngo //
analyzed: rnying pa la bcos na yang ngo //
translated: There is no offense if he repairs an old one.

original: khang pa rnying pa grum pa dang gas pa dang ral ba bcos pa'ang nyes med /
analyzed: khang pa rnying pa grum pa dang gas pa dang ral ba bcos pa'ang nyes med /
translated: There is no offense if he repairs an old dwelling that is cracked, broken, or torn.

original: gding ba'ang de dang 'dra /🔽khang pa'i ste dge 'dun gyi lhag ma'o //🔽khang pa'i dge 'dun gyi lhag ma ste 'dul ba rnam par 'byed pa'i nang nas 'byung ba'i mdo /
analyzed: gding ba'ang de dang 'dra / khang pa'i ste dge 'dun gyi lhag ma'o // khang pa'i dge 'dun gyi lhag ma ste 'dul ba rnam par 'byed pa'i nang nas 'byung ba'i mdo /
translated: The same applies to a mat.🔽This is the offense for a monk who has a dwelling made for the Saṅgha.🔽This is the Saṅghadisesa offense for a monk who has a dwelling made for the Saṅgha.

original: // / dge 'dun gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: // / dge 'dun gyi phyir ro //
translated: This is the summary of the Saṅghadisesa rules.

original: khang chen ni dge 'dun gyi phyir byas pa yan lag gcig tu brtsis te ltag tu bdag gi phyir khang pa brtsigs pa'i yan lag rnams kyi steng du 'dis bsnan te sngar ldan na lhag mar 'gyur /
analyzed: khang chen ni dge 'dun gyi phyir byas pa yan lag gcig tu brtsis te ltag tu bdag gi phyir khang pa brtsigs pa'i yan lag rnams kyi steng du 'dis bsnan te sngar ldan na lhag mar 'gyur /
translated: Since the large house is considered one part built for the sake of the Sangha, if one adds to it the parts of a house built for oneself, it becomes an excess.

original: gtsug lag khang gi dge 'dun gyi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gi dge 'dun gyi lhag ma'o //
translated: It is the excess of the Sangha of the temple.🔽It is the excess of the Sangha of the large house.

original: khang chen gyi dge 'dun gyi lhag ma ste 'dul ba rnam par 'byed pa'i nang nas 'byung ba'i mdo /🔽// / brtsams pas na sbyor ba'i'o //
analyzed: khang chen gyi dge 'dun gyi lhag ma ste 'dul ba rnam par 'byed pa'i nang nas 'byung ba'i mdo / // / brtsams pas na sbyor ba'i'o //
translated: This is the sutra that appears in the Vinaya Divisions.🔽If one builds a house for oneself, it becomes an excess.

original: bdag gis khang pa brtsigs pa lhag mar 'gyur ba zhig las zin par ma byas te rked chad du por na sbom po /
analyzed: bdag gis khang pa brtsigs pa lhag mar 'gyur ba zhig las zin par ma byas te rked chad du por na sbom po /
translated: If one does not complete the building but abandons it in the middle, it is a serious offense.

original: zin na sbom por 'gyur ba las rked chad du bor na nyes byas /
analyzed: zin na sbom por 'gyur ba las rked chad du bor na nyes byas /
translated: If one completes it, it becomes a serious offense. If one abandons it in the middle, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: thog ma phub par zin pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: thog ma phub par zin pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: If one completes the roof, it is the same.

original: khang pa brtsigs nas thog ma phub par bor na sbom po thog mi dbub par bsams te thog ma phub par bzhag na sbom po //
analyzed: khang pa brtsigs nas thog ma phub par bor na sbom po thog mi dbub par bsams te thog ma phub par bzhag na sbom po //
translated: If one builds a house and abandons the roof, it is a serious offense. If one intends not to build a roof and places the roof, it is a serious offense.

original: du ma'i @85a * //
analyzed: du ma'i @85a * //
translated: If one builds many houses,

original: phyir ba'o // phyogs bcu'i dge 'dun gyi phyir yang ma yin mi gcig gi phyir yang ma yin par gnyis yan chad du yang rung ming gis bsngos te /
analyzed: phyir ba'o // phyogs bcu'i dge 'dun gyi phyir yang ma yin mi gcig gi phyir yang ma yin par gnyis yan chad du yang rung ming gis bsngos te /
translated: It is serious if one builds a hut for oneself, or for the sake of the Sangha of the ten directions, or for the sake of a single person, or for the sake of two or more people, or if one builds it after dedicating it to a person by name,

original: 'di rnams kyi phyir bya'o zhes brtsigs na sbom po /🔽ma btang ba'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi phyir bya'o zhes brtsigs na sbom po / ma btang ba'o //
translated: saying, “I will build it for these people.”🔽It is serious if one builds a hut without having been given permission.

original: khang pa'i gzhi gzhan gyis ma byin nam ma nyos par thug thub tu brtsigs te rku sems dang mi ldan par brtsigs na sbom po /
analyzed: khang pa'i gzhi gzhan gyis ma byin nam ma nyos par thug thub tu brtsigs te rku sems dang mi ldan par brtsigs na sbom po /
translated: It is serious if one builds a hut on a site that has not been given or bought, and one does not have the intention of stealing it.

original: rku sems dang ldan pa ni pham pa'i skabs su 'chad /
analyzed: rku sems dang ldan pa ni pham pa'i skabs su 'chad /
translated: If one has the intention of stealing it, this is dealt with in the section on the defeating offense.

original: gang zag gis so //
analyzed: gang zag gis so //
translated: It is serious if the site and the materials belong to an individual.🔽It is serious if one builds a hut on a site that belongs to the Sangha.🔽It is serious if one builds a hut on a site that has been assigned to another.🔽It is serious if one builds a hut on a site that has been assigned to oneself.

original: khang pa'i sa dang rin bdag nyid kyi yin pa las brtsigs na'ang sbom po //🔽brtsams pa yang ngo //
analyzed: khang pa'i sa dang rin bdag nyid kyi yin pa las brtsigs na'ang sbom po // brtsams pa yang ngo //
translated: It is serious if one builds a hut on a site that has been assigned to oneself, but then abandons the project.

original: gzhan zhig gis khang pa brtsigs te lhag mar 'gyur ba zhig 'phro bor te lus pa las dge slong cig gis 'phro brtsigs na sbom po /
analyzed: gzhan zhig gis khang pa brtsigs te lhag mar 'gyur ba zhig 'phro bor te lus pa las dge slong cig gis 'phro brtsigs na sbom po /
translated: It is serious if one builds a hut on a site that has been assigned to oneself, but then abandons the project, and then another monk builds on the site where the first monk left off.

original: nyes byas pa ni gsol ba'i 'og tu zin par ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: nyes byas pa ni gsol ba'i 'og tu zin par ma byas pa'o //
translated: It is a minor offense if one does not complete the building within the time limit after having requested permission.

original: khang pa brtsigs par dge 'dun la gsol to //
analyzed: khang pa brtsigs par dge 'dun la gsol to //
translated: The monks were asked to build a house.

original: gnas pa las phyis ma brtsigs par bor na nyes byas /🔽khang pa'i gtsug lag khang dge 'dun gyi lhag mar gtogs pa ste dris pa'i'o //
analyzed: gnas pa las phyis ma brtsigs par bor na nyes byas / khang pa'i gtsug lag khang dge 'dun gyi lhag mar gtogs pa ste dris pa'i'o //
translated: If it is not built later and left unfinished, it is a minor infraction.🔽The house and temple belong to the Sangha.

original: khang pa dang gtsug lag khang gi dge 'dun gyi lhag ma ste 'dul ba dris pa zhes bya ba'i nang nas 'byung ba'i mdo /
analyzed: khang pa dang gtsug lag khang gi dge 'dun gyi lhag ma ste 'dul ba dris pa zhes bya ba'i nang nas 'byung ba'i mdo /
translated: The Sangha's remainder of the house and temple is called the Vinaya Questions.

original: // / rtsa ba med pa'i lhag ma la 'chad de /
analyzed: // / rtsa ba med pa'i lhag ma la 'chad de /
translated: It is explained as the remainder without a root.

original: dge slong phas pham pa'i kun spyod pa /
analyzed: dge slong phas pham pa'i kun spyod pa /
translated: A monk who has committed a defeating offense🔽is slandered by saying, I have committed any of the defeating offenses.

original: dge slong phas pham pa med pa la phas pham pa gang kyang rung byas so zhes skur pa dang / dge slong pham pa yod pa zhig la pham pas skur na'ang lhag mar 'gyur /
analyzed: dge slong phas pham pa med pa la phas pham pa gang kyang rung byas so zhes skur pa dang / dge slong pham pa yod pa zhig la pham pas skur na'ang lhag mar 'gyur /
translated: If a monk who has a defeating offense is slandered by saying, You have committed a defeating offense, it is also a partial defeat.

original: ltung ba yang 'dir bdag gi phyogs su yan lag tu ma yin te /
analyzed: ltung ba yang 'dir bdag gi phyogs su yan lag tu ma yin te /
translated: Here, the downfall is not a branch of one's own side.

original: dge slong phas dge slong ma la phas pham par skur ba dang / dge slong mas dge slong pha la phas pham pas skur pa yang /
analyzed: dge slong phas dge slong ma la phas pham par skur ba dang / dge slong mas dge slong pha la phas pham pas skur pa yang /
translated: A fully ordained monk who reviles a fully ordained nun with a defeating offense and a fully ordained nun who reviles a fully ordained monk with a defeating offense

original: sde mi mthun pa'i phyir lhag mar mi 'gyur ba ni ma yin te lhag mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sde mi mthun pa'i phyir lhag mar mi 'gyur ba ni ma yin te lhag mar 'gyur ro //
translated: do not become residual because they are not of the same class, but they do become residual.

original: la la brdzun gyis bsgo na'o //
analyzed: la la brdzun gyis bsgo na'o //
translated: If one is instructed by a lie.

original: dge slong tshul khrims dang ldan pa dang chos log pa la bltas pa la dge slong tshul khrims la dam zhing log pa la ma bltas pas skur kyang lhag mar 'gyur /
analyzed: dge slong tshul khrims dang ldan pa dang chos log pa la bltas pa la dge slong tshul khrims la dam zhing log pa la ma bltas pas skur kyang lhag mar 'gyur /
translated: If a fully ordained monk who is ethical sees a heretic and a fully ordained monk who is not ethical does not see a heretic, then even if the former reviles the latter, it is a residual offense.

original: de bzhin du log pa la bltas pas log pa la ma bltas pa la skur na yang lhag mar 'gyur /
analyzed: de bzhin du log pa la bltas pas log pa la ma bltas pa la skur na yang lhag mar 'gyur /
translated: Similarly, if one who sees a heretic reviles one who does not see a heretic, it is a residual offense.

original: 'pho bar 'dod pas so //
analyzed: 'pho bar 'dod pas so //
translated: It is said that it is through wishing to change the sex.

original: dge slong tshangs par spyod pa dang sangs rgyas kyi chos dang dbral bar bya ba'i phyir byas pa dang / dge slong phas pham pa med de gtsang ba dang brdzun du @85b skur ba dang / bdag gis smras te gzhan gyis thos te go ba dang /
analyzed: dge slong tshangs par spyod pa dang sangs rgyas kyi chos dang dbral bar bya ba'i phyir byas pa dang / dge slong phas pham pa med de gtsang ba dang brdzun du @85b skur ba dang / bdag gis smras te gzhan gyis thos te go ba dang /
translated: and one says this oneself and another hears and understands it.

original: yan lag 'di bzhi dang ldan na rtsa ba med pa la skur na lhag ma /
analyzed: yan lag 'di bzhi dang ldan na rtsa ba med pa la skur na lhag ma /
translated: If one has these four factors, then if one falsely accuses one who has no root downfall, one commits a partial defeat.

original: de rtsa ba gzhan du ma yin no //
analyzed: de rtsa ba gzhan du ma yin no //
translated: But if one falsely accuses one who has a root downfall, one does not commit a partial defeat.

original: dge slong phas pham pa bzhi las gang yang rung ba cig yod pa las pham pa gzhan du ming gis bsnor te skur na yang lhag ma ;
analyzed: dge slong phas pham pa bzhi las gang yang rung ba cig yod pa las pham pa gzhan du ming gis bsnor te skur na yang lhag ma ;
translated: If a fully ordained monk has any one of the four root downfalls, but one falsely accuses him of another root downfall by changing the name, one commits a partial defeat.

original: phas pham pa med pa la brkus pa'i phas pham par skur bar bsam pa las brdzun gyi phas pham pa byas so zhes smras na'ang lhag mar 'gyur /
analyzed: phas pham pa med pa la brkus pa'i phas pham par skur bar bsam pa las brdzun gyi phas pham pa byas so zhes smras na'ang lhag mar 'gyur /
translated: If one falsely accuses one who has no root downfall of a root downfall of stealing, but one commits a root downfall of lying, one commits a partial defeat.

original: brjed na med pa'o //
analyzed: brjed na med pa'o //
translated: If one forgets, one does not commit a partial defeat.

original: dge slong phas pham pa yod par sngon shes shes pa las brjed de mi dran pa bzhin du phas pham pa byas so zhes skur na'ang lhag ma ;
analyzed: dge slong phas pham pa yod par sngon shes shes pa las brjed de mi dran pa bzhin du phas pham pa byas so zhes skur na'ang lhag ma ;
translated: It is a partial defeat if one accuses another of having a defeating offense, but one does not remember that one previously knew that the other had a defeating offense.

original: rkyen ma yin pa ni mi brdzun par yang dag pa'i don to //
analyzed: rkyen ma yin pa ni mi brdzun par yang dag pa'i don to //
translated: The condition of not being a partial defeat is the opposite of that.

original: phas pham pa yod par mi shes bzhin du skur pa dang phas pham pa yod pa la brjed de skur ba dang phas pham pa yod la ming bsnor te skur pa rnams ni phas pham pa yod de bden kyang bdag gi sems la sangs rgyas kyi chos dang🔽bral zhing skur pa gdab par bsam pa'i phyir lhag mar mi 'gyur ba'i rkyen ma yin te lhag mar 'gyur ro //🔽rtsa ba med pa'i dge 'dun gyi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: phas pham pa yod par mi shes bzhin du skur pa dang phas pham pa yod pa la brjed de skur ba dang phas pham pa yod la ming bsnor te skur pa rnams ni phas pham pa yod de bden kyang bdag gi sems la sangs rgyas kyi chos dang bral zhing skur pa gdab par bsam pa'i phyir lhag mar mi 'gyur ba'i rkyen ma yin te lhag mar 'gyur ro // rtsa ba med pa'i dge 'dun gyi lhag ma'o //
translated: If one does not know that the other has a defeating offense, but accuses him of having one, or if one forgets that the other has a defeating offense, or if one accuses the other of having a defeating offense, but changes the name of the other, then one has a defeating offense, but it is not a partial defeat.🔽The condition of not being a partial defeat is the opposite of that.🔽The root of the partial defeat of the Saṅgha is not in the Vinaya.

original: rtsa ba med pa'i dge 'dun gyi lhag ma 'dul ba rnam par 'byed pa'i nang nas 'byung ba'i mdo /
analyzed: rtsa ba med pa'i dge 'dun gyi lhag ma 'dul ba rnam par 'byed pa'i nang nas 'byung ba'i mdo /
translated: The root of the partial defeat of the Saṅgha is not in the Vinaya.

original: // / rnam par ma yin pa'i chas skur pa'i lhag ma la 'chad de /
analyzed: // / rnam par ma yin pa'i chas skur pa'i lhag ma la 'chad de /
translated: The remainder of the downfalls that are not complete is explained.

original: tshig las gzhan pa la gnas te ngag gis brdzun na'o //
analyzed: tshig las gzhan pa la gnas te ngag gis brdzun na'o //
translated: If one lies with speech, other than with words,🔽two monks and two nuns are sitting.

original: dge slong pha dang dge slong ma gnyis shig kyang 'dug pha rol na sha ba rgyo zhing 'khod pa las ha ba rgyo ba'i cha blangs te /🔽dge slong pho mo gnyis shig 'khod pa la rgyo bo zhes skur ba las bcas te /
analyzed: dge slong pha dang dge slong ma gnyis shig kyang 'dug pha rol na sha ba rgyo zhing 'khod pa las ha ba rgyo ba'i cha blangs te / dge slong pho mo gnyis shig 'khod pa la rgyo bo zhes skur ba las bcas te /
translated: If one accuses a pure monk of having taken part in sex or of having taken part in stealing,🔽it is a partial defeat.

original: dge slong gtsang ma la gzhan rku ba dang rgyo ba'i cha blangs te skur na lhag ma /🔽lhag ma rtsa ba med pa rtsis mgo snga ma bzhi'i steng du rnam par ma yin pa'i chas skur pa 'dis bsnan te lngar ldan na lhag ma /
analyzed: dge slong gtsang ma la gzhan rku ba dang rgyo ba'i cha blangs te skur na lhag ma / lhag ma rtsa ba med pa rtsis mgo snga ma bzhi'i steng du rnam par ma yin pa'i chas skur pa 'dis bsnan te lngar ldan na lhag ma /
translated: If one accuses a pure monk of having taken part in stealing or of having taken part in sex, it is a partial defeat.

original: gzhan gyi chas skur ba'i dge 'dun gyi lhag ma ste 'dul ba rnam par 'byed pa'i mdo /
analyzed: gzhan gyi chas skur ba'i dge 'dun gyi lhag ma ste 'dul ba rnam par 'byed pa'i mdo /
translated: The partial defeat of the Saṃgha for accusing others of downfalls is the Vinaya Scripture.

original: // / sbom po ni gzhug gnas med pa la skur ba'o //
analyzed: // / sbom po ni gzhug gnas med pa la skur ba'o //
translated: The grave is accusing one who has no fault of having committed a defeating offense.

original: dge slong pho mtshan chad pa mi tshangs par spyod du mi rung ba zhig la mi tshangs par spyod do zhes skur na rtsa ba med pa dang rnam par ma yin pa'i cha gang yang rung ste sbom po /
analyzed: dge slong pho mtshan chad pa mi tshangs par spyod du mi rung ba zhig la mi tshangs par spyod do zhes skur na rtsa ba med pa dang rnam par ma yin pa'i cha gang yang rung ste sbom po /
translated: If one accuses a fully ordained monk whose male organ has been removed and who is not fit to engage in sexual intercourse of having engaged in sexual intercourse, it is a serious violation, regardless of whether the accusation is true or not.

original: ming ma phyung ba yang ngo //
analyzed: ming ma phyung ba yang ngo //
translated: It is also a serious violation if one does not mention the name of the person one is accusing.

original: dge 'dun nam dge slong mang zhig 'khod pa'i nang @86a * //
analyzed: dge 'dun nam dge slong mang zhig 'khod pa'i nang @86a * //
translated: If one says to a group of many fully ordained monks or nuns,

original: du ming nas ma phyung zhing dmigs kyis ma bsngos par 'di'i nang na ni pham pa yod ces smras te 'phrig tu bcug pa ni sbom po /
analyzed: du ming nas ma phyung zhing dmigs kyis ma bsngos par 'di'i nang na ni pham pa yod ces smras te 'phrig tu bcug pa ni sbom po /
translated: “Among you is someone who has committed a defeating offense,” without mentioning the name of the person one is accusing and without specifying the person, it is a serious violation.

original: yang dag par gshegs pa la ngan sems kyis khrag phyung ba dang dge 'dun gyi dbyen kyang /
analyzed: yang dag par gshegs pa la ngan sems kyis khrag phyung ba dang dge 'dun gyi dbyen kyang /
translated: Drawing blood with evil intent toward a Tathāgata and creating a schism in the saṅgha are also serious violations.

original: yang dag par gshegs pa la ngan sems kyis khrag phyung ba dang / dge 'dun gyi dbyen byas te gsol ba dang zhu ba lan gsum du ma bsgo ba ni sdig gi 'bras bu mtshams med par 'gyur /
analyzed: yang dag par gshegs pa la ngan sems kyis khrag phyung ba dang / dge 'dun gyi dbyen byas te gsol ba dang zhu ba lan gsum du ma bsgo ba ni sdig gi 'bras bu mtshams med par 'gyur /
translated: Drawing blood with evil intent toward a Tathāgata and creating a schism in the saṅgha without requesting forgiveness three times is a serious violation that has the result of a heinous act.

original: ltung ba'i rim pa ni sbom por 'gyur te ngan sems kyis khrag phyung ngo zhes skur pa dang dge 'dun gyi dbyen byas so zhes skur ba ni rtsa ba med pa'i dge 'dun gyi lhag ma'i sbom po /

analyzed: bzlog pa bzhin du zhu ba'o //

original: bslab pa ni so sor ro //
analyzed: bslab pa ni so sor ro //

translated: When the Saṅgha performs the rite of requesting that any of the following not be done—schism, siding with a schismatic, defiling an aristocratic family, or speaking unpleasantly—the monk commits one serious offense for requesting and one serious offense for each of the three statements of the request.

original: bsgo ba dang yang ma yin no //
analyzed: bsgo ba dang yang ma yin no //

translated: When he says this to the saṅgha, the schism is complete and there is no other fault.

original: 'jug par ni sbyor ba bzhin no //
analyzed: 'jug par ni sbyor ba bzhin no //

original: 'di la mi bsgo bar bya /

analyzed: ngag dka' ba ni lan gsum ma bsgo bar bskrad par mi bya'o // zhes byi tsa ya bar mas bshad /

analyzed: 'di dag la mdza' ba dang las kyis mi bsgo bar mi bya /

translated: If there is one who engages in the four: schism, following schism, defiling a clan and difficult speech, first one should advise and correct him, saying, Do not act in this way.

translated: The other explanations such as the request and inquiry are similar to the explanation of schism above.🔽This is the partial defeat of the Saṅgha that follows.
