translated: The Saṃghabhedakavastu of the Vinaya-vibhanga explains that the Saṅgha’s defeating offense of disparaging a fellow monk is a defeating offense.

original: dge slong rnams kyis dge slong gi tshul khrims la bskul ba la tshig tu mi 'byed par der rang gis byed na'o //
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis dge slong gi tshul khrims la bskul ba la tshig tu mi 'byed par der rang gis byed na'o //
translated: When monks exhort a monk to maintain his ethical discipline, if he does not respond to their words, but instead acts on his own,

original: dge slong tshul khrims 'dral zhing chu'i nang na srin bu mi rtog par gsod pa la sogs pa khrims 'dral zhing ltung bar gyur pa de mthol tshangs byos sdig pa dang ltung bar 'gyur ba de ma byed cig ces bsgo ba la slar 'khyal zhing kho bo la
analyzed: dge slong tshul khrims 'dral zhing chu'i nang na srin bu mi rtog par gsod pa la sogs pa khrims 'dral zhing ltung bar gyur pa de mthol tshangs byos sdig pa dang ltung bar 'gyur ba de ma byed cig ces bsgo ba la slar 'khyal zhing kho bo la
translated: if a monk violates his ethical discipline and kills insects in water, and so on, and then violates his ethics and becomes guilty of a downfall, if he is told, “Confess your sins and downfalls! Do not commit evil and downfalls!” and he replies abusively, “I will do whatever I want!

original: tshe dang ldan pa khyod ci yang ma zer cig / dge 'ang rung sdig kyang rung bdag kyang cang mi zer ro zhes zer zhing slar lan log pas ldon nam cang mi smra bar 'dug cing ngag dka' bar byed pa la dge 'dun gyis tshul khrims dang ldan
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa khyod ci yang ma zer cig / dge 'ang rung sdig kyang rung bdag kyang cang mi zer ro zhes zer zhing slar lan log pas ldon nam cang mi smra bar 'dug cing ngag dka' bar byed pa la dge 'dun gyis tshul khrims dang ldan
translated: If you say, Venerable, do not say anything at all, then I will not say anything at all, whether it is virtuous or nonvirtuous. If one replies in this way, or if one remains silent, or if one makes it difficult for the other to speak, then the Saṅgha should admonish the monk with pure conduct, saying, Do not make it difficult for the other to speak. Listen to the one with pure conduct and confess your faults. This is done with three announcements and a proposal, making four announcements.

original: pa'i dge slong la ngag dka' bar ma byed par tshul khrims dang ldan pas bsgo ba bzhin du nyon la mthol tshangs byos zhes gsol ba gsum dang zhu ba dang bzhis bsgo ste ma nyan na lhag mar 'gyur te dbyen gyi rtsis mgo dang 'dra ba lnga'i steng
analyzed: pa'i dge slong la ngag dka' bar ma byed par tshul khrims dang ldan pas bsgo ba bzhin du nyon la mthol tshangs byos zhes gsol ba gsum dang zhu ba dang bzhis bsgo ste ma nyan na lhag mar 'gyur te dbyen gyi rtsis mgo dang 'dra ba lnga'i steng
translated: If one does not listen, then it becomes a partial defeat.

original: du 'dis bsnan te /🔽ldan par byas na lhag mar 'gyur te /
analyzed: du 'dis bsnan te / ldan par byas na lhag mar 'gyur te /
translated: This is added to the five that are the basis for schism.

original: ngag dka' ba'i dge 'dun gyi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: ngag dka' ba'i dge 'dun gyi lhag ma'o //
translated: If one makes it difficult for the other to speak, then it becomes a partial defeat.🔽This is the partial defeat of making it difficult for the other to speak.

original: ngag dka' ba'i dge 'dun gyi lhag ma ste 'dul ba rnam par 'byed pa'i nang nas 'byung ba'i mdo dge 'dun gyi lhag ma rdzogs so /
analyzed: ngag dka' ba'i dge 'dun gyi lhag ma ste 'dul ba rnam par 'byed pa'i nang nas 'byung ba'i mdo dge 'dun gyi lhag ma rdzogs so /
translated: The partial defeat of making it difficult for the other to speak is finished.

original: // / bcu gsum dge 'dun gyi lhag ma la 'chad pa 'dul ba so so'i nang nas 'byung ba'i mdo sde lhag ma la 'chad pa rdzogs so /🔽// /'di man chad sum cu spang pa'i ltung ba la 'chad de /
analyzed: // / bcu gsum dge 'dun gyi lhag ma la 'chad pa 'dul ba so so'i nang nas 'byung ba'i mdo sde lhag ma la 'chad pa rdzogs so / // /'di man chad sum cu spang pa'i ltung ba la 'chad de /
translated: The explanation of the class of offenses that require confession alone is finished.🔽From here on, the explanation of the thirty downfalls that require rejection is given.

original: spang pa'i 'chang ba la 'chad de /
analyzed: spang pa'i 'chang ba la 'chad de /
translated: The explanation of the class of offenses that require confession is finished.

original: snga ma med pa'i nyin zhag gi mtha' ma gtogs te med pa'o //
analyzed: snga ma med pa'i nyin zhag gi mtha' ma gtogs te med pa'o //
translated: The exception is the last day of the month.

original: gos shig rnyed na rnyed pa'i nang par gyi skya rengs phan chad sngar 'das pa'i zhag rnams ni grangs su mi brtsi'o //
analyzed: gos shig rnyed na rnyed pa'i nang par gyi skya rengs phan chad sngar 'das pa'i zhag rnams ni grangs su mi brtsi'o //
translated: If a monk obtains a piece of cloth, he must sew it into the robes by the next dawn. The days that have already passed are not counted.

original: nam rnyed pa nas mgo btsugs te de @88a * //
analyzed: nam rnyed pa nas mgo btsugs te de @88a * //
translated: From the day he obtains the cloth, he must begin to sew it into the robes.

original: bzhin du dge slong dang nyal ba dang / bud med dang nyal ba dang / zhag bdun pa'i sman dang dbye ba'i chos gos zhag drug pa dang / gos kha sogs zla ba gcig pa dang g-yul na zhag gnyis gnas pa la sogs pa las /
analyzed: bzhin du dge slong dang nyal ba dang / bud med dang nyal ba dang / zhag bdun pa'i sman dang dbye ba'i chos gos zhag drug pa dang / gos kha sogs zla ba gcig pa dang g-yul na zhag gnyis gnas pa la sogs pa las /
translated: Similarly, the rules on sleeping in the same room as a monk, sleeping with a woman, medicine for seven days, the six-day rule for separating the patched robe from the other robes, the one-month rule for the edges of the robes, staying two days in an army camp, and so on,

original: ltung bar 'gyur ro cog thams cad zhag gi mtshams brtsi ba'ang 'di dang 'dra ste skya rengs kyis gcod de /
analyzed: ltung bar 'gyur ro cog thams cad zhag gi mtshams brtsi ba'ang 'di dang 'dra ste skya rengs kyis gcod de /
translated: Also, all the downfalls that are to be confessed within a period of one day are to be counted from the time of the first light of dawn.

original: sbyor ba'i snod gnas /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i snod gnas /
translated: The basis of the downfall is the vessel,

original: sbyor ba ni ltung bar sbyor ba /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni ltung bar sbyor ba /
translated: the application is the act of committing the downfall,

original: snod ni zhag bsags nas ltung bar 'gyur ba la bya /
analyzed: snod ni zhag bsags nas ltung bar 'gyur ba la bya /
translated: the vessel is the accumulation of days until the downfall is incurred,🔽the basis is a woman and a monk staying and living in the same house.

original: gnas ni bud med dang dge slong khyim gcig na 'khod cing gnas pa la bya ste 'chad pa'i spang ba ni zhag bcur sngags ma btab na nyes byas /🔽bcu gcig gi skya rengs byung na ltung ba'o //
analyzed: gnas ni bud med dang dge slong khyim gcig na 'khod cing gnas pa la bya ste 'chad pa'i spang ba ni zhag bcur sngags ma btab na nyes byas / bcu gcig gi skya rengs byung na ltung ba'o //
translated: The downfall of keeping an extra begging bowl for more than ten days is a minor infraction for each day until the eleventh day of dawn.

original: bud med dang nyal ba ni thog ma nyal ba nas nyes byas la zhag lon na ltung ba /🔽zhag las 'gyur ba gzhan yang de bzhin du 'dra bar go bar bya /
analyzed: bud med dang nyal ba ni thog ma nyal ba nas nyes byas la zhag lon na ltung ba / zhag las 'gyur ba gzhan yang de bzhin du 'dra bar go bar bya /
translated: Sleeping with a woman is a minor infraction from the first moment of lying down with her until the first light of dawn.🔽If one day has passed, it is a downfall.

original: skya rengs dang bo'i thog ma 'di'o //
analyzed: skya rengs dang bo'i thog ma 'di'o //
translated: One should understand that the other downfalls that are incurred after a certain number of days are similar to this.🔽The first light of dawn is the first light of dawn.

original: skya rengs kyis tshad gzung ba skya rengs rnam gsum yod de sngo rengs ni dang por 'byung ste /
analyzed: skya rengs kyis tshad gzung ba skya rengs rnam gsum yod de sngo rengs ni dang por 'byung ste /
translated: There are three kinds of dawn: the blue dawn is the first to appear.

original: lho phyogs kyi gling du nyi ma shar nas shing 'dzam bu'i glor bab pa dang 'dzam bu'i gseb nas 'ong byung ba 'dzam bu'i lo ma'i 'od kyis sngon por 'byung ste de byung ba'i tshad du brtsi'o //
analyzed: lho phyogs kyi gling du nyi ma shar nas shing 'dzam bu'i glor bab pa dang 'dzam bu'i gseb nas 'ong byung ba 'dzam bu'i lo ma'i 'od kyis sngon por 'byung ste de byung ba'i tshad du brtsi'o //
translated: When the sun rises in the southern continent, it shines on the Jambu tree, and the light of the Jambu tree turns blue. The time when it appears is considered the time of dawn.

original: dmar rengs ni shing 'dzam bu las nyi ma 'phags pa dang 'od dmar por byung ba la bya /
analyzed: dmar rengs ni shing 'dzam bu las nyi ma 'phags pa dang 'od dmar por byung ba la bya /
translated: The reddish dawn is when the sun rises above the Jambu tree and its light turns red.

original: ser rengs ni nyi ma nam mkha' la mngon par byung nas 'od ser por byung pa la bya ste /
analyzed: ser rengs ni nyi ma nam mkha' la mngon par byung nas 'od ser por byung pa la bya ste /
translated: The yellowish dawn is when the sun appears in the sky and its light turns yellow.

original: skya rengs phyi ma gnyis kyis ni mi brtsi'o //
analyzed: skya rengs phyi ma gnyis kyis ni mi brtsi'o //
translated: The two later dawns are not considered.

original: nyi ma shar nas las su mi rung ngo //
analyzed: nyi ma shar nas las su mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not suitable to work after sunrise.

original: gso sbyin dang tshul nas 'byung ba dang tshul du 'jug pa ni zhag dus las kyang skya rengs kyis ni tshad mi gzung gi nyi ma shar tshun chad las byar rung ngo //
analyzed: gso sbyin dang tshul nas 'byung ba dang tshul du 'jug pa ni zhag dus las kyang skya rengs kyis ni tshad mi gzung gi nyi ma shar tshun chad las byar rung ngo //
translated: The poṣadha ceremony and the rules of the rite are not measured by the dawn, but it is suitable to work until sunrise.

original: spang ba ni bdag gir 'du shes pa gtso ba'o //
analyzed: spang ba ni bdag gir 'du shes pa gtso ba'o //
translated: The main factor in the downfall is the perception of ownership.

original: spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ba ni rdzas bdag gi lag tu 'ongs shing thob la bdag gi yin par bsams shing shes pa las spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur te gos kyi spu ni /
analyzed: spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ba ni rdzas bdag gi lag tu 'ongs shing thob la bdag gi yin par bsams shing shes pa las spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur te gos kyi spu ni /
translated: The offense of abandoning is when the substance comes into the monk's hand, is obtained, and he thinks and knows it is his.

original: dge slong la brtags pa bal dang dar dang zar ma dang du gu la dang ko tam pa dang / aa ba ran ta ka dang ras dang bdun las sngags ma thebs na spang bar 'gyur /
analyzed: dge slong la brtags pa bal dang dar dang zar ma dang du gu la dang ko tam pa dang / aa ba ran ta ka dang ras dang bdun las sngags ma thebs na spang bar 'gyur /
translated: For a monk, wool, silk, cotton, dukūla, koṭambaka, avarantaka and cloth, if not less than seven years old, are abandoned if not consecrated.

original: ma brtags pa ni rnga mo re'u ri dags kyi bal dang mtho ris kyi gos rnams ni sngags mi 'chags /
analyzed: ma brtags pa ni rnga mo re'u ri dags kyi bal dang mtho ris kyi gos rnams ni sngags mi 'chags /
translated: Unconsecrated wool of camel, sheep, deer and celestial cloth are not consecrated.

original: 'di bsngos na med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di bsngos na med pa'o //
translated: If this is consecrated, it is lost.

original: gos shig gud @88b nas 'ongs te rnyed pa'i mi gzhan zhig sbyin pa dang gzhan du gtang bar bsams nas bsngos te bzhag pa ni sngags ma btab kyang nyes med do //
analyzed: gos shig gud @88b nas 'ongs te rnyed pa'i mi gzhan zhig sbyin pa dang gzhan du gtang bar bsams nas bsngos te bzhag pa ni sngags ma btab kyang nyes med do //
translated: If a cloth comes from elsewhere and is obtained, if one thinks of giving it to another or sending it elsewhere, and it is consecrated, then it is not necessary to consecrate it again.

original: rab tu 'byung bar 'dod pa'i phyir bsngos na yang de'o //
analyzed: rab tu 'byung bar 'dod pa'i phyir bsngos na yang de'o //
translated: If it is consecrated for the sake of going forth, it is the same.

original: gos shig rnyed na gsar du rab tu 'byung ba zhig yod /
analyzed: gos shig rnyed na gsar du rab tu 'byung ba zhig yod /
translated: If one finds a piece of cloth, it is to be used as the robes of a newly ordained monk.

original: de'i gos dang yo byad du bya'o zhes bsngos te bzhag pa yang sngags ma btab kyang nyes par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i gos dang yo byad du bya'o zhes bsngos te bzhag pa yang sngags ma btab kyang nyes par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if one does not recite the mantra, there is no fault in dedicating it to that end.

original: gos brtags pa yang ngo //🔽gos shig rnyed na bdag gi yo byad bcu gsum du bsngo ba'i sngags kyis btab pa dang gos lhag pa'i sngags kyis btab pa dang bdag la mi dgos te slar byin pa dang blangs nas gzhan sbyin par bsngos pa dang 'di bzhi gang ltar byas kyang nyes par
analyzed: gos brtags pa yang ngo // gos shig rnyed na bdag gi yo byad bcu gsum du bsngo ba'i sngags kyis btab pa dang gos lhag pa'i sngags kyis btab pa dang bdag la mi dgos te slar byin pa dang blangs nas gzhan sbyin par bsngos pa dang 'di bzhi gang ltar byas kyang nyes par
translated: One should also examine the cloth.🔽If one finds a piece of cloth, one should recite the mantra of the thirteen articles of a monk, the mantra of the excess cloth, and the mantra of not needing it oneself, and dedicate it to giving to others.

original: mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If one does any of these four, there is no fault.

original: 'dir rgyud ni zhigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir rgyud ni zhigs pa'o //
translated: Here, the continuity is broken.

original: gos shig rnyed de zhag dgu tsam na sngags kyis btab na zhag brgyad kyi bar tu sngags kyis ma btab pa zhag de rnams zhigs nyes par mi 'gyur ba'ang bya /
analyzed: gos shig rnyed de zhag dgu tsam na sngags kyis btab na zhag brgyad kyi bar tu sngags kyis ma btab pa zhag de rnams zhigs nyes par mi 'gyur ba'ang bya /
translated: If one finds a piece of cloth and recites the mantra after nine days, even if it is not recited for eight days, it is not broken and there is no fault.

original: lhag pa'i sngags kyis btab na mkhan po yin par bsam pas bdag gis sems pa med de zhigs pa la yang bya /
analyzed: lhag pa'i sngags kyis btab na mkhan po yin par bsam pas bdag gis sems pa med de zhigs pa la yang bya /
translated: If it is consecrated with the special mantra, then if one thinks, “It is the preceptor’s,” one should not think, “It is mine,” and if one uses it, there is no offense.

original: spang par gyur te gzhan byin pa'i tshe bdag gi bar sems pa med pas ltung ba byang bar 'gyur ba la'ang bya'o //
analyzed: spang par gyur te gzhan byin pa'i tshe bdag gi bar sems pa med pas ltung ba byang bar 'gyur ba la'ang bya'o //
translated: If one becomes a monk and another gives it to one, then if one does not think, “It is mine,” the downfall is purified.

original: rang bzhin las nyams pa yang ngo //
analyzed: rang bzhin las nyams pa yang ngo //
translated: Also, if one’s vows have deteriorated, one should consecrate it.

original: gos shig gsar du 'ongs te rnyed na zhag brgyad dgu'i bar du sngags kyis ma thebs pa las /
analyzed: gos shig gsar du 'ongs te rnyed na zhag brgyad dgu'i bar du sngags kyis ma thebs pa las /
translated: If one obtains a new robe, one should consecrate it with the mantra within eight or nine days.

original: dge slong smyos na zhag du lon kyang rung spang ba'i ltung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong smyos na zhag du lon kyang rung spang ba'i ltung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If a monk becomes insane, then even if he has kept the robe for many days, there is no offense.

original: nam dran pa nas zhag bcu tshun chad du sngags gdab /
analyzed: nam dran pa nas zhag bcu tshun chad du sngags gdab /
translated: From the time he regains his senses, he should consecrate the robe with the mantra within ten days.

original: 'di yod pa las gzhan yang 'di lta bu'i dngos po skyes so //
analyzed: 'di yod pa las gzhan yang 'di lta bu'i dngos po skyes so //
translated: “I have this, and in addition, such and such an item has come into my possession.”

original: gos shig rnyed na sngags kyis ma btab ste spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur na gos spang bar gyur pa de rnyed tshun chad gos gzhan rnyed do cog spang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gos shig rnyed na sngags kyis ma btab ste spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur na gos spang bar gyur pa de rnyed tshun chad gos gzhan rnyed do cog spang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one obtains a robe and does not consecrate it with the mantra, one commits an offense. If one discards the robe, then from the time one discards it, one commits an offense for every robe one obtains.

original: lhan cig tu skyes pa zhag bdun pa yang ngo //
analyzed: lhan cig tu skyes pa zhag bdun pa yang ngo //
translated: The medicine that is taken together with food is also like this.

original: zhag bdun pa'i sman du gtogs pa rnams kyang gang yang rung snga ma rnyed ba spangs par gyur na de tshun chad rnyed pa kun kyang spang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhag bdun pa'i sman du gtogs pa rnams kyang gang yang rung snga ma rnyed ba spangs par gyur na de tshun chad rnyed pa kun kyang spang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one has obtained the medicine that is taken for seven days, and then discards it, then from that time on, whatever one obtains is discarded.

original: rigs tha dad pa ni ma gtogs so //
analyzed: rigs tha dad pa ni ma gtogs so //
translated: But this does not apply to medicine of a different type.

original: spang ba de'i ltung ba yod bzhin du yo byad tsam yang bdag gir byas pa'o //🔽gos rnyed pa sna gcig spang ba'i ltung bar gyur na de rnyed tshun chad gos gzhan ci rnyed pa kun spang dgos pa ni sngags mi 'chags pa lhan pa'am skud pa tsam yan @89a * //
analyzed: spang ba de'i ltung ba yod bzhin du yo byad tsam yang bdag gir byas pa'o // gos rnyed pa sna gcig spang ba'i ltung bar gyur na de rnyed tshun chad gos gzhan ci rnyed pa kun spang dgos pa ni sngags mi 'chags pa lhan pa'am skud pa tsam yan @89a * //
translated: If one has committed the downfall of keeping the articles of a renunciant while one’s downfalls still exist, one must discard them.🔽If one has committed the downfall of keeping a single article of clothing, then from that time on, whatever other articles of clothing one obtains must be discarded.

original: chad kyang spang dgos so //
analyzed: chad kyang spang dgos so //
translated: One must discard even a single mantra-blessed thread or a piece of cloth.

original: de las chung ba'i dum bu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de las chung ba'i dum bu ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not a piece smaller than that.

original: gos shig rnyed na sngags gdab dgos pa ni khru gang 'khor ba yan chad cig las sngags kyis ma btab na spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gos shig rnyed na sngags gdab dgos pa ni khru gang 'khor ba yan chad cig las sngags kyis ma btab na spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur /
translated: If one obtains a piece of cloth, one must recite the mantra over it. If it is one cubit or larger, if one does not recite the mantra over it, one commits a downfall.

original: khru gang man chad la ni sngags kyis gdab mi dgos /
analyzed: khru gang man chad la ni sngags kyis gdab mi dgos /
translated: But if it is less than a cubit, it need not be consecrated with the mantra.

original: dge 'dun gyi yang ngo //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi yang ngo //
translated: It is the same for the Saṅgha.

original: phyogs bcu'i dge 'dun gyi dkor yang rung ngo //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i dge 'dun gyi dkor yang rung ngo //
translated: It is also the same for the property of the Saṅgha of the ten directions.

original: mtshams gcig gi dge 'dun gyi dkor yang rung bdag gi chos gos gsum gyi gor brnyas te sngags kyis btab pa las bral na'ang ltung bar 'gyur te phyogs bcu'i ni spang du mi dbang /
analyzed: mtshams gcig gi dge 'dun gyi dkor yang rung bdag gi chos gos gsum gyi gor brnyas te sngags kyis btab pa las bral na'ang ltung bar 'gyur te phyogs bcu'i ni spang du mi dbang /
translated: If one sells the value of one’s own three robes and then separates from the consecrated article, one commits an offense. But it is not possible to give up the property of the Saṅgha of the ten directions.

original: mtshams gcig gi spang dgos /
analyzed: mtshams gcig gi spang dgos /
translated: One must give up the property of the Saṅgha of a single region.

original: mi bdog pa de ni 'dir gtso bo'o //
analyzed: mi bdog pa de ni 'dir gtso bo'o //
translated: Not having any property is the most important thing here.

original: gos shig rnyed de spang ba'i ltung bar gyur pa las gos de rkun pos khyer ram chus khyer ram med par gyur na spang ni mi dgos ltung ba ni mthol dgos so //
analyzed: gos shig rnyed de spang ba'i ltung bar gyur pa las gos de rkun pos khyer ram chus khyer ram med par gyur na spang ni mi dgos ltung ba ni mthol dgos so //
translated: If one finds a piece of cloth and then commits the offense of separation from the consecrated article, but then the cloth is stolen, carried off by water, or lost, one need not give it up, but one must confess the offense.

original: brubs pa bting ba na 'di gsum ni ma yin no //
analyzed: brubs pa bting ba na 'di gsum ni ma yin no //
translated: When one is spreading out the mat, these three are not the case.

original: tshul nas byung ste brubs pa bting na 'chang ba dang bral ba dang 'jog pa gsum gyi ltung ba med de gnang ngo //
analyzed: tshul nas byung ste brubs pa bting na 'chang ba dang bral ba dang 'jog pa gsum gyi ltung ba med de gnang ngo //
translated: If one spreads out the mat after leaving the proper region, there is no offense of separation from the consecrated article, nor of keeping it, nor of storing it. It is permitted.

original: 'di yan chad ni 'chang ba dang 'bral ba 'jog pa gsum gyi rtsis mgo 'dra ste 'di yan chad spyir 'chad do //
analyzed: 'di yan chad ni 'chang ba dang 'bral ba 'jog pa gsum gyi rtsis mgo 'dra ste 'di yan chad spyir 'chad do //
translated: Up to this point, the three topics of keeping, separation, and relinquishment are similar in calculation.

original: bdag gi yod bzhin du zhag bcu 'das na'o //
analyzed: bdag gi yod bzhin du zhag bcu 'das na'o //
translated: If one keeps it beyond ten days while one’s own robes are present,

original: bdag gis gos shig rnyed de lhag par 'chang na sngags kyis ma btab par zhag bcu tshun chad dbang ngo /
analyzed: bdag gis gos shig rnyed de lhag par 'chang na sngags kyis ma btab par zhag bcu tshun chad dbang ngo /
translated: if one obtains a robe and keeps it beyond ten days without reciting a mantra, one has a fault.

original: bcu las 'das na spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bcu las 'das na spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one keeps it beyond ten days, it is a downfall.

original: pha rol gyi thog ma'o //
analyzed: pha rol gyi thog ma'o //
translated: The other is the beginning.

original: zhag bcu 'das na spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur pa ni zhag bcu gcig gi skya rengs dang po 'das nas spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhag bcu 'das na spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur pa ni zhag bcu gcig gi skya rengs dang po 'das nas spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one keeps it beyond ten days, it is a downfall. If the first dawn of the eleventh day has passed, it is a downfall.🔽It is in regard to robes.

original: gos la'o // 'chang ba'i spang ba ni lhag ma'i gos kyang yin pa dang / tshad kyi mtha' ni 'khor gsum yog pa'o //
analyzed: gos la'o // 'chang ba'i spang ba ni lhag ma'i gos kyang yin pa dang / tshad kyi mtha' ni 'khor gsum yog pa'o //
translated: The relinquishment of keeping is also the relinquishment of extra robes. The limit of the measure is the three cycles complete.

original: gos de khru gang 'khor ba yod kyang rung 'khor gsum yog pa yang rung /
analyzed: gos de khru gang 'khor ba yod kyang rung 'khor gsum yog pa yang rung /
translated: Even if the robe is one cubit in size, it is still the three cycles complete.

original: de yan chad dang 'khor gsum yog pa'i lte ba man chad pus mo yan chad mdun dang rgyab yog pa la bya ste 'di ni chos gos smad gsum du bsngor rung ba'i tshad /
analyzed: de yan chad dang 'khor gsum yog pa'i lte ba man chad pus mo yan chad mdun dang rgyab yog pa la bya ste 'di ni chos gos smad gsum du bsngor rung ba'i tshad /
translated: The upper part is above the navel and the lower part is below the knees. This is the measure of the lower robe that is suitable to be dyed as the three Dharma robes.

original: bsngo bas ma btab na'o //
analyzed: bsngo bas ma btab na'o //
translated: If it is not dyed.

original: gos lhag ma de sngags kyis kyang ma thebs pa dang yan lag 'di lnga dang ldan na spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gos lhag ma de sngags kyis kyang ma thebs pa dang yan lag 'di lnga dang ldan na spang ba'i ltung bar 'gyur /
translated: If the remaining cloth is not consecrated with the mantra and one possesses these five limbs, it becomes a downfall.

original: btab kyang 'das pa dang bcas na'o //
analyzed: btab kyang 'das pa dang bcas na'o //
translated: If it is consecrated, but one has not completed the consecration.

original: rnyed pa'i gos shig sngags kyis ma thebs te spang ba'i ltung ba yod bzhin du ltung bar @89b gyur pa de tshun chad gos rnyed do cog sngags kyis btab kyang sngags ma chags pa yin te spang dgos so //
analyzed: rnyed pa'i gos shig sngags kyis ma thebs te spang ba'i ltung ba yod bzhin du ltung bar @89b gyur pa de tshun chad gos rnyed do cog sngags kyis btab kyang sngags ma chags pa yin te spang dgos so //
translated: If one has a piece of cloth that has not been consecrated with the mantra and one has a downfall, then even if one consecrates all the cloth one obtains from that time on, it will not be consecrated and must be relinquished.

original: gzhan yod na ma bsngos par bdag gir byas na 'dir ro //
analyzed: gzhan yod na ma bsngos par bdag gir byas na 'dir ro //
translated: If one has other robes, but one makes them one’s own without consecrating them, it is a downfall in this rule.

original: ltung ba yod bzhin du gos phyis ma rnyed pa zhag ma 'das kyang sngags mi 'chags shing spang bar 'gyur ba ni snga ma'i khrin gyi chad pas spang dgos so //🔽'chang ba'i spang ba'o //
analyzed: ltung ba yod bzhin du gos phyis ma rnyed pa zhag ma 'das kyang sngags mi 'chags shing spang bar 'gyur ba ni snga ma'i khrin gyi chad pas spang dgos so // 'chang ba'i spang ba'o //
translated: Even though one does not find a new blanket while one has a downfall and does not pass the night without it, one does not confess the mantra and must give up the old one because of the penalty.🔽The downfall of possessing.

original: 'chang ba spang ba'i ltung ba ste /
analyzed: 'chang ba spang ba'i ltung ba ste /
translated: The downfall of possessing is explained as follows.

original: 'dul ba rnam par 'byed pa'i nang nas 'byung ba'i mdo /
analyzed: 'dul ba rnam par 'byed pa'i nang nas 'byung ba'i mdo /
translated: The summary in the Vinaya Divisions states:

original: // /'bral ba'i spang ba la 'chad de /
analyzed: // /'bral ba'i spang ba la 'chad de /
translated: The downfall of separation is explained as follows.

original: nyes med pa gding ba dang bral ba na'o //
analyzed: nyes med pa gding ba dang bral ba na'o //
translated: There is no fault if one is separated from the blanket.🔽Since it is stated that if one is separated from the three robes that one has designated as one’s own, one commits a downfall, the blanket is also designated as one’s own, because one would doubt whether one has committed a downfall if one is separated from it.

original: chos gos gsum bdag gir bsngos pa las bral na ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes 'byung bas gding ba yang bdag gir bsngos pa yin te bral na ltung bar 'gyur bar the tshom za ba'i phyir bshad pa de gding ba dang bral ba ni ltung bar yang mi 'gyur
analyzed: chos gos gsum bdag gir bsngos pa las bral na ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes 'byung bas gding ba yang bdag gir bsngos pa yin te bral na ltung bar 'gyur bar the tshom za ba'i phyir bshad pa de gding ba dang bral ba ni ltung bar yang mi 'gyur
translated: Therefore, if one is separated from the blanket, one does not commit a downfall.

original: nyes med pa yang med do //
analyzed: nyes med pa yang med do //
translated: There is also no fault.

original: gding ba bzhag ste mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: gding ba bzhag ste mi 'gro'o //
translated: One should not go without the blanket.

original: mdo ltag ma ltar gding ba dang bral na nyes med ces te zhag tu thogs pa'i gnas shig tu 'gro na gding ba bzhag ste mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: mdo ltag ma ltar gding ba dang bral na nyes med ces te zhag tu thogs pa'i gnas shig tu 'gro na gding ba bzhag ste mi 'gro'o //
translated: If one is without the confidence of the sutra, the one who goes to a place where he will stay for a night, having left his bedding, is without fault.

original: bzhag na nyes byas /
analyzed: bzhag na nyes byas /
translated: If he leaves it, there is an offense.

original: de ste de ring phyir 'khor snyam pa med na yang ngo //
analyzed: de ste de ring phyir 'khor snyam pa med na yang ngo //
translated: If he thinks, “I will return today,” there is no offense.

original: gzhig tu 'gros te zhag tu mi thogs par slar 'khor ba'i gdeng yod pa ni gding ba bzhag ste song yang nyes med do //
analyzed: gzhig tu 'gros te zhag tu mi thogs par slar 'khor ba'i gdeng yod pa ni gding ba bzhag ste song yang nyes med do //
translated: If he goes to a place where he will not stay for a night, but will return, and he has the confidence that he will return, then he may leave his bedding and go, and there is no offense.

original: slar 'khor ba'i gdeng med pa las gding ba bzhag na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: slar 'khor ba'i gdeng med pa las gding ba bzhag na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If he has no confidence that he will return, and he leaves his bedding, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: de ltar song ba las dus ma yin pa grub na der de brnyas te gnos shig / mdo ltag ma ltar slar 'khor ba'i gdeng yod de gding ba bzhag ste song ba las chu brug gam dgras chod de rkyen cig byung nas slar ma 'khor na /
analyzed: de ltar song ba las dus ma yin pa grub na der de brnyas te gnos shig / mdo ltag ma ltar slar 'khor ba'i gdeng yod de gding ba bzhag ste song ba las chu brug gam dgras chod de rkyen cig byung nas slar ma 'khor na /
translated: If he goes in that way, and it becomes an untimely period, he should stay there, and if he has the confidence of the sutra that he will return, he may leave his bedding and go. If he does not return because of a flood or because he is stopped by enemies, or some other condition arises,

original: dge 'dun dang grogs po dang khyim pa'i mal stan gag la nyal yang rung gding ba med du mi rung ste gzhan cig las brnyos la nyol cig / dge 'dun dang khyim pa'i mal stan la gding ba med par nyal na nyes byas lci ba /
analyzed: dge 'dun dang grogs po dang khyim pa'i mal stan gag la nyal yang rung gding ba med du mi rung ste gzhan cig las brnyos la nyol cig / dge 'dun dang khyim pa'i mal stan la gding ba med par nyal na nyes byas lci ba /
translated: If you sleep on the bedding of the Sangha or of a layperson without a mat, you commit a serious offense.

original: grogs po'i mal sten la gding ba med par nyal na nyes byas yang ba'o //
analyzed: grogs po'i mal sten la gding ba med par nyal na nyes byas yang ba'o //
translated: If you sleep on the bedding of a friend without a mat, you commit a slight offense.🔽If you cannot find one, you may look for a mat for a long time, but if you do not find one, you should cover yourself with something from above, like a blanket.

original: ma grub na steng nas dgab pa bzhin blta ba la ring du ma logs shig / mdo ltag ma ltar slar 'khor ba'i gdeng yod de song song ba las rkyen cig byung ste slar ma 'khor ba las gding ba brnyar yang ma rnyed na chos gos snam bdun
analyzed: ma grub na steng nas dgab pa bzhin blta ba la ring du ma logs shig / mdo ltag ma ltar slar 'khor ba'i gdeng yod de song song ba las rkyen cig byung ste slar ma 'khor ba las gding ba brnyar yang ma rnyed na chos gos snam bdun
translated: If you have the confidence that you will return, you may go out for a long time, but if you do not return because of some circumstance, you should spread out your seven-strip rain cloak,

original: la zheng du bzhir blta bas @90a * //
analyzed: la zheng du bzhir blta bas @90a * //
translated: which is four cubits wide,

original: te bting la srod dang tho rangs nam gyi sum gnyis kyi bar du bcag pa'am tsog pur 'dug la mi nyal bar kha don bya /
analyzed: te bting la srod dang tho rangs nam gyi sum gnyis kyi bar du bcag pa'am tsog pur 'dug la mi nyal bar kha don bya /
translated: and spend the night sitting cross-legged or kneeling, reciting prayers by mouth, without lying down, for one-and-a-half periods of the night, from dusk until dawn.

original: nam gyi gung gsum cha la'ang mal stan la mthang gis ma reg pa dang chos gos la mi gzan pa'i tshul du bskum ste nyal /
analyzed: nam gyi gung gsum cha la'ang mal stan la mthang gis ma reg pa dang chos gos la mi gzan pa'i tshul du bskum ste nyal /
translated: You should sleep in such a way that you do not lie down on your bed until the last watch of the night and in such a way that you do not touch your Dharma robes.

original: sbyar ma gzhag pa'i mi reg pa'i gnas su dbyar gyi ras chen mi gzhag chos gos sbyar ma gang du bskur dgos par dbyar gyi ras chen yang mi gzhag par bskur /
analyzed: sbyar ma gzhag pa'i mi reg pa'i gnas su dbyar gyi ras chen mi gzhag chos gos sbyar ma gang du bskur dgos par dbyar gyi ras chen yang mi gzhag par bskur /
translated: You should not place your rainy season retreat cloth in a place where you would not place your robes, nor should you send your rainy season retreat cloth to a place where you would not send your robes.🔽You may place your rainy season retreat cloth in a place where it is appropriate to place your three robes, but there is no fault in not doing so.

original: chos gos gsum gang du gzhag par rigs pa'i sar ras chen bzhag kyang nyes med de gang du bzhag pa dang gang du bskur ba'i rigs pa 'og nas 'chad pa yin te mi stor ba'i tshul du gzhag pa la bya /🔽char pa la yang ma yin /
analyzed: chos gos gsum gang du gzhag par rigs pa'i sar ras chen bzhag kyang nyes med de gang du bzhag pa dang gang du bskur ba'i rigs pa 'og nas 'chad pa yin te mi stor ba'i tshul du gzhag pa la bya /🔽char pa la yang ma yin /
translated: You should not place your rainy season retreat cloth in a place where you would not place your robes, nor should you send your rainy season retreat cloth to a place where you would not send your robes.🔽You may place your rainy season retreat cloth in a place where it is appropriate to place your three robes, but there is no fault in not doing so.
